Fit everyone comfortably with enough room for a cooler in between all of us. Sam had her playlist turned up or she would hand over the AUX cord and we could play our tracks as loud as we wanted. The whole experience was incredibly laid back and worry free. I would absolutely recommend Cool bus ATX to anyone that wants to have a great time with a big group in Austin.   On a side note, if it is Sunday, make sure that you buy beer on Saturday because they don't sell it on Sunday before noon.   Thanks again, Sam!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We just got back from an amazing weekend with Cool Bus ATX!! Sam, the owner, is very sweet and accommodating. The bus itself is awesome - lights, music (you can play your own music too!), plenty of seating, very well maintained and clean. Would recommend to everyone. Thanks again Cool Bus ATX!

reviews.author: Tanya R.
reviews.description: You can't go wrong in chosing this company for your tour. David was our guide and he was fabulous. He was very helpful in picking out which vineyards to go to. He did everything possible to ensure we had a great time. Even helped me with getting the best cake ever for a surprise.  You will be very happy!! We will definitely be back! Thanks for everything!!

reviews.author: Anjelah L.
reviews.description: My family and friends booked this tour for my birthday. We had 10 people in the bus and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. Our driver, David was AWESOME!! He had great recommendations and kept us (somewhat) on our schedule! He was a blast! Bus was super roomy and had everything we needed! We will be back and booking with open range again tours again!

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: What a great experience!  The 2 Davids were great. We booked this last minute due to the recent snow/ice storm and they were very flexible. We started at William Chris, headed to Pedernales and ended at Augusta Vin. The 15 passenger van was great for our group of 11. They offered water and took care of checking us in at each winery. David was a complete gentleman and carried all of our purchases and secured them in the van while we enjoyed our time tasting the different wines. He even dropped us off downtown so we would be on time for our dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: I had a driver cancel on me 3 days before my trip. David was so friendly and squeezed in my group through a cancellation he had. He was so nice and really helped us out!!

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: David was extremely instrumental in getting a wine tour pulled together, despite many places being shut down (or car-to-go only) due to the latest covid orders. We enjoyed his friendly banter, nice and clean van, and all of the places we went. Will definitely book with David again.

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: Absolutely gorgeous day out and about with our guide Mark-he even took us to see the bats after three totally different experiences tasting frozen sangria, fine local wines and tasty beer selection which took us back to Germany! Each location they chose for us was better than the next. Thank you so much for taking us out on a Bad Moms Tour ‚Äç

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Excellent company! Highly recommend! They were prompt and so accommodating for our party. Tour driver even went and picked up lunch for us while we were wine tasting. Don't hesitate to use them for your transportation needs!

reviews.author: Amye B.
reviews.description: Do NOT recommend! We booked a tour for 8 people and everything was a mess from the beginning. We were told we would be upgraded to a 15 passenger bus. A 15 passenger VAN showed up with a dent in the side and ripped seats. We were told we could bring coolers. We were only able to fit 8 adults in the van with our two coolers- no way we could've had another person in the van. None of the wineries had been scheduled yet and the ONE we had specifically requested was not available. We had to scramble ourselves to find wineries, in which we were promised everything would be done ahead of time. The meat and cheese tray that was promised was a small tray that was bought during the tour at a convenient store to feed 2 people. Our driver was great, however the owner did not deliver what was promised and we were highly disappointed. There are plenty of companies to choose from, and I would NOT recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Shannon Z.
reviews.description: Open Range tours was perfect for our bachelorette wine tour. David was professional and personable. He cared that we were safe and having fun. Once our tour, extended an extra hour, drew to an end, David even recommended transportation for our evening fun. Would definitely recommend Open Range tours and will contact them for future visits.

reviews.author: Keith H.
reviews.description: Open Range Tours is a great company. We've had the owner, David, several times, and we've never been disappointed. He cares about his clients, and goes out of the way to make sure their experience in the wine country is the best it can be. We've used him so much, that we will never use another company when we're in the region. You can't do any better than Open Range, trust me.

reviews.author: Nicole N.
reviews.description: "Double Pimp D" aka David was absolutely phenomenal.  We had a group of 13 in San Antonio go wine tasting in fberg for the day.  He picked us up from San Antonio, drove us up to Hill Country and around to 3 wineries.  As this was my first Texas wine tour, he did an AMAZING job of helping us select which wineries would be a good fit for the group.  As we had a decent amount of guys with us- he suggest Garrison Brother's Distillery which ended up being a HUGE hit!  He was extremely professional, courteous and just an absolute delight to spend the day with!  He also has a wicked funny sense of humor.  He was also very accommodating and ordered and picked up lunch for us so we could continue to enjoy beautiful Hill Country.  I would use him again in heartbeat and highly, highly recommend him to anyone wanting to enjoy Texas Hill Country!  Thanks David!

reviews.author: B M.
reviews.description: David was very helpful in planning a last minute wine tour. He was attentive in making sure we had a great day! He picked places that were just right for what we wanted. Our driver, Lyn, made the day seamless and easy by being flexible and friendly. I would definitely use them again.

reviews.author: Mike D.
reviews.description: Used David for my wedding at the Lodge and Country Inn Cottages. They had great communication and made the wedding a breeze. Would absolutely recommend them to do a wedding again. Thanks David!

reviews.author: Dustin M.
reviews.description: David is the man! My wife and I had such a great experience. He took us all over wine country. He had great stories and knew all the great places to go. We will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Morgan B.
reviews.description: Awesome experience. D'ann was very helpful and recommend the best wineries in town. JP was a great tour guide. They both went above and beyond to make our experience memorable. Highly recommend Open Range.

reviews.author: Marge B.
reviews.description: I arranged a Girls' Getaway to Fredericksburg, so naturally I wanted to do a wine tour. I contacted several tour companies. D'Ann was extremely responsive and gave me several suggestions of where to go. Since I'm a wine club member at quite a few wineries in the Hill Country, I opted to do a custom tour and made my own reservations. Greg, the owner (and D'Ann's husband) arrived on time and drove us to 3 wineries where we were able to enjoy a nice, relaxing afternoon. Greg was so friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend Open Range Tours...thanks, D'Ann and Greg!!!

reviews.author: Casey F.
reviews.description: D'ann went above and beyond for the tour for my sister's bachelorette party!  There were some general issues with scheduling and logistics that were my fault, but she very kindly fixed everything!  Our driver David was on time, helpful, and a lot of fun.  They know a lot about the wineries and have personal relationships with the owners/managers/tasting staff.  David also went above and beyond by making an extra stop for shopping/pie-indulging and by dropping us off at our dinner restaurant so we didn't have to walk from the visitor center where he picked us up.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: My winery tour with open range was excellent. D'anne took great care of my group. She texted me several times to keep me updated on the tour and even gave me her personal cell number so that I could reach her anytime. Our driver, Bill, was right on time. He was knowledgeable and very friendly. I highly recommend them for your next tour.

reviews.author: Holly P.
reviews.description: We went to Fredericksburg for a girls trip and wanted to spend a day at the distilleries and breweries. David was fantastic to work with planning everything out. I wouldn't have changed any of that part. But, once the day rolled around we were met with a hiccup. The driver, not David like I was anticipating after multiple conversations, arrived in a mustang for 5 of us. Obviously that wasn't going to work so I was offered by the driver only to cancel or reschedule. Our trip was planned around spending our day out and about so cancelling wasn't an option for us. After a phone call to David, we were assured our day wasn't ruined just a bit delayed. The driver left and showed back up with an SUV and away we went. The driver wasn't interactive and she didn't seem to even be having a good day... It happens I get it but come on. Anyway, we made the best of our day and enjoyed ourselves. When we were dropped off, I tried to pay but she said to get with David. No problem but I did have a problem with her then saying that she'd go ahead and take the gratuity and that the standard is 20%. I didn't even know what our total cost was to figure 20% but asking for the gratuity before I even paid for the day was in poor taste. We did go ahead and tip, and well mind you, because that's the kind of people we are. I ended up calling David and finishing out the transaction and once again, he was a pleasure to deal with. Overall, we'll use them again because I appreciated David that much. But, I'll definitely make sure we don't have the same driver. 5 stars for David but 4 stars overall for the above mentioned.

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fianc√© and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

name: Yellow Rose of Texas Wine Tours

reviews.author: Patti A.
reviews.description: Everything was great!  John, the owner was super cool.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: This business is run by a single creep who deceives his clients and thinks he can because it's "his business", even though what was PAID for was denied to us. He is running the business with very unprofessional interactions with his customers and partnering wineries. I would NOT recommend using this company.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I booked Yellow Rose 1 month out and had great communication with John, the owner. He ended up being our driver on our own private bus for a 40th birthday trip with 4 crazy girls. He was at our beck and call and did not complain once. We had 3 wine tour stops and then Luckenbach, and it was soooo fun!  All 3 places were each different than the other which gave us a great variety. Thank you John for a wonderful time!

reviews.author: M W.
reviews.description: Our group had a fabulous day with John at Yellow Rose Wine Tours!! It was so relaxing to sit back and enjoy the day with friends, all while knowing every detail had been taken care of.  This coming from a very "type A" personality is a huge 5 star! We did the "red rose" package, touring 3 wineries and had a few hours in Luckenbach.  John was friendly, fun and a great host. All we had to do is drink wine, visit with friends and enjoy the day! If you are looking for a fun experience, try Yellow Rose! We will be back next year to do it all over again!

reviews.author: Sasha F.
reviews.description: Do not use this "tour"!! It is cheaper to pay the tasting fees and hire your own driver. The owner is greedy and a complete A. We originally had 5 ladies who were going on the tour with us and one backed out. We didn't ask for a private tour and John (who I'm guessing is the owner) didn't tell us until we were already at the first location that he would stop the tour until we paid for a fifth person that wasn't there. No wonder he kept pushing cash, it was a complete rip off. It was either go home after that tour paying $125 a person..Or have two more tours while paying for a person who wasn't there. PS it's about $15 for the wine tastings. ($15x3=$45) It was not worth it. On a positive note, Gary at Hanhe Estates winery was amazing. Highly recommend this guy and his wine.

reviews.author: Michaela S.
reviews.description: A couple friends and I decided to go on the White Rose package and had a blast. We visited 2 wineries, a distillery, and a brewery. Our driver, John, was great. He made our experience in the Hill Country one to remember. He was very friendly and kept us on schedule without making us feel rushed. Overall we had a great day and would definitely book again!

reviews.author: Tiffany K.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with John our driver and Cindy's understanding of the wineries.  John helped us learn more about the area and really did a great job accommodating everyone.  Some of us picked up lunch and we ate it at the Fat Ass winery which I would highly recommend. Water was provided and the options at each winery covered all tastes.

reviews.author: Jordan H.
reviews.description: "Tour" is an awfully strong word. We were picked up and then drove for 45 minutes without our driver, John, saying a word about where we were going or how long it would take to get there. He then picked up 3 other people when it was supposed to be a private tour. He took us to the wineries but never said a word about where to go or what to do. He followed us around at the wineries and sat with us. He was 30 minutes late then forgot what the schedule was supposed to be and tried to keep us at the 2nd winery until 30 minutes after we were supposed to be home. He told us we could pay with cash or card, but he only actually took cash or PayPal, which put some people in a real bind. He hounded us about payment the whole time. It was awful and we will never do it again.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: My husband and I are from the North East Austin area and wanted to get out of town for the weekend to pre celebrate our upcoming one year wedding anniversary. I searched online for fun things to do in the area, and this place was consistently popping up. I took that as a sign!   I was worried because my husband isn't too into wine but he wanted to go! We arrived in mid-afternoon and it was pretty quiet. The restrooms are separate from the tasting room so I went in before we start our tasting, my husband went into the tasting room. The restrooms were clean and nicely decorated. When I joined up with my husband he had struck up a lively conversation with the two dudes behind the counter. No, they weren't two of the three dudes, but they took great care of us during our stay here!   We tried all 6 of their available wines and my husband only disliked two of them. I was impressed because he's sooooo picky. We decided on the Texas Red, and we picked up a bottle to share on-site! We also ordered a cheese and meat tray and were told they would walk it down to us so we could go ahead and start enjoying the scenery of their River Deck!! I was impressed by these guys and their customer service.   The winery has such beautiful scenery. As we move into the fall and winter seasons, this is THE place to have a big glass of wine. My husband and I enjoyed the Texas Red SO much, we bought another bottle to bring home so we can have it on our actual anniversary 10/20/2019.  If you're in the area or looming for something to experience while in San Marcos, go for a visit!

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: Went to pick up my wine club wine today. The girls that work in the tasting room are very friendly and helpful.   I  have been out of town for quite some time, they were kind enough to hold my wine for me  without any issues or drama.   I believe this was my 3rd visit. The girls actually remembered me.   I love their red blend. It is fantastic. I love the environment at this winery. It's very laid back and comfortable. They have a deck that overlooks the river where you can gather and barbecue if you would like.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: I loved my visit here! The prices are unbeatable and the older lady that helped us (I forgot her name - I blame the wine!) was amazing. She was very thorough and knowledgeable. She made my first wine tasting experience very fun. I will definitely visit again if I get the opportunity to. The Port wine was my favorite- I couldn't leave without a bottle. 10/10!

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: Who knew there was a cute winery in San Marcos? We found this on yelp and I love it! We tried each wine, found a couple we liked, and bought a bottle to enjoy there.   I'd we liked the wines, the view was the best part! The winery is on a huge property, with an area over the river to sit and drink your wine. So pretty!

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Really beautiful scenery here, and overall a good experience. We came here after a visit to The Grapevine on our way back into town.   Most of the wines are pretty sweet, which I wasn't surprised by, I think it's generally a Texas wine thing. The woman behind the counter was really friendly with us and was happy to engage and talk about wine. She was very well traveled and knowledgable on many different kinds of wines and not just Three Dudes.   It's dog friendly and kid friendly here. It used to be named Three Dudes and a Dog but I guess they had to drop the The Dog part due to some legality thing.   The wine was a little too expensive... we bought a box and normally places will throw in your tastings for free when you do that, but they charged us for it. It wasn't a huge deal but I was a little surprised when she tacked it on to the bill.

reviews.author: Jill W.
reviews.description: Any event with endless wine and a riverside deck is worth attending. At Three Dudes Winery, the rustic atmosphere is a perfect balance between classy and casual. The wine tasting room is open daily from 12:00-6:00 PM, and their friendly staff make it a fun and relaxing experience.  The guys behind the counter are extremely knowledgeable about each of the house-made wines, and you can sample four for five dollars. Our selections, from sickeningly sweet to normal sweet:  Texas Black Gold. A dessert wine so rich you almost can't finish it by itself. A bite of dark chocolate cuts the sweetness of the wine to make it bearable.  Texas White Zinfandel. Fruity and floral. A little too floral for my taste.  Texas White. This one is a customer favorite with a great balance between sweet and tart. Served chilled, it's light and refreshing.  Texas Red. Smoky and slightly chocolate-y. They say it pairs well with barbeque.  The only downside of the wine tasting is the size of the room. Any more than six people, and it starts to feel crowded. However, the Three Dudes (and their dog) are talking about expanding the space. You can also take a glass outside to the patio or the deck.  I left with a bottle of Texas White and a slight feeling of disappointment: I did not run into three dudes or a dog. But I wouldn't complain if I had to come back a few more times to find them.

reviews.author: Linda V.
reviews.description: In the town of Lockhart a lady recommend  we try this winery since we r exploring the area. It looks small from the road but once on the grounds it is bigger. They have the grapes sent down from the hill country. They have been in business about 12 yrs and do not mass product or sell commercially...yet!. The white wines I thought were better then the reds! They were crisp but not to sweet, the reds were to heavy for my taste! Apparently they have a deck on the river to sip wine on but today they had wedding and reception to prepare for so we couldn't go down there. Certainly worth a visit!

reviews.author: Janet N.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed Three Dudes Winery! I came here for a school project and this was one of the best projects ever!   My favorite wine was the black gold! They give it to you with complimentary dark chocolate! Who doesn't LOVE chocolate?!  I wish the ambiance was a little better because this is one of the only wineries in San Marcos. The seating is nice but it's very limited!   The service was great though! The lady that was serving us was very knowledgeable on the wines and the history of the place. There are obviously better wineries in Texas but you should definitely give five dudes a try if you're in the San Marcos

reviews.author: Lynn R.
reviews.description: Love love love!  We first checked out Three Dudes when my in-laws came to town. I instantly liked the wines, and the vibe. Then... my sweetheart started planning our wedding reception  (the ceremony had been out of state). Bit by bit, I fell in love with this place. It was raining on our first visit, so I hadn't yet  realized how expansive it was.  There are 2 levels of deck that sit right above the river. This provides an amazing view of sunsets and allows a nice breeze. The structure is partially covered, with a stage area (we plugged in and jammed no problem). They have tables to rent, and are super helpful with setup ideas and flexibility.  They provide servers for the wine, and totally allow you to bring your own beers (no kegs). They also offer catering suggestions. You can opt to have them do the clean up or not.  The best part: our gal, Angela! Angie is professional and communicative, but more importantly  (for us anyway), she was nice. She was wonderful in offering suggestions and patient with our changing needs. She's genuinely just a cool chica, and an asset to this backyard treasure.

reviews.author: Kaether C.
reviews.description: Let me start off by saying, anything to do with wedding planning can be stressful. I am so thankful that the winery helped pretty much do everything for our engagement party, and took away most of the stress.   We had our engagement party here and the package included setup and cleanup, tables, linens, wine, and food from a local bbq restaurant for 50 people. Overall, everything was great! The winery was very helpful and even stopped a meltdown from occurring. I would recommended this place to anyone! The wine was amazing and the location is perfect.

reviews.author: Hannah G.
reviews.description: We love this place.  Angie is amazing great service beautiful location and even better wine.  After visiting we decided to get married here in July, and the staff was amazing all out guest loved the wine to. But I can not speck highly enough of Angie and her team, she worked with us, so helpful and always has a smile even when it started to storm she mar everything still fun smoothly.  We have signed up for the wine club which is also a great price.  It is worth the drive to visit this amazing spot, and drink great wine!

reviews.author: Caroline N.
reviews.description: Love this dog friendly winery. Amazing and unique wines. Really love the white zinfandel and the Texas red. Also loved the clerks. Really friendly, attentive and informative. Will definitely come back again with our pup!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This is a new winery.   Hopefully they have plans to grow their facility and quality of wines.  Now their wines in their tasting list are mostly sweet.  Non-sweet wines are not that good.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: This is a lovely place outside of San Marcos. We had tastes of each of their wines. The woman who served us was very knowledgeable about the wines and the wine-making process. The wines themselves were generally a little sweet for my taste although I enjoyed the Merlot quite a bit. They also have a nice port. The river deck is nice, buy a glass of wine or a wine slushy and sit and enjoying life.

reviews.author: Holly W.
reviews.description: This winery is so great! It's has a rustic country feel and overlooks the San Marcos river. It's picturesque and is a great venue for a intimate party or wedding.   Now let's talk about the wine. No it hasn't been aged for decades but it suits the down home Texas atmosphere and the service there is outstanding. The Cabernet is dry and light and the Chenin Blanc is refreshing with notes of pear and green apple. They also have frozen wine daiquiris perfect for a hot Texas day!   If you swing by I hope you get Angie to help with the tasting or general service. She captures the sweet southern charm of Texas and knows her wine like the back of her hand. I would recommend this winery to anyone. It's reasonably priced, fun and a great overall experience.

reviews.author: Dwayne S.
reviews.description: Alyse was fantastic!!  What a great line-up of wine and even better customer service!  Great frozen Bellini for the patio too!  We will be back!!   Ask for Alyse!

reviews.author: Rachael C.
reviews.description: My husband and I stopped in to three dudes on our 5 year anniversary. We were hoping to stay and enjoy a leisurely bottle of wine since the weather was nice and the winery has a lower deck that looks out onto the river.  We graduated from Texas State and have spent many afternoons at wineries around the hill country, and this area is near and dear to us. Unfortunately, our experience at three dudes left us both with a bitter taste. The lady who was conducting the tasting wasn't very friendly and even though we tried to engage her in conversation she just gave short answers that left no more room for discussion. She then told us that they were holding a wedding at the venue and that we weren't allowed on the upper deck and could only go to the lower deck. This could have been conveyed in a friendly way - the upper deck is reserved for the wedding, but check out our lower deck, there's a great view of the river! Or something like that. Anything other than just flat out telling paying customers that they were too busy to serve us wine on the upper deck.  To sum it up: we were so thrown off by how unfriendly she was, we just left, and likely won't be back.  They do have good peach bellinis though and the Cabernet is decent

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: We went to Three Dudes for a wedding reception on a day that was too hot to be outside. Despite the heat i thing everyone had a great time. They have a wonderful covered deck like area and a lower deck a little closer to the river.   The wines were good. The port was surprising, it was a big hit that night. There's enough space and areas that people could spread out and have a good time with out being too far away. They have a little stage were two bands played.   I never saw A dude, let alone three. There were two women serving the wine, Alex and Dara, who were pretty awesome. Super nice girls, helpful to the newbies and a pleasure to chat with. They did a great job all night despite the horrid heat. The manager was always around to keep things running smoothly. Super nice lady, Angie.   -100 imaginary stars for the heat but that's on Texas, not the winery.

reviews.author: Bonny F.
reviews.description: Had such a great time on the patio with a bottle of Texas Red tonight. Angie and Michael are fantastic and make it feel like home. This is definitely our favorite winery in all of central TX to hang out at on a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Nicholas A.
reviews.description: This winery is a hidden gem! We enjoyed our tasting at the main building and then took a bottle down to the deck to relax while looking over the San Marcos river. Excellent service and great wines!

reviews.author: Natalia L.
reviews.description: What an incredible winery  with such knowledgeable personable staff. Located on such an extraordinary piece of land. Me and my husband each did a wine  flight and picked our favorite sips and ordered a glass each which we enjoyed on the fabulous patio.  I love that with every flight purchase included is a souvenir wine  glass. Flights and by the glass were very reasonable given the type of wine  served.  We ended up enjoying our time so much that we came back an additional day.  I highly recommend this place to anyone looking to sip on some delicious wine .

reviews.author: Shirley R.
reviews.description: This place is so beautiful! Heads up though, make sure you make rezzies for the tastings, we didn't and were unable to since they were fully booked that day.  However, do not fret if you didn't, because the grounds are stunning. You can order a glass or a bottle, no judgment ;), from their double decker bus, that gave me some serious harry potter vibes. Then take it and enjoy the view. There is ample sitting. I would love to come back with reservations of course, and try a flight in their beautiful tasting room.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: Had such a wonderful time here, we went on Tuesday via reservation and were the only ones there until noon. Plenty of outdoor space to social distance along with animals to interact with: donkies, goats and miniature horses! A decent selection of wines with one standing out in particular to our taste-buds, can't remember the name specifically but it was red wine cherry blend, maybe seasonal?   The staff is friendly, place was very easy to find, there is a bit of construction going on in and around the place but it's not too big of an annoyance to take away from the overall great experience.

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: I truly enjoyed my visit to Wimberley Valley Winery. This was the first stop on my wine tour for my anniversary weekend. The tasting reservation process was pretty easy. The tasting price is very fair (5 glasses for $18) and the pours were generous. The wines were very good. I left with a couple of bottles. I definitely recommend the Christmas Cuve√© and the Sangria wine. Once you finish your tasting, there is plenty of space outside on the patio or other areas to just sip more wine and just be.  A lovely experience.

reviews.author: Kasper L.
reviews.description: This is a cool place! I'm glad I had the opportunity to visit here. I'd like to come back and try the tasting.   The outdoor seating area was nice and very spacious. I did like the outdoor patio and the arrangement of all the things. I enjoyed the red wines that they had. I really liked the season fruit wines--tasted like juice with how fruity they were (I mean that in a good way).   The food truck also served some pretty solid food. Really enjoyed the chili and cheese tator tots. The pizza was good too! The burger was a little disappointing though.   All in all, nice place to visit! Come check it out!

reviews.author: Kelli N.
reviews.description: Visited this winery today and enjoyed everything about it! The wines were better than expected and the ambiance was terrific. What I really didn't expect was the fantastic food. Finding something a gluten free vegetarian could safely eat and enjoy was beyond my expectations but wow did they surprise. Best gluten free veggie I've ever had! Lovely afternoon here, we'll definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: I was looking for something Covid safe to do outside and to get out of the house. This winery has plenty of space on the grounds to distance safely from others. We made a reservation for a tasting. Well worth it to learn about the types of wine. The staff is knowledgeable and nice. It is a comfortable environment and you can ask many questions. After the tasting we ordered a glass each and went outside. We ordered a pizza from the mobile kitchen. It was wonderful!  I suggest going on a beautiful day and enjoy wine, good food and sunshine!

reviews.author: Eric W.
reviews.description: We went wine tasting with a group of 5. The collection was big and the server was very inquisitive, informative, and kind. After our hour of tasting 5 wines, we bought two bottles and went out to the property to enjoy the day and the live music. We had a perfect spot beside the musicians (who were very very good) and had an amazing view of the property. I was at peace with all the elements in place. I will be back, bringing family, and enjoying a bottle here and there.

reviews.author: Mahwish S.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this winery. I loved it the first time and it left an impression on me to go back. Because of Covid, they are doing tastings by reservations only so that they can control number of people and properly space out in their tasting room. I'm sure you'll love a bottle to buy and you'll have ample time and space to enjoy it on their deck or yard after your tasting. Our tasting guide, Robert, was very knowledgeable about the different wines and a joy to converse with! They do have a good truck on their premises that bakes wood fire pizzas. I didn't try any this time because we already had brunch before coming. The port was my favorite wine. You've got to try it for yourself!

reviews.author: Gloria G.
reviews.description: This place is beautiful. Our first time in wimberly. We had such a great time, so peaceful. The live music was great. She kept it PG for the babies. The manager was walking around greeting everyone. The employees gave us suggestions on where to stay. Over all great experience.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Made a rez (required) a day in advance and was prompted seated for my 45min tasting! I decided to go with 5 TX wines to try, and they did not disappoint! My server gave super generous pours and timed it accordingly. Because I'm a slow drinking, I had the last 2 to enjoy in the spacious courtyard area. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Brittany D.
reviews.description: What a great find!! I recommend the wine slushies! Watermelon was my favorite however the red reserve one was not bad either (more dry). They have a food truck on-site which has delicious thin crust woodfire pizza. We got the Lexus of Lactose. Atmosphere was great and relaxing. Definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: We just moved to the area and recently took our out of town guests to this charming winery...what a treat! The wine was pretty good ( i mean it's not Napa, y'all) but the ambiance, scenery and people are amazing! The tasting was very reasonably priced and the tasting room is full of gorgeous local art. The grounds are stunning with mini horses to pet and love on and plenty of photo ops. Definitely put this place on your Austin wi

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: A year later and Wimberly Valley Winery is just getting better!  Our friends are members here and we joined them to go out and pick up their wine. While we were there we had a tasting.  They now have a full line up of "fruit" wines like Blackberry, Cherry and cinnamon, honey crisp apple, and others. They are on the sweeter side but for me were seriously tasty! I loved the cherry and the blackberry.  However at this time of year it is the mulled wine that truly wins the day for me! If you haven't had mulled wine I suggest you get off your butt, drive the distance, and sample some right now! It is so worth it!  A hearty and loud Ooooh my Goddie toooo Hottie to this wonderful glass of spiced wine that is served hot! It brings flashes of warm fire places, deep snow, thick sweaters and holiday cheer with every sip. It is my absolute favorite!  They are adding more structures to the location, the outside area is a divine place to grab a bottle and just sit and soak up the outdoors while enjoying a good sip with friends, and the inside is a great lush environment of comfy lodge like decor.  It is a great location with good people and a great selection of wines... not only theirs but a plethora of other wines as well. We always enjoy our time here!   One last note.... try the mulled wine! It is the holiday season in a bottle!

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: This place was definitely a one and done. There wasn't anything bad about our visit but there wasn't anything great about it either. They don't even use Texas grapes so these are all from out of state and only a handful are barrel aged. They were basic and not anything special. We came for a tasting so we tried a total of 5 different wines each (10 between the two of us.) They even serve store bought wines here!!! I've NEVER been to a winery that serves what I can buy myself at HEB. They didn't tell you anything about the wines other than "this is dry and fruit forward," no explanation of the grapes used, how long its aged, etc that we've become used to at other wineries. Also the alcohol content must be very low in thier wines, we went on empty stomachs and neither of us felt a thing which is not the case at other wineries we've been to. I'd give it a try if you're in the area, but don't expect much. The grounds are nice and they have a cute double decker bus they converted but for us one visit was plenty.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and we loved it! We'd never done anything like it before, and we were not disappointed! And honestly how often do you see blue wine???

reviews.author: Carly H.
reviews.description: Drinks were good but service was poor. Server Gabriel said we had a bad experience because he works for his ex and that we could leave a review about our "shitty experience" on Yelp. Welllll, here I am. When we walked out we got to speak to the owner and realized our tasting came with a complimentary wine glass that the server didn't provide. Owner brought it out, thankfully. Place is beautiful but had a better experience at other wineries because of service.

reviews.author: Kirsten P.
reviews.description: Nice looking place! Amazing vibes and the patio area is just so cute! I reserved a "table" and when I went in I was very confused. No chairs or tables unless you go in the back (where they don't serve the wine) so we stood at the wine bar waiting for tastings. Wine was delicious and our waitress was so sweet and nice!

reviews.author: Erika S.
reviews.description: Honestly, I'm disappointed in the experience of this place. We saw the reviews of this winery and thought it would be a fun part of our weekend trip, so my three friends and I came in for a wine tasting inside their bar and we were surprised about the snooty service and multiple issues we had. First off, when we were pointed to which bar we'd be tasting at, there was a dirty tissue on the ground that was at our station (which I had kicked away, not wanting to make a fuss out of it). It apparently wasn't cleaned yet before we arrived, so our sommelier wiped it down before placing the menus down. In addition, we were placed right by the exit/entrance door to their storage room where we constantly shuffled away to not block the staff coming in and out.   When she quickly put down some menus and expo markers and asked us to pick 5 wines to try and walked away, she didn't really care to pause and help us with decisions, so I stepped in to help my friends who were less knowledgeable about wines. Throughout our wine tasting process, our sommelier also made really strange comments to us, saying multiple times: "This particular wine is really expensive, so that's why you only get a splash." Not sure why that was necessary to repeatedly state that? It wasn't encouraging us to purchase anything, especially when we weren't enjoying the particular tastes of our wine and she didn't bother helping us give recommendations, other than asking if we had any questions after we already picked our choices. When one of my friends asked about the bathrooms not working, she just curtly answered it was because the pressure gauge was off for the whole place due to the Wells. I understand that's not entirely in their control, but she did not have to respond in a rude way, and unfortunately my friends had to hold their bladders until we got back to our cabin bathroom.  Overall, I recommend people skip the wine tasting indoors and just go straight to the outdoor patios to check out the cute red bus that has the express wine bar service. The person in there seemed a lot nicer, and there were places we could've sat down and enjoyed the nice weather, instead of standing the whole time interacting with our rude sommelier indoors.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places EVER!  I'm a member so I go as often as I can, their member benefits are amazing. My niece and nephew love taking carrots for the horses and donkeys and kicking the soccer ball around. The venue is just beautiful and even when their are tons of people there it just doesn't feel crowded, the layout is perfect.    The wine is top notch. I  like sweeter wines so most on the menu suits me but they have some dry wine as well for folks who love a dry red or white.  Slushes in the summer, warm spiced wine in the winter, fruit wines in the fall ... this place has it figured out!  Grab a Cheese tray and hang out for an hour or stay all day!

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Winery on the Gruene is the perfect little spot to grab a glass of wine and relax.   If you've been to Gruene you know parking can be a little bit of a nightmare, that is why we love to come to this place since they have their own parking and is also located near the entrance to the town. They have both indoor and outdoor seating, with a cute little garden which is great for photos during spring. They have a decent selection of wines, which you can purchase by the glass or a bottle. If you are hungry, they also have a BBQ food truck but is not always open. Last but no least, if you are parent searching for a changing table, this is not the place for you. We had to change our baby inside our car, which was a little annoying since it was 90+ degrees outside.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: I'm hesitant to call this a winery because they don't grow their grapes however all of these stars are location location location. They're right on the Guadalupe River in downtown historic Gruene TX. If you're having a bridal party, etc. this is an ideal spot with great social distancing and a recently added BBQ Food Truck. I'm not giving it more stars because 1) they're not growing grapes and 2) I'm really not impressed with their products BUT I don't like sweet wines which they specialize in from the looks of their menu. Their service was impeccable and quick and attentive even though it was a busy Saturday. Dog and kid friendly. Cheese and crackers available.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: Love this place.  Great wine and great place to relax. The employees are very friendly. We have a ball every time we come out here.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: I love Winery On The Gruene.  I served tastings here as an employee back in 2014 when I first moved to New Braunfels.  This little gem makes delicious wine and the staff make you feel like family.  I always visit Winery On The Gruene when I return to Texas.  I love the Malbec that they make.

reviews.author: Cheyenne L.
reviews.description: Ughhh. Betsey was the worst. She was so rude. The Chardonnay was awful. Seriously, it's so bad and does not taste like Chardonnay. I gave her a $5 tip on a $5 glass of wine. She poured it in a plastic cup and I asked for a glass. She told me a wine glass would be $2 additional. OK! I just gave you a $100% tip, not happening.  Only reason this place is getting an additional star is bc the hostess was sweet. Don't waste your time on this place, it's crap. Also, be prepared to wear a mask and not get good service.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Recall when I said I had reviews in my drafts? Ughs, this one is from 2018 (don't judge me).   Winery on the Gruene is a small 'boutique' style winery that makes vino on the premise. There are a variety of vino's to sample at a reasonable price (4 tastings for only $4.00). If you know what you want and are a true vino drinker like me, you can 'go for it' and just order a glass (Vino Blanco in my case, $5.00 per glass; see my receipt).  The vino selection here is decent and the customer service is even better. The only facet about this location that is not great is the lack of room inside when you go for a tasting. However, if you have time to come here and have a glass of vino while you sit outside and enjoy a nice spring day, you will not be sorry.   Happy Drinking!

reviews.author: Lindsey R.
reviews.description: This has quickly become my go-to spot. The tastings here are 4 for $6 and then $1 each after that-- and you keep the cute glass, what a deal! Pictured is the wine-a-rita, mix your favorite wine with a frozen margarita mix. These wines are seriously delicious. I'm usually not into fruity wines, but these are done right and are amazing. The employees are super friendly and it's a good time every time we go. There's even a bbq food truck in the parking lot if you get hungry!  Dog friendly patio, with some more secluded picnic benches if you'd like. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: What a cute little winery at the end of the street on the corner. They have outside seating and a nice area to sit and hang out. Unfortunately this was not the wine for me. They were sweet and a lot of fruit wines. If this your thing it's great. Otherwise nice staff and great help.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Wow, how have I not written a review about Winery on the Gruene?! It's like my best friend's favorite place to go in Gruene so I've actually been so many times... We've been visiting since they were at the original location down the street like ten years ago in one of the new strip centers on the outskirts of the little village of Gruene! Winery on the Gruene got lucky when this location became available, right in the center of Gruene!  Winery on the Gruene is located just up the hill from Guadalupe River about a block west of Gruene Hall. Great location, easy to find. Lots of room to sit inside or out. There is even space upstairs to sit or rent out for private parties.  All the staff have always been amazing... Thank you! That is always one of the reasons to go back to any business.   Winery on the Gruene is not a vineyard. Most grapes are not from Texas. Maybe not even any. That is my only complaint as I like to keep my wines local, although that is what works for these guys. They are not limited in their creations. They purchase grapes from all across the country to make their wines. They have a large selection on their menu, so you will find something you like. Winery on Gruene specializes in these sweet fruity wines, which is one of the reasons why my bestie LOVE them!  My favorite is Blackberrry Merlot. On my last visit for Tami C.'s birthday surprise, that is all I had... no need to sample, just give me a big full glass and I'll be a happy camper!   Yeah, you  know I'll be back for some of that Blackberry Merlot!

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: Great romantic place with decent tasting prices.  The wine was great and fruity.. my husband and I didn't feel the alcohol until later  but it was a great time.   Staff was very personable and fun to talk to.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: Wine, Food , and atmosphere was good! Social distancing, masks, and friendly people. The BBQ was great and the staff is so sweet! We had the BBQ Mac and Cheese was awesome!

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: Love this area and the wine was delish too!   Beautiful outdoor space tucked right in the corner of town.    Super friendly staff - my lady did not ask about my wine taste. The menu is pretty detailed and you could ask questions. Large selection about 30+ wines.   You purchase 4 wines for $4 and they have cute souvenir wine glasses. And other cute merchandise.   Merlot was my favorite. I didn't buy bc I wasn't sure about getting it home!   Check this place out if you are in the area!

reviews.author: Timothy W.
reviews.description: One and done.  First time visit yesterday day will be our last.  Wine was decent.  Server was lousy with zero personality and no desire to do anything more than ring you up for your purchase.  Told her we were first timers and her response was do you want to do a wine tasting, a glass or a bottle.  Told her 2 glasses.  Which  kind?  How about showing me the menu?  All with a frown and no smile or welcome.  The covered patio was not comfortable or aesthetically pleasing either.  Better places to spend my money in Gruene.

reviews.author: Martie E.
reviews.description: Very friendly and knowledgeable, being very careful about social distancing, and tasting prices very reasonable. We purchased the Sweet Red Memories. We will definitely stop again the next time we are in the Hill Country!

reviews.author: Tamara C.
reviews.description: So my experience was around wine grown on property not this type of  winery where the grapes are imported from other growers then produces different flavors of wine. Very charming staff and was helpful on wine tasting. We choose four wines to taste from their menu and have different emo fave on what we thought of the wine. I must say the tasting serving are healthy pour and provide the opportunity to enjoy a little more of each wine.  For me most of the wine was somewhat sweet and berry tasting as the Merlot wine has a hint of sweet berry. Reminded me of when I was had my first drink of Boonesfarm wine but not that sweet...lol.  Charming with that modern industrial farm decor.  I would come back to just sit on the porch with glass of vino. Cheers.

reviews.author: Melanie U.
reviews.description: Yes to finally finding wine that I like! My best friend comes here frequently and was excited to bring me when I visited for the weekend. I'm not a wine drinker at all, so I only go for the sweet tasting liquids. These fruit wines are so fun and delightful, and they had a great deal on flights ($4/4 samples, $1 for each additional sample). They have indoor and outdoor seating, and service was attentive and helpful. I definitely plan on ordering some wine online!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What yummy fruit infused wines!!! We all took home bottles after our tasting bc they were so good AND so cheap! Plus, the service was amazing.  I do wish they had a bit more space- the tasting area can feel cramped. Feels like they need a bit of an upgrade/refurbish!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Super friendly staff. They offer a wide variety of wine. While this place is cute, quaint, and has awesome customer service, the wine we sampled was too sweet for my taste. We did a sampling and I chose a variety and was not impressed. This is just my palette though. If you're a sweet wine drinker, you will love this place. They do offer cheap tastings and a free glass which is also cool. I say go and see for yourself. Like I said the staff makes it a great experience.

reviews.author: Gage J.
reviews.description: The wine-arita was really good. I recommend the blackberry infused wine for it. I am rating this 3 stars due to the sarcastic worker inside. After witnessing multiple people walking in and out of the place, I followed suit and upon entering the establishment, I was greeted to a yell of, "Go to the window! There is a big sign outside!" Be respectful. I was just following suit trying to do the right thing during this "pandemic".

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Cheap wine!!! $4 wine tastings, great place to sample wine and they serve you well. Friendly staff and tasty wines. Always a great stop while in Gruene.

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: This winery is so beautiful, I could live there.   The views are breathtaking, and the main house is absolutely impressive, I was so impressed with the property I had to explore it further on my own.   They have been operating since 2004 and turned the former residence into a tasting, event and sales space. The sunroom and patio are perfect for enjoying a tasing or a bottle of wine among friends.   I actually sampled all of the wines on my visit to the vineyard, of course my preference is red, but I found many of the whites quite refreshing. Although the pool is no longer used for swimming, it makes an excellent backdrop, stop in and set a spell! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: Beautiful location next to an Italian restaurant (they aren't affiliated). We got food from them and ate at a picnic table outside the winery. We tried two whites and a red, fairly inexpensive for a glass of wine. I think I paid $6-$8 per glass.. and they were all delicious! The only struggle is to find a place to sit during a weekend.. took a bit of patience before we got a spot. Dog friendly outside, too :)

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: I'm a huge fan of the property and how much green space they offer and the nibbles offered are quite tasty (especially the truffle fries). I'm not weeping with joy from any of the wines but they're easy enough to drink.  It's particularly lovely for violet crown sunsets, so save it for your last stop if you're making the rounds in this neck of the woods.  They don't have any ice, which I find supremely odd being that it's Texas and they serve white wine! If you want to keep your wine chilled while sitting outside (they've got plenty of gorgeous trees to provide shade but shade is not a wine bucket!) the only way to do so is to drink it real fast while thinking cold thoughts.

reviews.author: Elizabeth D.
reviews.description: Lovely area and great tasting menu. They have lovely picnic tables outside to bring your own snacks or enjoy their pizza or charcuterie boards alongside bought bottles. I just wish they had some music playing it was very quiet like pin drop quiet. I feel as though that might add a more comforting ambience. However we enjoy it very much and the restaurant near by looked spectacular

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: This is a must-stop on your wine tour and where we began ours! The architecture alone is a photographer's paradise and the wine is wonderful.   We were a little disappointed to hear that, as of our visit in May, they weren't doing tastings due to Covid because I do think it can be done safely and would've made for a better experience. Otherwise, you either have to buy a full bottle or multiple bottles if you'd like a well-rounded understanding of their wines. We opted for a blend that we absolutely loved, described on the bottle as a "patchwork quilt of grapes." It was honestly worth every penny--so delicious!   We took our bottle and glasses outside onto the expansive lawn which is just perfect for picnics. They have lots of shaded tables under the old growth trees.   Perhaps for safer tastings they could serve them "beer flight" style with the informational flyer and direct you to sit outdoors so that you can still experience a handful of their wines without breaking the bank? That would make it a 5-star experience for me!

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Duchman is one of my favorites around the area. The winery is simple and small but has an European charm.   I've done the tasting before and also just purchased wine by glass. Both are delightful. Tasting is nice for first timers to explore a variety of wines Duchman produces. Because of the tasting, I was able to find my favorite red and white wine of theirs. And for $10/tasting, it is such a steal!! (Price may have changed. This was based off of 2018). After my first visit, I just opt to get a bottle or glass of my favorite red and sip it on the patio taking in good wine, views, and company.   My friends and I always love to end our Hill Country winery trek at Duchman and drive over to Salt Lick after for good ol Texas BBQ.

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: The winery is beautiful and the wine is ok but we didn't find the staff to be very friendly. We ordered two snacks and both left a lot to be desired. The watermelon was soggy and smooshed up. We tossed whether to bring it back or not, and finally I did. The girl brought me another one which was fresh. Why serve me the nasty one first?? Unfortunately our experience wasn't good.

reviews.author: Peyton M.
reviews.description: My friends and I had the pleasure of doing a wine tasting with Andrea. The wines tended to be lighter which was perfect for a hot Texan day in July! Later, we had a ton of fun chatting with Javier and some other staff while enjoying a bottle of their finest. Very fun time here and the entire property is beautiful!   The wine tasting was $17 per person.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This was actually one of my favorite stops in our Driftwood wine tasting day. This particular winery has outdoor picnics for groups and benches for smaller groups for one to buy a bottle , bring some of your own food and enjoy their wines. During this pandemic time, this is the perfect scenario to drink wine while still practicing social distancing.   They do allow you to use the restroom with mask wearing enforced for you to go inside the building.   Their wine was light and refreshing. We chose  a white wine.   If you go near the end of the day you enjoy a nice sunset followed by lighted trees giving you a Christmas vibe. Up until that day , I never knew that Texas had a winery side like Driftwood but places like Duchman Family Winery proved to me that they do exist and they have really good wine too. Highly recommend you make a stop at this winery.

reviews.author: Ann R.
reviews.description: What a LOVELY VENUE! Absolutely adored our wine!  The staff was knowledgeable.  They aren't doing tastings due to Covid but u can buy a bottle and drink on premises.  We probably would have bought more if we could taste, we usually do.

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Awful. Went here for my 21st birthday celebration with a small group of friends. We were completely respectful and there for a wine tasting and there were rude remarks made about our age and backhanded comments along with nobody taking us seriously or serving us promptly.

reviews.author: Ren D.
reviews.description: Before our visit we were so excited to visit this place. It was a nice place out but if we felt ignored. They really have poor customer service. I had a review but it was taken down by yelp for whatever reason, I was so surprise when from rude employee message me on my yelp apologizing personally, and apparently there was a guy anonymously message me regarding my review to be reposted. Eventually found they are working together and engaging me on whatever conflict they have. Thus, proven that they really have poor customer service , very unprofessional.I wont be surprise if they will ask yelp to take my review down again.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Not doing wine tasting due to COVID while others in the region have all started doing it. Even glass options would be good...but you can only buy bottles. Tried the rose and it was good. Made from locally sourced Sangiovese, which was a nice plus.

reviews.author: Carol B.
reviews.description: Over priced tasting . $17 tasting for very small pours of 6 wines . No water in tasting room. Had to go get it yourself . No crackers or palate cleansers . If it was a free tasting I wouldn't care as much . When I made reservation I was specific about food and was not given accurate info. You are not able to order food or eat during the tasting. Food only available to purchase after tasting was over. Servers poured wine on top of previous tasting . Missed poured twice . Server changed frequently and not consistent. They obviously are not organized to keep track of what wine we should be on . Huge red wine fan( live in Europe for 6 years ) was not a fan of  any of the reds . Surprisingly liked 2 of the whites, Beautiful atmosphere and building . A shame the tasting experience doesn't match . Could be so much better!!

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Nice stop just outside Austin for a wine tasting! The outside setting is very cool, spacious front lawn and some tables/chairs for hanging out. Dropped into this place for a quick wine tasting, consisting of 6 small pours of wine. The whites we tasted were all very smooth, not overly sweet but just the right amount of smooth and dry. Definitely recommend sampling all the whites if you have time, you won't be disappointed!  We didn't go check out Trattoria next door for food, but have been there in the past and pretty good Italian food, pairs well with the winery.  If you come here and the weather is looking good, you can expect a very scenic, picturesque spot to spend some time at!

reviews.author: Afshin D.
reviews.description: I live in California and only an hour away from Napa. I wasn't expecting anything close to what one would experience in Napa. However, I still wasn't fully pleased.   The only way I can imagine that someone would really enjoy it, is to bring your own picnic and use their outdoor seating area. This is of course conditioned on the weather and also whether or not there is gonna be any bachelorette party there during your visit. (We saw two when we visited and they were so loud and they had overtaken all the outdoor seatings)  We tried their tasting. It was only $15 which is relatively cheap. In Napa you pay 2-3x more than that in a good winery. They let you choose your own 5 wines out of their selection or go with their recommendation. The tasting overall was okay, nothing that I disliked and at the same time nothing wowed me. I'm not sure if I'm gonna go back there, but it was worth to try it once.

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: Duchman is a great winery to visit near Austin that makes great wines.  I've recently been on a kick to learn more about and try Texas wines.  I've tried wine from several different Texas wineries in the past couple months (all purchased from wine stores) and Duchman is so far my favorite.  I prefer red wines and my favorite Duchman wines are the Aglianico and Sangiovese. Since the winery is so close to Austin, my husband and I decided to visit.  The grounds are beautiful - the perfect place for a picnic.  I appreciate the precautions they've taken due to COVID-19 too.  You can't go into the building (though they will let you in if you need to use the restroom), so they are set up outside selling wine by the bottle and require everyone to wear a mask.  There is plenty of space to picnic and social distance.  They sell some picnic meals on-site, but we brought pizza from Pieous, bought a bottle of wine, and had a lovely time relaxing at a picnic table in the shade.  I highly recommend visiting Duchman.  I'm happy there is a winery that makes great wines so close to Austin.  Even if you can't do a tasting during COVID-19, it is still worth the drive to drink wine in a pretty setting!

reviews.author: Em L.
reviews.description: My visit was 5 years. I opened of the bottles I got there finally... dammmmmmn! Its so good !  Go ! You won't regret.

reviews.author: Alice R.
reviews.description: Really beautiful property. We wanted to go to Salt Lick and wanted to find some other activities in the area so came here for a tasting before lunch. They do $15 for 6, which is pretty good, and was offering 5% off your total bill for following them on Instagram.   There's some beautiful benches set up outside to go with your glass of wine. It unfortunately seemed to be drought season when we visited so the actual grape plants were pretty bare. Once you step inside, there's a small room where the tastings happen and the shop where they sell bottles and all kinds of souvenirs. There unfortunately wasn't any seating indoors so we had to stand the entire time. If you walk in more, you can see barrels and label making rooms. Wish they had given us more history during our tasting but it was fun nonetheless.   It was pretty easy to get an uber out here from the city but be warned getting an uber out here may take a little while.

reviews.author: Devika D.
reviews.description: Staff was really friendly and explained all the wine choices to us. I went with my friends and we're not wine connoisseurs so that was super helpful. You order by the bottle. The outdoor area was beautiful and tables were all well distanced for covid.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Still amazing as ever. I love their wines and I love sharing them with friends and family. They are always so kind and accommodating and I just love supporting local. A few years ago, my husband and I bottled our own wine wand added labels for our wedding party- it was so fun since we had some bottles of wine with our parents while bottling and were also allowed to bring in snacks and sandwiches.  They have updated their back outside area and allow doggos- yay!

reviews.author: Andres S.
reviews.description: Stopped by for wine tasting for the first time with my wife and Travis helped us out. He made the experience very enjoyable and made us feel very comfortable.. would definitely recommend. Cost/quality was pretty reasonable and just want to praise the service that was provided.. we will definitely make our way back :)

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Very quaint, several seats and small tables. Service very friendly and knowledgeable  Wine and you can bottle and label your own for gifts  Couple things to eat Only one restroom for both genders  Very loud and echoey if you are sensitive.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Very nice staff.  They know the wine very well and are very helpful.  Honestly, the wine is "ok" but, the rest of the experience makes it worthwhile!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: What a gem.   All the wines we tasted were amazing.  And staff (Spring) was super kind and attentive.  Thinking about joining their wine club this was such a chill place.

reviews.author: Ursula F.
reviews.description: This was a great place to try a flight of wines. They make them themselves but with grapes from other places than TX since TX grapes are not so consistent. Our server was Spring and she was very knowledgeable and fun. She helped us have an excellent time there.

reviews.author: Debi L.
reviews.description: This was an awesome place to relax and have a glass of wine after a day traveling the TX backroads.  Would make it a point to stop in whenever I'm in town.

reviews.author: Keyana S.
reviews.description: This was a very nice setting! The people are warm and welcoming. John was our server I believe and he was super knowledgeable and had him pick a few wine flavors for my flight, which were amazing! Got introduced to this lovely place by someone and will definitely be returning soon with my friends!

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Love Love Love Water 2 Wine, New Braunfels.  The wines are yummy, but the staff is what really makes this a favorite.  Brandy, Johnny, and Marty are The Best!  This little wine bar is the perfect spot for friends to gather.   Easy parking in front or in the back.  Wonderful selection of tasty wines.  Fast and friendly service!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: This is a small little winery, but I love it! Super cute and quiet. The wine selection was great. I loved that you could make your own wine labels for special Occasions. I thought that was super cute. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Bethany W.
reviews.description: This is my favorite local wine place. People there are so nice and personable and the wine is always amazing.

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: always a great time here, my happy place! Brandi and Johnny makes you feel at home always!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Free tastings-- need I say more. Good ambiance, knowledgeable and friendly staff, good selection of wine and decent prices. You can create your own wine and customs labels.  No food available, other than the standard chips and crackers; but you can bring in food with you. Definitely worth a stop and taste.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Amazing service. Three free samples. An amazing selection of wines. Adorable gifts to purchase. Very relaxing cozy and comfortable. Downtown location.  I can't add more to what has already been said by previous Yelpers. The staff is still knowledgeable and answers all of your questions with ease. The staff was extremely accommodating.  The server kept moving back and forth, checking on us, pouring wines at other tables, and had a smile on his face.   I had one of his award winning wines.  And, my friend tried a different award winner.  They did not disappoint.  This cute lil gem accommodates the vino aficionado as well as the novice.

reviews.author: Monique L.
reviews.description: We have been going to W2W for years. We love the wine with no sulfates, no nitrates because they make their wines on site. They have all different kinds of wine so you will be able to find something you enjoy, especially since you get some free tasting. We go a least once a month for a date night. Some Saturday nights they have live music. They have a wine club you can join to get bottles at a discount and many more benefits. You should visit if you like wine.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: Thanks for sharing the twin river red with me. My new favorite.  This is the funnest place in to for some great vino, friends and laughs! Love you all, Steve

reviews.author: Greg Z.
reviews.description: Disappointing after trying to go to water 2 wine two other times. We finally made it a day they were open only to be disappointed in the wine. No one in our party of 4 liked any of the samples enough to want a glass.. So we just moved on

reviews.author: Donna S.
