reviews.description: Another fun place to try wine. As a bonus, you can make your own batch and come back in 45 days with friends for a bottling party! What a cool concept!! Great wine and super nice people.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: After I'd stopped in to ensure I had the necessary items for a trip (ie: a few bottles of really awesome wine) at the Water2Wine in Austin... I forgot them at home.  Yep.  That's me.   However, Water 2 Wine in Seguin came to my rescue!   Not only are the folks here really friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make sure you leave happy.   The place is very welcoming and warm, as well.   If we ever take a road trip, I have to admit, this might be stop on the way.  :)

reviews.author: Ruben I.
reviews.description: What a great hole in the wall I. The middle of downtown New Braunfels! Came wine tasting for my mother in laws birthday and enjoyed each wine we tried! There was 5 of us and the first 3 wines we tried were free and let me say, we were smart about it and ended up tasting 15 wines between us 5, each getting a different wine and passing it around each try. I highly recommend the diablo wine! It's a dry red but super super smooth! The whites were all amazing! But the sangria's? #givemeabarrel they both were excellent! I will definitely have to bring my grandma back to wine taste!

reviews.author: Stacy T.
reviews.description: What an amazing, hidden gem near Canyon Lake! First, all the wines are made by natural fermentation (aka natural wine) with organic grapes- this winery is even featured in a Natural Wines book. The owner is so friendly and also has the sweetest dog. The decor is unique, interesting, and definitely sets a mood. The wine is delicious- we had a bottle of the "on-site-only" Lambrusco Pet-Nat, and we bought a couple others to-go. All the local websites were advertising Dry Comal Creek as the only local winery (and I'm sure it's great), but we stumbled upon La Cruz de Comal because Dry Comal closed at 5 and La Cruz was still open until 6pm. We will DEFINITELY be back for more organic, natural wine!

reviews.author: Cici P.
reviews.description: We stopped by on our road trip. Bought 2 bottle to give to family member as a gift. Cost us almost $140 for 2 bottles. So mad when our family members open the paper wrap. The corks on both bottle are soaking wet and cracked. The wines tasted nasty. 1 bottle (supposed to be sweet) taste like nasty medicine. The other one is red wine,  taste like someone opened it for a long time and then put the cork back, we didn't want to drink it anymore even it cost us money. Because it was so nasty. I can't believe it.

reviews.author: Lin N.
reviews.description: They were friendly and have a very sweet dog to hang out with customers. Social distancing was enforced and since there were no other customers when we visited (at the beginning) they allowed us to tour the vineyard. Their wines are amazing.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Charming owner who educated us on his background and special grapes.  We loved the sparkling black Spanish wine and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The wine was very expensive compared to wineries we've frequented on the west and east coastal areas.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: Great place! Lovely winery. You don't need reservations, fun to try different wines and very reasonable price to do so. Love the owner! So personable and interesting.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Great hidden spot in the area.  The tasting room is small but perfectly set up.  They grow their own grapes for the majority of the wine they have available. The sommelier was very knowledgeable but not too stuffy. Great stories about the wine. We brought two young kids and didn't feel out of place. No food available, but able to bring your own.

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Heaven, I'm in Heaven!  Can't say enough good things about this little winery. All wines are "natural". No additives.   The tasting room looks like a little cottage nestled in the French countryside.   The owner/winemaker, Lewis, is a piece of work. One of the most intelligent and yet one of the most obscure and eclectic people I have ever met. A true pleasure to meet and chat with.   Do yourself a favor. Check out the hours and plan to visit this little piece of heaven. You will be thrilled and so glad you did.   I highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Deeah K.
reviews.description: On our hunt to visit a unique winery in the hill country of Texas, we found La Cruz de Comal. When we drove in, right away we noticed the winery's main building and it felt like we were in France. It is an authentic European building, small and cozy and welcoming!  The owner was there to serve his 100% estate grown grapes which boast of no additional acid, sugar or sulfites to his wine. The owner, who is a retired lawyer, Mr. Dickson, calls his wine, "real wine." We tasted four wines and our favorite was the port, it had a smooth and delightful finish. There also is a sweet winery dog who loves to visit with the customers...we had a relaxing time there and would recommend it to anyone who wants to taste "Real wine."

reviews.author: Keyshia J.
reviews.description: I decided to take a trip and visit this place. I researched all the vineyards nearby but this place not only had the highest reviews, it seemed to have a nice scenery. The interior and exterior has french touches to it and you can tell each piece was well thought out.   Now the wine.... my husband and I FELL IN LOVE. At first the prices seemed to be pricey but once you do the wine tasting, you'll know why. The wine is so pure and has so much grace you have to walk out with at least a bottle (we bought three). I like wine but I'll only drink one glass because I get dizzy but when I went hope my husband and I both finished a bottle. The wine here has no sulfites and you can just taste the purity of the grapes.   Pricing: When you buy three wines the tasting fee is waived for one person ($15). The owner gave us a discount so after one wine tasting fee and 3 bottles of wine we paid around $160.   The interior is just lovely here you can just tell each piece in the room was placed there for a reason. The bathroom outside looked very old so I was very hesitant to use it but one you go in it is so cute and was not uncomfortable at all.   So, overall this place was an excellent experience!

reviews.author: Tripp D.
reviews.description: The winery is very nice but the wine is terrible. I have had some wonderful wines all over the states and in other countries. It is very obvious the owner should have stuck to being a lawyer. I understand the all natural thing. But it was awful. I tried to like even one of them or even find something interesting about at least one. With all of the time spent in Napa Valley and in France you would have thought the wines would at least be palatable. The only thing I can figure out is most of the reviewers don't drink wine. And if your thinking about going to see for yourself...I'm being nice in my descriptions.

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: How often those the owner of a great wine pore You a glass ... This the best sweet wine I have ever tasted I will be back.. With my grill, to hang out longer..

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I love everything about this place! It's a hidden gem tucked away in the hills just south of Canyon Lake.  Lewis, the owner, is a former big-time defense attorney in Houston who found his calling to be one with the grapes and wine. Listening to him wax poetically about what he's doing differently at his vineyard gives you insight into what you're about to experience. He's also a hoot!   Instead of using commercial yeast, the wines ferment from wild yeast/bacteria on the grapes and whatever bacteria is in the HillCo air. This gives the wines an obvious farmhouse character (mild funk/horsey, slightly sour). He doesn't filter so the wines are a bit hazy and have some sediment/yeast on the bottom.   Grapes are either grown on-site or purchased from farms in the Hill Country and they don't add sulfites.  If you like traditional wines, you might not enjoy the wines that much but I still think it's worth a visit.  Tasting: $15 for 6 samples Bottles: Range from $25-$60 Times: Tasting room is open on Sat and Sun from 12p-6pm. What we bought: a bottle of Rose.  The tasting room is an adorable limestone building and the vineyard can be seen from the windows.   If you can't make it to the vineyard, Jester King Brewery just started carrying their wines in its taproom! It's a match made in heaven! Wild yeast for everyone!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Such a surprise! Never been a wine connoisseur but you can definitely taste the difference between his wines and others, and worth the extra price tag by comparison to wineries in the area. The place is beautiful and the owner is full of information.

reviews.author: Suzanne M.
reviews.description: So sad! A beautiful intimate winery however the owner is unapproachable and down right rude. The server was knowable about wine however the wine was awful almost undrinkable. Wine tasting cost as much or more than a tasting in Napa. So don't bother making this trip!

reviews.author: Christian M.
reviews.description: This place has the BEST wine I've tasted....period.  The tasting pours were generous and we enjoyed learning about the differences between their preparation methods versus the larger, more commercial vineyards.  I have to assume it's those differences that led to such pleasant flavors.  I've always been a red guy but found the first white I've enjoyed here.  Another first, I could really discern the various ingredients/flavors in each glass of wine, and the reds didn't have that strong bite to them.  I've been to Napa and Senoma, as well as France and Italy, and I just haven't ever enjoyed the taste of wine as much as I did during our trip to this little winery.

reviews.author: Christopher A.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved this place. The owner was such a nice man and you could tell how much pride he took in his work.   The wine was fantastic!!!!! I just left here and I can't wait to get back. I'd give this quaint little place 10 stars if I could.

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: We just left and I'm SO confused... I don't know how our experience can be so different from all the other Yelp reviews. We just parked, shared a tasting and left in about 15 minutes because we felt kind of unwelcome and found the wines to be awful. And we wanted desperately to love this place, because it is GORGEOUS. I'd have been very easy to please to be able to spend time in this beautiful place. But the owner was kind of frosty, barely spoke to us (but was more vocal with others), didn't tell us anything (not even the names) about any of the wines. I complimented him effusively on the place when we first got there and tried to get him to chat during the tasting, but he didn't thaw. I don't know if we made him mad because we chose to share a tasting?? We would've gotten a glass or two once we found a wine we liked. We felt like we weren't wanted, which when you're sitting at the little wine counter right in front of the guy, is really uncomfortable. I could've ignored all that if one of the wines worked for us, but I hate to say it, we thought all 4 were terrible. We drink a lot of wine, not cheap or sweet ones, and none of these tasted like anything we've ever had before. I'm confused that every other reviewer LOVED them and we had such an opposite reaction. We are at a loss for the experience we just had. The winery is so so beautiful though, it rivals CA wineries. So bummed. :(

reviews.author: Marty C.
reviews.description: Go here. The wines are mostly made from grapes grown on the property by a gentleman who has studied wine making in California and France. Tasting is a good value, and the property and tasting room are gorgeous. If you like to taste and talk about fine wine, you will feel right at home. If you don't know much about wine, but want a nice country drive and wines that appeal to a variety of tastes, check it out, too.

reviews.author: Brett B.
reviews.description: One of the most beautiful wineries you will find in Texas! Very well done, it is a must see if you are anywhere close! The owner is a hoot, and the wines are very unique. This is the kind of place you could just sit at all day.

reviews.author: Sandra D.
reviews.description: This is a delicious winery!!  All natural with no sulfites, preservatives, pesticide or added yeast. The wine felt fresh and was a delight!!  We left with three bottles and will be back next time we are in the area. Ryan was there to help out and we found him to be extremely helpful!!

reviews.author: Estie R.
reviews.description: Cute little place, but no shade outside. VERY QUITE, like a library.  Wine is good. Food was ok. Pretzels were chewy.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: As far as I could tell, at the time of writing this review this is the only winery in the immediate area of Seguin. After visiting wineries in Fredericksburg/Hye/Stonewall area, this one falls a little short. The wine itself is okay, but I didn't like it enough to buy a bottle. The building is a little strange, as is the decor inside. There's a lot going on in there. There were tons of kids running around which for a kid-free date weekend sort of dampened the mood for us.  I failed to get her name, but the young woman behind the bar serving was working hard, helped all the customers, and was courteous and friendly - probably the best thing about this place.  All said, we do not regret the visit, but there are definitely areas for this business to improve on.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Big selection of meads. A few nice wines i tried. Mix the blackberry and cran-orange spice. Yum.

reviews.author: Joe I.
reviews.description: What a fabulous winery just 6 miles north of Seguin. A wonderful selection of dry reds, dry whites and very nice sweet wines as well. They also have mead wine. The perfect place for a weekend trip

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Whoa! A winery in Seguin? I had not idea. Met friends here for a surprise birthday get together. The tasting room is quaint with 4-5 tables. Was very shocked to find out they started as a meadery. And very impressed by the mead selection. There was 3 meads on tap, raspberry champagne on tap, and a plethora of wine and meads by the bottle available for tasting or a glass.  They do sell growlers, so you can enjoy the tapped mead and champagne at home. I was impressed with the meads and champagne. I did not try any of the wines.  Beautiful landscaping and large windows, which allow you to look out into the vineyard and at the property.

reviews.author: Cathy P.
reviews.description: They have the best mead and one of the best wines I've ever tasted!!!!  If you like sweet wines (like I do) they have great wines, especially their white wines. They flavors are so complex and have underlying subtle flavors that come out as well.   The meads are really sweet and very smooth.   The wine tastings are 5 tastings for $5 which is an amazing deal. Their selection is somewhat limited so if you go with someone else you practically get to try everything they have.   The only downside is that t is out in the country, and looks a bit shady... But they are expanding so it's starting to look more legit.   If you're ever in Seguin area, I definitely suggest this be one of your stops.

reviews.author: Leon W.
reviews.description: This is a new winery  very organized with a great amount of wines to choose from. There are different activities planned for the upcoming months, check their website.

reviews.author: Yesenia H.
reviews.description: Loved the tastings. Very inexpensive. 5 tastings for $7. The jalape√±o mead had a very overpowering honey taste, I didn't like it. But really liked the Red Lotus and the Blueberry Jasmine Mead. I highly recommend this winery.

reviews.author: Jay T.
reviews.description: Very high priced tastings fee.$30. NO CREDIT towards purchase of $30+ bottles of wine. Place was empty. I wonder why?

reviews.author: Diana B.
reviews.description: If you are looking to escape the city and explore the local wineries this should be a stop on your list! Personable, authentic, great tasting wines and mead wines. Mead wines are based with honey. They offer delicious food and a beautiful property to walk. They will even show you things like fresh picked grapes fermenting from the morning to unbottled wine tastings in their winery.  The couple that runs this winery are amazing and down to earth. I will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Brian P.
reviews.description: Awesome mead and wine! They let us in 20min before close and gave us a full sample and full pours. It was great drinking mead in sequin and the owners were incredibly nice! Highly recomended

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: Great lineup of wines and mead (malomel). It's a lovely family-owned business. The estate wines were very good, and I think the Golden Lotus is very special and would make a lovely gift. I think this would be a great facility to host a celebration of any sort, whether a wedding or a family get together. I am so glad that I stopped by!

reviews.author: Amber M.
reviews.description: We had a great experience at the winery. They had a wonderful line up of wines and meads. Prior to this experience, I was not a fan of meads..their fruit meads  (blackberry and strawberry were my favs) were delicious!! The owner was fantastic and we enjoyed our tasting with her. Next time we are in Seguin, we will definitely be making a return stop to Blue Lotus. Thank you for a great afternoon!

reviews.author: Kristin L.
reviews.description: This place was so much fun! We just left from a bachelorette party and a wonderful time. Mike and Melissa were so sweet, and their girls are ADORABLE! Katlin (she's two) gave me some great recommendations before our dance party :) definitely try this place! They have some delicious and unique wines. I can tell mike has really been mixing and matching to find the perfect flavors! We will definitely go back!

reviews.author: Alyssa R.
reviews.description: Thank y'all so much for the wine tour. Our bachelorette party had a great time!

reviews.author: Debbie J.
reviews.description: We went in for a quick tasting and wanted to try the mead, which was excellent.   The tasting was 5 for $7.  The cranberry orange spice is a must try for the fall season.  Our server was nice, knowledgeable and made good conversation.   We'll definitely go back.  The only recommendation that I would make to the owner is to put chairs at the bar.  The tasting room opened earlier this year so that may already be in the works.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Had an absolutely amazing time visiting here!  The husband and wife team are amazing people with beautiful property.  My girlfriend and I both did a tasting, of which I bought a bottle of the Black Lotus (amazing) and my girlfriend tried both the ports.  She ended up getting a bottle of that.  We also got a bottle of the strawberry mead to drink there on the property.  It was a perfect start to our wonderful valentines weekend we spent in San Antonio.  We will definitely be going back and telling our friends about this wonderful spot!

reviews.author: Lina F.
reviews.description: We came here for my sisters bachelorette weekend! Had an amazing time! :) The harvesting was fun and the grape-stomping was great! I loved the variety of wines - all of us found something we liked. We also devoured the lunch they offered. The spaghetti lunch was amazing and the salad dressing was divine!! We need that recipe! LOL. Thanks for a great visit!

reviews.author: Ted G.
reviews.description: A great winery!  This is a beautiful winery and a great stop if you plan on visiting the other winery nearby or salt lick BBQ. Everyone is exceptionally helpful, they have a very comfortable tasting room, but I felt the tasting was way overpriced, so I decided to just buy a bottle of the Fall Creek Vineyards Tempranillo to drink while the rest of the group had their tasting.   They have an impressive operation and make some wonderful wines, definitely worth the stop. Cheers!

reviews.author: Chica B.
reviews.description: I visited this vineyards Dec 23 in the afternoon.  We were the only one in the winery.  We received good attention from the staff.  The wine tasting was really good.  Got to get one of the bottles for a present and an edged glass to keep.  I plan to visit Texas in a near future and this is one place that I plan to come back again. Wine first and bbq later.  Of all of the wines Mourvedre was our favorite.

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: TLDR: relaxing atmosphere with nice white wines. Good on the spectrum of Texas wines but not on the level of French or Napa wines.  This is a great spot right across the street from salt lick. Parking lot is gravel but there's plenty of parking available. Hostess was extremely friendly and great conversation.  The wines themselves are good- we especially loved the Chardonnay and reserve wines. Based on Texas wineries, I have to say this is hands down one of the better vineyards. That being said, I have a deep love for Russian river valley wines (especially green valley pinots and Chardonnay's) and Texas grapes just don't measure up. Is that an unfair comparison? Probably.  Overall highly recommend visiting and supporting local. You'll want this on your wine tasting list of stops for sure, and best of all it's fairly close to Austin.

reviews.author: Trenna H.
reviews.description: If you're looking to have a nice day trip from Austin, Fall Creek is a great spot.  I love coming out here for a wine tasting and enjoying the outside patio and having the vineyard to explore. The landscape is gorgeous and the staff are so knowledgeable and friendly.  Most importantly, the wine is delicious.    Pro tip- for an additional $8 you can add on an extra tasting of the ExTerra Tempranillo (usually a $100 bottle). It's amazing and a must try.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: The wine was amazing!!! Needless to say, we will be returning on our next trip to Austin. We are huge Cabernet fans and all of the wines were delicious. We took a few bottles home. When we tried the Tempranillo and it swept us off our feet. We have since found some of these wines in our local Houston Spec's.   The facility is clean and the grounds are well kept. The restrooms are also clean!!! Our host was simply amazing and went above and beyond to explain the process and enjoyed the discussion describing the notes we would/did experience. Really enjoyed the entire experience.

reviews.author: Kara G.
reviews.description: Fall Creek Vineyards totally exceeded our expectations! We have been super strict about staying home during COVID-19, but my #1 birthday wish was to get out ... in a safe way. With young children. My husband called Fall Creek ahead of time and was told that kids were allowed and that there was plenty of outdoor space.   We arrived around 2pm on a Wednesday afternoon and were greeted by a super friendly and knowledgeable gentleman. I wish I had grabbed his name, because he was seriously amazing. He let us know that a food purchase was required to be served on premise, which was not a problem at all because everything looked delicious (we chose a cheese platter), and gave us a wine menu as well.   We selected our own seats and were able to stay away from the party that came in after us. Our sommelier was so knowledgeable and provided everything in a COVID-19 safe way. He was also super sweet to our kids, even though our three year old was crushing crackers on the table (we cleaned up after him before we left but it was still so embarrassing).   All of the wines were delicious. We ended up leaving with their Tempranillo, their Sauvignon-blanc (vintners-selection) and two souvenir glasses.   We spent about an hour at Fall Creek, which ended up being the total highlight of my birthday, but could have spent more time there exploring their beautiful grounds  had we not had a dinner reservation.

reviews.author: Gerardo D.
reviews.description: Texas has great wines.  A short drive from Austin (right across from Salt Lick) you can spend a few hours in the vineyard, sit in the patio, or stay inside. Of course, there is wine tasting and a variety of bottles for sale.  Fall Creek makes wines in all price points. From the quite good inexpensive wines to award-winning bottles for people who really know their reds. I am a fan of their Tempranillo.  If you are in Austin, it's worth a visit!

reviews.author: Elise G.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Couldn't recommend this more for a safe way to spend the day with your friends during (and even not during!) Covid.  My mom's in town so I wanted to take her to a winery semi-close to Austin but not too far away. ENTER: Fall Creek. It's been recommended to me by several friends so figured I'd check it out for myself:  PROS: Seriously the nicest staff in the world. Thank you Daniel! Plenty of socially distanced tables and chairs in LOTS of different areas of the winery A bottle of their amazing Sauvignon Blanc - $22! Great snacks to accompany (I got Pimento cheese) They had live music on a Saturday with a full band. swoon! Across the street from Salt Lick if you want foods  CONS: Seriously none. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect day. Can't wait to visit again!   Pro tip: go to Desert Door nearby for more fun. :)

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: FCV at Driftwood is a nice little winery, with seating indoors and out. When we were visiting, there was only one other guest present (midday Tuesday). As a personal recommendation, if you're trying to social distance, I would suggest visiting here only during the weekdays when it's less busy, otherwise it may seem too crowded since the place is on the smaller side.  The food menu mainly consists of cheese and snacks that go well with wine but it's a little overpriced. The staff was nice but they were just there for the most part, nothing more to enhance our experience.   3/5 staff/service 4/5 nicely decorated interior and exterior 5/5 with the right company

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Good stop on your wine tour! We opted for two full glasses of their most standout wines and although it was much more expensive wine than I'm used to, we did get a generous pour. The backyard terrace is peaceful and has many seating options. I would've loved to see an option where you could do a wine tasting outdoors, perhaps the same way you order a beer flight. I saw this because wine tastings are only offered inside.

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: We didn't care for this place that much. The dining/patio area was nice but seemed like some of it was off limits (maybe party rooms). Wine offering was limited. We had a Chardonnay, Tempranillo and a Lescalo. They were just OK but it was the end of our day before heading to Salt Lick so that could have had an impact. One visit here was enough for us.

reviews.author: Me Y.
reviews.description: Entrance is nice yet when you go to the back it needs a little tending. Table tops were messy, landscaping needs a little touch up, I'm hoping it was just a little neglect we might try it again later.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The wine here is really delicious. They are only doing tastings inside. The tasting is a preset menu. You can order a glass and get food outside afterwards. The service is great and our waitress was very friendly and helpful.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: After 3 months of quarantine, two of us ventured out for a bff day of wine and views. Our 2nd stop was Falls Creek....it was so pretty with perfect sunny weather and enough seating inside and out. Covid is still among us so they offer hand santizers but you bring your own mask. Most patrons didn't have on of course once they had their wine in hand.   We opted to sit outdoors. Tables are 3-4 ft apart in some spots so choose within your comfort zone for social distancing. We grabbed a quick glass of wine and made our way to the next stop.   Looking forward to returning with the hubby this summer.

reviews.author: Tina M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our tasting experience here! We will be back. Knowledgeable and gracious, this winery is a must do for anyone in the area that wants an amazing wine tasting experience.

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Went to Fall Creek for a wine tasting prior to dinner at Salt Lick.  We were seated in the indoor patio which was extremely warm.  No water was offered.  We requested the tasting - 5 wines that are pre-selected, you aren't able to choose.  After the second (extremely small) pour, we had to request water.  Decided to order a couple of apps for the group..we were brought store made hummus and pimento cheese - still in the plastic container, propped on a plate with a wrapped package of crackers.  Had to request small plates, which seemed to surprise our server.  By the end of the tasting we were all sweating as the sun was beating down on us and there seemed to be no AC. The wines were okay, but the experience and service could have been much better.  I wouldn't return.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting was $20 for 5 small pours.  Can't select wines to try, only had 5 bottles open and only one was what I would have wanted.  Food prices were also high.  Place was fairly full but I don't know why.  Wines we tasted were fair at best.  Too many good one in the area to waste your time here.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: This vineyard was a delightful second stop on our day drinking in the Driftwood area. The wine picked by my group was light , refreshing and the perfect compliment to have after we had made a lunch stop at a brisket place. We had been feeling stuffed but this wine was so light and enjoyable to help digest our food while we enjoyed their peaceful tranquil outdoor seating area near a cute little pond. We also took advantage of their photo opportunity landscapes.

reviews.author: Mariz V.
reviews.description: I've had my fair share of vineyards from local like Grape Creek in Fredericksburg then to Castello di Amorosa in Napa Valley. I was embarrassed after taking my family to experience the wine tasting here. Although, some of the wine were fairly tasty, but the serving was small compared to the vineyards I mentioned in the beginning. I had never been to a wine tasting with a pour stopper that was new to me. Mind you they charge $20 per person for wine tasting. We were observing a table near us that was getting extra pour from the pour stopper technique. We decided to order 2 cheese plates ($25/plate) that came in this container after we finished it, which was a small portion by the way. We noticed that the container said "Best By: 2/12" we visited 2/13. So we alerted our server she politely checked with the back she was told that it meant Arrived By, which to me was odd. If it was "Arrived By" I think that's what they would've put on the container but I guess just to shut us up.  As to COVID capacity the patio was full we couldn't wait to leave. This is my family and I's experience I wish it could've been better.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Our favorite wine spot in Austin. Their Meritus is a winner every time. Cute and cozy spot, very picturesque and everyone who works here is super nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: E R.
reviews.description: Good pours, tasty rum, a lovely shaded deck to sit out on, and congenial staff. Perfect spot for a quick cocktail or a wind down and a nice chat.

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Great spot to enjoy a drink and relax! We arrived on a Thursday afternoon. Bartender greeted us warmly and talked to us about the rums are made. I appreciated feeling welcomed in spite of the lack of traffic in the out there location. We ordered drinks and sat among the trees on their awesome deck for a bit. My husband bought all three varieties when we left. Worth a visit!

reviews.author: Raymond J.
reviews.description: Been here twice now and really just stopped this time to get their bourbon filled chocolates for my guests on our drive by.  Great place to seat and enjoy the outdoor country view and have a drink.  Sample their Bourbon and have some chocolate filled Bourbon.  Come visit this place when you are near by

reviews.author: Jazz C.
reviews.description: The rum was delicious! The guy behind the bar was so nice and welcoming. It's a great place to relax and enjoy a delicious drink! There's lots of outdoor space perfect for social distancing.

reviews.author: James F.
reviews.description: During a recent car club event, I called Cypress Creek from a restaurant in Wimberley to tell them our arrival was eminent. The lady on the other end of the call was quite nice suggesting they had PLENTY of space for our cars to park.  Well, they weren't wrong. Quite possibly the best photo opportunity of the entire weekend. Our attendees overlooking 24 cars perched in the beautiful trees of Hays County overlooking some of Mazda's genius. Free samples of crafted rum too?   I'd call that a win! Owners were quite attentive as soon as we arrived. Telling us the story of the brand; walking us through each tasting. Some drinks were ordered; maybe a bottle or two bought. Not sure we were the most receptive group being on a car tour in the Hill Country. Service was excellent!

reviews.author: Dolly S.
reviews.description: Such a nice staff.  We were i Impressed by his knowledge.  He was very compliant the tasting was good they serve 3 different varieties we enjoyed the vanilla. The gentleman was very helpful for other things to do in the area.

reviews.author: Dustin C.
reviews.description: Tucked away behind Wimberely mear Jacobs Well stands a small distillery with a small bar and large patio.   They offer free samples of the three different whiskeys with one of them being bourbon barrel aged using Rebecca Creek barrels.   The staff was friendly and well informed on the products. Currently they are distributing to smaller local stores and will start distributing to more stores in the future.   As it is August right now we couldn't tour the distillery because it was too hot but we were informed that the tours would start in October when it cools off.   The bottles are decently priced for hand crafted rum like this.   There are plenty of tables and chairs for groups, drink cocktails were decently priced, and property is a great change from the city.

reviews.author: Rach C.
reviews.description: We made lots of stops in the area and this was by far my favorite! We made it about an hour before they closed and the guy at the bar was so nice and welcoming. The patio area in the trees was beautiful and they had this nice swing. I had the drink with the pineapple and vanilla rum.....sooooo good! It was so good my husband grabbed a bottle so we can drink it at home. If you're touring the area i would recommend coming here early and just enjoying the scenery and the lovely conversation with the guy at the bar!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We found this place on our way to Jacobs well. This place has great drinks and a great atmosphere. The rum is  very good. We did not take the tour, but it is offered. They have a food truck on site. Their mojito was refreshing. They even let me be part of the cocktail making process. The owners were super friendly. For those that want to taste before buying, they offer free rum tastings.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I cant' say enough good things about this place. It is in the middle of Hill Country, and it was our last stop before heading home.   Personally, I'm not a big rum drinker, it is too sweet for me, but it tastes great in mix drinks, and they have some  great and fancy mix drinks here.   Swing by and hang out on their patio, it will be great!

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. Not only do you get to enjoy some very delicious rum, but the scenery is beautiful. My fiance and I really enjoyed getting to hang out on the raised deck and just relax for a little while. The guy at the bar was really polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely come back.

reviews.author: Kelsey D.
reviews.description: Give these hard working folks your money! The rum is delicious, affordable and local. The owner gave us a quick, free tasting so we could decide what kind of rum we wanted in our cocktails. Do yourself a favor and spend an hour or two sitting on the gorgeous upper deck catching the breeze and catching a buzz!

reviews.author: Mallory M.
reviews.description: Family run rum distillery. We visited on a weekday and were the only ones there. Great customer service! If you like rum, then this is definitely worth checking out for a tasting!

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: The vanilla rum is fantastic. Perfect place to spend the afternoon to relax and have a drink. Patio sitting is great. Lots of shade

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest, most quaint little gem.  If there's a local distillery, I always want to try out their goods.  I didn't expect it to be at someone's home, though!  Not that it's a bad thing.  Rum, for me, is a take it or leave it type spirit.  I typically use it only in cocktails.  I don't think I've ever wanted to sit down with a glass of rum.  Now bourbon?  That's a different story.    On arrival, I just expected a tasting only, but they actually make cocktails.  They have a small menu, or you can request whatever you want from the mixers they have.  Mojito?  Of course.  Want to go dive with a great rum and just some Coke?  They won't judge you for that, either.  They make their own version of Rumchata in house and it was SO DELICIOUS.  For real.  And they'll give you the recipe.    Pick your favorite of the three varieties: Crystal, Gold, Vanilla and buy a bottle.  Then pick up a bottle of vanilla extract.  If you don't cook, make your mom very happy.  That stuff is fantastic.  In the hotter months, don't be a jerk and demand a tour of the actual distilling barn.  We all know how distilling works.  If not, the internet is your friend.  They don't want to be in the high temperatures, and neither do you.  Let them explain the process to you while you sip a nice, cool drink instead.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this little gem by accident when we were looking for a winery, it was a happy find! Friendly people, good rum, and a good deck! It was a little expensive and no tours are offered but the tastings are free which is a nice change to the other places we have been.   Make sure you try the vanilla rum and take a turn on the tree swing! My nephew loved it.   Wish they would have more signs.... the first was easy, then we were feeling lost.

reviews.author: Michele G.
reviews.description: The best part of this distillery is the location...a country vibe that is beautiful. Now for the bad news...The rum is a strange flavor. I have been to other rum distilleries and have never stumbled upon such a "harsh" flavor that could never be drank alone. That being written we decided to have a drink on the patio...I'm glad alcohol kills germs because the guy serving us had the dirtiest hands and fingernails I have ever seen in my life and I have children. For example when he grabbed our glasses from the cabinet it left a dirty grip mark. I was pretty much grossed out. It's too bad because again the location is great.

reviews.author: Deji M.
reviews.description: How sweet is David, distiller, maker, and bottler of Cypress Creek Reserve? Let's examine the facts:. -- He led us through a tour of his small but highly functional distillery. -- He answered all of our questions about the process he uses, and even showed us some of the machine parts he's made. -- His wife made us two (nicely sized) tasters: a mojito, and another thing I drank even faster than the mojito that tasted like a lemon drop.  $5 each later, we skipped right down to Wimberley Valley Spirits to get ourselves a bottle, because the law is mean and David can't sell any of the goods on the premises.  Stupid Republicans, or something.  Now we check out our unopened souvenir, plotting and planning, totally giddy that we pulled into that questionable-looking lot with the signage for rum. Who were we to say no?

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: This last Friday I went to the distillery to taste their rum. All three of their rums are VERY tasty. I purchased a bottle of the aged rum. The owner's daughter-in-law (I can't remember her name) was very friendly and very knowledgeable on the rum. She made the tasting fun, and I highly recommend anyone in area to go visit. I know I'll be back!

reviews.author: Ali E.
reviews.description: Love the vanilla rum! Make a side trip on the way home from Stonewall to pick up a bottle!

reviews.author: Hilda S.
reviews.description: The views are breathtaking, the wines are fantastic and staff are very friendly. From the whites to ros√© and reds, the wines are delightful. Likes them so much that I became a wine club member. Looking forward to returning and introducing friends to this winery.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: New winery, family owned and run. Limited selection of tasting to 3 that were made of Texas plains grapes but they were all good wines. The biggest attraction, which will guarantee they'll be successful is the view and gorgeous setting. They put a large deck on the hill so you can enjoy your wine while looking out at the vineyard.

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Wonderful place with some great wines! The staff was delightful and friendly. The place wasn't too crowded but they just opened in November and I think people are going to be learning about this place and packing it out very soon!   They grow grapes on the property but all the wine I had was outsourced since their weren't ready yet. They had three wines to try (white, rose and red) but will be having six very soon as their home grown grapes are about ready. I enjoy dry, less sweet wines and these were perfect. Highly encourage you to put this spot on your wine tours of Wimberly! They also have some snacks/small bites if you are hungry.

reviews.author: Linda A.
reviews.description: This is a "Hidden Gem"!!! What a wonderful winery!!! We went relatively early to avoid any crowd and the staff were welcoming and informative.  They now have 4 wines and all of them were delicious. I'm not a sweet wine drinker and gratefully none of them were sweet. One crisp white, 2 ros√©s and a red. We left with a bottle of the red and one of the ros√©s too. The property and views are beautiful. They have two decks with tables and umbrellas to relax and enjoy the wine, the views, the weather and a fabulous charcuterie platter. It is a bit tricky getting there BUT it is well worth it. Don't miss this delightful vineyard!

reviews.author: Kaitlin Z.
reviews.description: Owners were very welcoming and friendly. Wine was great and snacks were so tasty! They had fun games and beautiful places to hang out on the property. Definitely will return.

reviews.author: Magdalena T.
reviews.description: This was our first winery ever. 8 years ago. Joseph did fantastic today. So good to be back and become members.

reviews.author: Shelly G.
reviews.description: Very rude customer service. We were the first customers of the day and they had no desire to serve us. They are an outdoor only venue which is totally fine but don't have any outdoor heating yet they have a huge firepit that they wouldn't start. Then our friend showed up with their 4 year old and wouldn't let them come in. So not kid friendly, bad customer service and no outdoor heating.

reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: We came here for our first wine tasting, at this spot. The service is amazing. The people, Joseph and Jane made us feel  wet welcome and comfortable. Out of the five wines we tasted, we only liked one wine. But that's ok, we will always keep our tastebuds open for you! The environment is incredible. Beautiful oak trees, beautiful building, bathroom was clean and nice. Had a great experience, $20 each for a wine tasting? Yes! Sooooo worth it. Live music and great food trucks!

reviews.author: D C.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  It was a beautiful day in a beautiful setting. The wines we tasted were all good.  The tasting was slow and even paced.  We bought a charcuterie plate to nosh on and it lasted through all 6 wines.  It was one of the more enjoyable tastings I've ever done.  I would definitely come back.

reviews.author: Matou≈° P.
reviews.description: First time here, but definitely will not be our last!  Lovely outdoor space, plenty of room to space out, great covid protocol. Friendly staff, dog friendly, and some unique and very tasty wines.   After our tasting on the patio, we moved to a nice table in the yard, each had a glass of wine (they recorked the left over), and enjoyed a nice sweet crepe from the food trailer.    We will be back.

reviews.author: Stacy B.
reviews.description: Totally chill relaxing place to enjoy some wine with friends.  Nestled back among the oak trees off 46, this place is a little gem.  Patio has a view of the vineyard, and when the weather cools off there is nothing better than sitting under the trees enjoying the fire pits. Community tables make for great conversation and an easy way to meet people when new to the area. Check Facebook for date nights and various events. To really get the feel for this spot, it's best to go when there is a band and food trucks.   Experienced friendly staff really make this place stand out. I don't know much about wine so staff was great about helping me select an excellent "Wurst Red" wine. This place probably deserves a 5 star for good time, but I lowered it to 4 since seating indoors is limited.   And chairs on the patio are not very comfortable. I will certainly update my review if changes are made. Would love to see some comfy coffee house style couches indoors to make it more comfortable.   Pro Tip:  Order the red or white frozen sangria. It is the BOMB!!  Tastes like a fruit slushy in the most delicious way.

reviews.author: AA P.
reviews.description: We liked every single wine on the tasting list and took home two bottles that were not on he list.  They offered for us to try the two bottles we selected before we purchased them which was excellent customer service, above and beyond.   The staff was pleasant, had a sense of humor and were quick to accommodate guests to keep them dry and happy when a wild rain storm blew in.  We made reservations to return at the end of the summer when their wine list changes, they gave us lots of information!  Lots of outdoor space and a great ambiance.   Very enjoyable afternoon.

reviews.author: Joseph G.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem. Shiela is awesome and very nice all the time! Try their wine tasting, my wife and I enjoy it every time we go. Make sure you make a reservation.

reviews.author: Taylor B.
reviews.description: I wish I could give Dry Comal Creek Vineyards over five stars. The wine was incredible, the patio seating was spacious, and the staff was VERY friendly and helpful. We didn't realize we needed a reservation until after we arrived, but the sweet lady at the entrance helped us make a reservation so we could get seated. The outdoor seating was very spread out, and there was a lot of shade from all the large trees. Our server helped us choose a bottle, and brought us any sample we wanted before purchasing a bottle. The wine was so good we left with a couple bottles to bring home. The pricing is very affordable ($20-$30 a bottle). I would highly recommend visiting this gem near New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Katelyn J.
reviews.description: I love this winery, but I'm a little in shock after being kicked out because I had a 10 week old baby with me. We were there for an hour, then we were told we had to leave because kids aren't allowed. I totally understand a child who can run around, but this was a nursing baby. Underneath a blanket. The winery wasn't enforcing their mask rule, but doesn't allow newborns.

reviews.author: Dellaney W.
reviews.description: Had a great experience at this winery. Everyone was so friendly and laid back. The grounds are beautiful, there was a BBQ food truck the day we went which was delicious as well as a great singer there for entertainment. Don't pass this place up.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Nice but pricey  Wish there were more comfy places to sit inside for a very very hot summer day Outside there are vast areas to choose from to sit and relax   Love the fire pits scattered around one side with chairs .  Vineyards were on the other  Good for private gatherings  Wine was not cheap but it was good It's not from the grapes they currently grew but their own brand   Took a quick video at Yelp check in

reviews.author: Natalie C.
reviews.description: My experience was amazing! Joseph was such a great server. He took pictures of me and my boyfriend, was easy to talk to, and knowledgeable of the wine. It's such a relaxing and beauty area. We will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Pam S.
reviews.description: Loved it! The layout is great and spacious! We sat on the patio and loved the big fan. Bottle wine priced right. The bbq food truck was there with yummy food. Only thing missing was music! Enjoyed nonetheless!

reviews.author: Kimberly K.
reviews.description: What a wonderful little hill country winery tucked away from the fast paced world! My fiancee and I have come out here several times on a motorcycle ride to enjoy the peaceful surroundings and get away from the traffic in the city. We love their frozen sangria and the Comal Red. They offer a plastic boot for $20 that they fill with their delicious frozen Sangria. Bring the boot back and refills are only $10!   The staff here are so nice and helpful too. On our last visit we were going to each have a glass of wine and the lady told us for a few dollars more we could buy the whole bottle. You don't have to tell me twice! Grab a seat outside, either by one of the many oak trees, or under the shaded pavilion and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed this winery on the TX wine trail! Super close to Canyon Lake and New Braunfels, this gem has lots of outdoor space and some delicious wine offerings. They are dog friendly too. I really appreciated the hospitality of the servers, who were kind enough to give the hubby our tasting outside since we had the pup. We ended up getting the cheese plate (which was yummy) and ordered two glasses of wine. We also bought a bottle of rose for the road. Great spot!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Very quaint and peaceful winery. There is a gift shop, indoor seating as well as outdoor seating (in the shade and in the sun). There are a bunch of wines to sample as well as one champagne and their famous sangria slush (my favorite).  The ladies are so helpful with the samplings and very knowledgable about the wines and where the grapes come from (not all can be grown on site due to certain bugs and climate reasons). I was very intrigued that they decanter their wine when you buy a bottle. I have always heard of this but have never seen a place do it. We were able to taste a wine before and after decantering and WOA what a difference!! I'm not sure why more places don't do this  This is a fun place to get away to with the country feel and relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.author: Alysha N.
reviews.description: Great outdoor area with live music makes for a relaxing winery visit. The wine is great!

reviews.author: Doug G.
reviews.description: So this was an absolute lovely vineyard.  We really liked the grounds, the out door gazebo and the building.  The furniture made of wine barrels was really nice.  We paid 15.00 for these really tiny tastes. We didn't really like their wines and do not enjoy sweet wines. We ended getting 3 glasses of their Sangiovese. Total bill was over 50.00.  This was pricy for a tasting and 3 glasses.  Normally if you end up buying glasses most wineries don't charge especially if the tasting pours were so non committing I don't think we even got through our tasting before deciding just to buy full glasses. So you should Be a little more generous with your pours if you are going to charge 15.00.  You all need something a little dryer and bolder.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: I love this vineyard. Just picked up the 2017 Foot pressed red wine. It is not available to the public but available to those that participated in last years stomping event. People are very friendly and outgoing. The different wines are delicious. I like all of the reds, especially the Black Spanish Dark Red Lenoir 2012 Reserve , which has a nice bold berry flavorI am not a fan of white wines but their French Colombard is amazing. It is a great light summer wine that is soft, fruity and mellow and so is the Spanish black and white wine. The vineyard is a great place for weddings and parties. It is a very quiet and restful place.

reviews.author: Mary Ann C.
reviews.description: We made a quick stop at this winery and enjoyed the view while having a glass of wine.  I chose a jammy Cabernet called Lone Star Cab that was perfect. They do wine tasting but I just opted for a glass of what I knew that I would enjoy.    The cafe was not open but they had items that paired well with wine.  I'm sure it is busy in the weekend.  The Cafe is small so get your food to go and enjoy one of the many cozy spots to view the vineyards.   The staff were very friendly and the store was very clean.  They have gifts as well.  If we were in town longer, We would have come back for lunch.    The road to the vineyard is gravel so drive slow.  Parking is free and plentiful.  Follow the signs as the vineyard is about a mile up from the main road.

reviews.author: Bill K.
reviews.description: The wife and I tasted a flight of 6 wines: including the Rose, Cab, Red Blend, Merlot, Sangovese, and Syrah.  They were all simply awful swill. Everyone of the varietals lacked depth, character and complexity.  Everyone of the reds tasted blah, and I mean blah. They all lacked the distinctive aroma and notes that each of the grapes are known for.  The Rose  lacked any minerality that one would expect, and was as bad as the others.  The tasting room experience was as bad as the wines. The server had zero personality or character either.  We came away with the same thoughts as we have from other Hill Country Wineries.  They should not, nor should they be attempting to produce well known wines, and in fact do a terrible version of Cabs, Merlots, and Chards.  They should stick to Italian varietals, as well as a few others that might be better suited to the Texas climate, even though most people have no idea about those varietals. I suppose its just marketing to attract people in to the tasting room, and once they get toasted enough it no longer matters, since once the minds fogs, its just pour me another.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We were recommended this place by a friend so we decided to check it out. It is in a very remote area which makes it nice. They are on a hill so that the outdoor seating has a great view.  We got 2 tastings and for the most part I enjoyed all of their wines. The Alamo Red was great and so was the Longhorn Red. My wife enjoyed the Chardonnay as well. The servers were very helpful and help guide us to their more popular wines.   We ended up buying a couple of bottles and really enjoyed the experience and the view. We plan on coming here again soon!

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: Gorgeous property...Hill Country vistas at their finest.  Lovely people running the place, too. The wine was fine but definitely not the sole reason to visit, so make sure you have a couple places you're bopping around to in the area. Cute little tasting glasses and there's a shop for kitschy items featuring a lot of wine puns.    I do think the crowd skews a bit older, so better suited for entertaining folks than a bach party!

reviews.author: Anna Q.
reviews.description: Beautiful winery 25 minutes from Wimberly! We stopped by during 4th of July and was surprised there wasn't more of a crowd. Strict 21+ policy (many signs warning you to turn back if you aren't 21!) but the servers were so nice and kind. We did a wine tasting which was $20 for 6 samples of white, red, and sweet wine. You can also split the sampling between people, which I shared with a friend. Server (I think her name was Julie) was so sweet and knowledgeable about the wine flavors and gave us recommendations and some history of the flavors. Our favorite was the Starry Night, or the Orange Muscat wine! A bit disappointed they didn't give chocolates or nuts during a wine tasting and overall felt a bit rushed through the process as more people showed up, but it was still a unique experience.   The patio has a beautiful view of the orchard, which is why we came here versus other wineries in the area. Outdoor seating is plentiful, many round tables for larger groups too. Definitely would've spent a good half of day out here sipping wine if it wasn't for the rain. The Bistro (food/restaurant area) was closed because of Covid so eat before you arrive so you don't get hangry or wine drunk! ;)

reviews.author: Nae F.
reviews.description: This was the second stop on our wine tour during our anniversary celebration. The ambiance is fantastic and is worth the visit to just get a bottle and enjoy the panoramic views.   Pro tip: they do not allow children, so know that before you go. I believe most of the poor reviews are about this fact, but if you are prepared beforehand it will help with the planning.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: The Napa or Texas! It's totally different I know, I know however it's a sweet little place in Hill Country. Bring a few friends and drink a bottle outside under the tree shade. They have a nice bistro menu to pair with your wine.   Prices are really reasonable $25-50 a bottle. Nice selection of whites, reds, sweets. Enjoy.

reviews.author: Tayo F.
reviews.description: The view. You gotta see the view. Especially as the sun is going down. My picture doesn't so it justice but it it was amazing. There is of course the other great things like the food, the outdoor lights they put on when the sun goes down and the wine is pretty good too but none of that compares to the view. You'll know it when you see it.

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This was the best winery of the 8 1/2 I made it to in Texas. All of the wines had a, well let's just say, flavor I am more accustomed to tasting. Prior to this place, everything I tasted was a mixture of sour fermented grapes. Not knocking Texas wines but they are just not my style. Maybe it needs an ice cube. Every wine here, ones that I tasted, is 100% Texan and done the way I think it is suppose to taste. Also, the view from the estate is beautiful. Very worth a stop for tasting and buying.

reviews.author: Phillip S.
reviews.description: As a wine club member I was told to not smoke in the parking lot. They just lost me as a longtime customer and I will tell everyone to not go there. VERY POOR customer service people, you just lost a lot of business over 1 cigarette. My friends and I will never be back.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Second time coming here and have not been disappointed. There was a small wait for wine tasting due to limited seating inside. They wipe down tables in between people and staff are all wearing mask. Plenty of space outside for proper social distancing and enjoying some wine. We grabbed a bottle and ate at the small restaurant they have there. Would recommend you make reservations if you want a view. Service was great and food was amazing. My favorite was the pizza, don't remember the name of it but it had honey on it and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. Never thought I would like a pizza with honey on it, now I can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Anielka E.
reviews.description: Driftwood winery was our first stop of wine tasting of the day. The view was what sold me. Perfect for pictures!! They have an outdoor sitting area where you can admire the views and the bottle that you order is brought to you by a server who wears a face shield and gloves.    My group ordered a bottle of the 2017 Newsom Cabernet Sauvignon and we were pleased with our choice. It was not dry like a Merlot but just right. This winery does not allow you to bring outside food only the food offered in their bistro outdoor facility. This was not an issue for us.   Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.author: Chelsea R.
reviews.description: The view here and ambience is absolutely amazing. We did a wine flight and then brought a glass to their seating area. Wine itself was just OKAY. The view is incredible. You get a take home glass with the tasting!

reviews.author: Matou≈° P.
reviews.description: We have been club members here in the past, and really loved it. We went an 75 minutes out of our way to stop in for a tasting to see what peaked our interest in their current offerings. We loved that they have so much beautiful outdoor space. That is something that was always a major draw for us at Driftwood.   We called ahead, let them know we had a pup with us, and wanted to do a tasting. They told us to come on in. (It was a Monday and the place was very slow)  Upon arrival they told us they will only to tastings inside? What? In the era of COVID? As for the dog, they said one of us could do a tasting.   Between the lack of customer service, unfriendly attitude, and most importantly lack of outdoor tastings we will never bother to come back. WAY too many options with just as beautiful of grounds, equally great wines, safe tasting environment, and more importantly good customer service.

reviews.author: Patricia V.
reviews.description: It was an awesome peaceful experience.  The wine was full of flavor and wonderful taste of wines. The property is so beautiful.  It would be a perfect location for a wedding or vows renewing. The winery also offers a small bistro and gift shop with great items to purchase. I will recommend Driftwood and will come back!

reviews.author: Olivia C.
reviews.description: Good wine, good scenery, but the lady checking us in made it bad. First, I'm 21 and so is my best friend. We went with her parents, and her dad likes to joke around. We shared our ID's (after already confirming with someone else that we are at least 21 and allowed to enter), and he made a joke about us having fake ID's. Obviously we don't have fake ID's, this lady could've scanned them and checked. Anyways, she then proceeded to yell at all of us about how we can't allow anyone under 21 in the winery, she even yelled "NO ONE IS ALLOWED IN HERE UNLESS THEY ARE TWENTY ONE, PERIOD," she really did say "period" which immediately made my friend and I annoyed. Just very mean and disrespectful. I understand that she was trying to enforce the rules but we are over 21 and she did not have to explain the rules in such a rude way. Even her coworkers seem to not like her that much, they gave her the side eye, like she's THAT lady at work.  Then we did the wine tasting and the lady who poured us our wine was absolutely lovely. So sweet, gentle, kind, and even in the wine tasting area we had a great view of the hills and nature around us. The wine was very good. we liked almost everything, and even bought a few bottles.  After this, we went to buy some bottles and a glass of wine, again meeting the lady from earlier. A hand washing towel that my friend bought wasn't scanning correctly snd she got VERY mad at my friend for it. She took out her frustration from the computer on my friend. She was basically yelling at her and telling her to get another hand towel of the same price, she was interrupting us, I was ready to snap at this lady. She was VERY rude the whole time. She got the entire room of customers quiet from her yelling at my friend. She was just clearly very frustrated but should not have taken it out on my friend, family and I. This winery is incredible, but her attitude, frustration, and behavior knocked my rating down from 5 to 3. I was gonna put a 2 because of her, but the winery was amazing, it deserved a 5, but this woman made a serene and calming experience a bad one. My friend and I are both 21 and it isn't our fault the computer messed up scanning a hand towel. There were a few more negative experiences we had with her but these were the worst ones. Even the other customers in the room who were complete strangers to us saw her being this rude, controlling, and mean and visibly for uncomfortable. This company would be a 5 star place without her ruining everyone's experiences.  EDIT: Her name is Aileen. I don't know how it's spelled but my friend that I mentioned remembered her name because we were planning to call the company and inform them about her rudeness to customers.

reviews.author: Harry C.
reviews.description: Great setting and wonderful view and good wine.  The bistro food is on scale of 2 out of 10.  I never tasted such poor quality food.  Even if you order a soft drink, you get it in a can, they don't even have ice.  If your looking for a meal, go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Holly N.
reviews.description: Really disappointed in the customer service at this winery. We called to see if reservations were required and what time the last tastings were served. The woman on the phone said no reservations needed and the last tasting was at 5:30pm (winery closes at 6pm). We walked up to the check in host at 5:31pm for him to say in a smug tone, "Oooh we just closed up".  I told him what the lady on the phone said and he said, "yeah sorry". I was surprised at the lack of hospitality as we would have been out of their way by closing time and were looking forward to supporting a local winery during these difficult Covid times.  Better luck next time I suppose but left a less than wonderful taste in my mouth. I'll wash that taste down with wine from another winery!

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you have a big group don't waste your time coming here. This establishment doesn't want your money. They made that clear today.

reviews.author: Alim B.
reviews.description: Great place. The service is amazing! Everyone that works there has a vast knowledge of the wines. I would recommend getting a membership as well! Totally worth it! Also the view is to die for!

name: Sidecar Tasting Room
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: Went today with friends. Had the red wine flight...rose', montepulciano and the Tempranillo...liked them all but not enough to buy.  Had the meat and cheese plate...yum.   Ann (sommelier) was sweet and knowledgeable.  Flagship winery is Big Springs winery (which we visited today as well)   BUY LOCAL  SUPPORT LOCAL

reviews.author: Mark R.
reviews.description: Had a great time at Sidecar. Stopped in for lunch and a flight of wines as our first stop in Dripping and really enjoyed the setup. Lunch is from a food truck (trailer) on site. My group tasted reds and whites and all were very tasty. Food was good - had burgers and they were good quality. Setup was nice with covered tables outdoors or an indoor option. I didn't check out the brewery onsite but did see some guys partaking in the brews. I would not hesitate to return.

reviews.author: Cory Jo M.
reviews.description: Super cool environment and beautiful decor! The vibe here was awesome! The wine was okay. I like sweet wine and the wine flight was dry so I didn't enjoy it like a wished I would've.

reviews.author: Lacy B.
reviews.description: This place is so cute!!! Amazing service. Delicious empanadas. Love the ros√®! We sat outside under the oak trees and enjoyed the scenery. Perfect first stop of our bachelorette weekend!

reviews.author: Tiffany Y.
reviews.description: Visiting from California and we wanted to go wine tasting and this was a winery nearby so we decided to give it a try. No regrets! Anne was very welcoming and friendly. She also gave us information on other wineries/breweries/distilleries to try. I had the $15 flight of reds and she also gave me an extra cup of red wine, Needy B*tch, I ended up buying a bottle! I finally found a great bottle of red that I actually enjoy, sad that I can't get it shipped to me in California. Drippin' Sweet is also great, bought a bottle as well. Love the descriptions given to the wines it made them sound all delicious. And they were! (According to all the ones I tried).

reviews.author: Jules A.
reviews.description: This little place is amazing!! A very welcoming and clean environment and have a nice selection of wines. Also the cheese and meat platter is so good!!  We stopped by on our way to Dallas. You definitely have to check it out!

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: Great little place to go taste and snack! We had a flight of the white and red and they were great. We had one of each of the empanadas and all three were so good! I'm not sure where they get those things but they are amazing. My favorite was the bbq one. They also have games you can play. Would be a good place for a date!

reviews.author: Jeanette D.
reviews.description: Pretty good wine tasting. We did the red wine tasting. My favorite wine was the Tranquillo wine. $15 for 3 wines which is a little weak for wine tasting but the cool ambience made the trip worth it and the portions weren't weak.

reviews.author: Briana N.
reviews.description: Talk about southern hospitality. So we came here from a airbnb in dripping springs. It was a little far for an Uber to pick us up, but we got one. So we are there enjoying wine glasses, wine flights, food, the atmosphere. Everything about this place is so cute and amazing. But trying to get an Uber home seemed unlikely. Everyone kept cancelling on us and the bartender Ann or Annie (plus the last two customers) kept telling us that we were not gonna walk the 2 miles home. Annie made sure that we stayed till she closed and literally DROVE US BACK TO THE AIR BNB!!!. She was the sweetest thing and didn't even want to take any money from us. We had a back and forth of take it, no keep it, take it!! Haha I'm 80% sure I got the money in her cupholder before I left but I was the tipsy one so who knows haha. I really hope I did because driving us back to our Airbnb was above and beyond.

reviews.author: Mallory Y.
reviews.description: Absolutely great place to stop by if you are in the Dripping Springs area. The service was top-notch and the decor is really eclectic! They have wine flight options or you can enjoy a glass if you chose. The server was incredibly knowledgeable and had great recommendations for everyone in our group. She let us try what we wanted before committing to our drink of choice. I ended up going to wine cocktail called the Texas Kiri and it fresh rosemary in it which I though was a nice touch! They also have live music outside and plenty of areas to sit and enjoy listening to it. Definitely try this place out!

reviews.author: Jenni S.
reviews.description: Super cute little place in drippings springs, but I wasn't a huge fan of the wine. Sad, because I really wanted to love it. Maybe next years harvest will be better!

reviews.author: Tanna L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were looking for a bar to hang out at. We came across Sidecar. Everyone is so friendly and enjoy the time we spent here.

reviews.author: Steven A.
reviews.description: Great experience for a weekend visit by friends from out of town. They had a great selection of delicious wines as well as live indie folk music. Will definitely come back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Jesse M.
reviews.description: Being in the Industry, it was a pleasant surprise to visit the Sidecar Tasting Room! Claire was an awesome Host, knowledgeable about the wines, and gave great info on recommendations. Clean and tasteful Wine Bar and I enjoyed the Red Flight! Took a few bottles home to enjoy!

reviews.author: Marilyn M.
reviews.description: Great ambiance, really good wines! We did the tasting and bought a bottle to take home! Hide gem in Dripping Springs!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: We were in town for another winery quarterly wine pick up party.  That winery no longer allows you to open your bottles of wine at the party or allow dogs.  As such, it wasn't a great day.  We decided to go some place else.  We showed up around 4pm on a Sunday and had the entire place to ourselves. It is so cute.  I love the decorations and the vibe. We did the wine tasting which is $7 or waved if you buy a bottle of wine.  Megan was wonderful.  She was full of information and funny.  We had such a wonderful time we decided to join Bell Springs wine club.  Three bottles a quarter. No sign up fee. They have a wine pick up party that allows you to bring your dogs.  20% discount the first year and the discount increases every year you are a member.  Free wine tasting for you and four people either at Side Car or the winery itself. You also get to pick which three bottles you want. We signed up on the spot. What is NOT to like! We enjoyed many of their wines but really it was Megan.  She made us feel so welcomed and was so friendly.  Bell Spring treat her right, she is a HUGE asset to you.  We can't wait to attend our first wine pick up party.  Hope to make it to first Thursday soon and hang out at the Side Car.  If we lived in Dripping Springs this would be a weekly stop for us.  What a great place in this sleepy town.  We are so glad to part of their wine club and excited for the many cool events moving forward.  This should be a place to stop if you are in Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: Paige M.
reviews.description: LOVED the atmosphere! Such a cute place and great dry whites. The girl working there had a wonderful personality.  She was so easy to talk to and very knowledgeable. If I'm just hanging out, looking for a nice place to chill with a glass, this will be it!

reviews.author: Peter V.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection and wonderful staff. Claire (taller with blonde hair) is absolutely fabulous. She really gets to know the clients. Also very knowledgeable. I recommend the Needy Bitch red wine.

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and wonderful selection of wines. Don't let the road it's one stop you from enjoying this spot.

reviews.author: Claire P.
reviews.description: This was the perfect stop off while driving through. They had good wine, good service and great ambiance. We would definitely recommend to anyone driving through Dripping Springs.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This place is really nice. They have a ton of different wines, beers, etc to choose from and a beautiful outdoor seating area to enjoy. It's covered with trees so mostly shaded but I thought it was really cool that they had misting fans going for muggy hot days like today.  If you're in town and want to hang out with the girls or spend time with your significant other, this would be an amazing place to come and try something new while relaxing.  Everything was also labeled: sweet, red, white, ros√©, and even organic. I didn't know organic wine was a thing but apparently it is and they have it.   The guy working today was not the nicest. He barely said anything and didn't really help us out much. It seemed like he didn't want to be there.

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: This store/wine local is in the center of Gruene. It is across from Gruene Hall and Mozies restaurant.  The store is filled w wine glasses and coasters (other items relating to wine) w funny quotes. They have a very large variety of wine that they sell by the glass and by the bottle.  We got 2 glasses of their "best seller", the Texas Southwind Blackberry Wine and one of my friends bought a bottle ($29) bc she loved it so much. Each "glass" was $9 and it came in a small plastic cup. I have an eye for a serving of wine and this was DEFINITELY short. Our cup wasn't even HALF way full.  Unfortunately, they do not do offer Wine Flights. I'm not sure why. This could be such a great addition to their business. They have a huge variety of wine. It'd be nice to try 4-5 wines and then be able to buy a bottle (or 3 ) of your favorite wines to take home w you. IMO, they are hurting their business by not offering flights. If we had been able to try more wines and not have to pay so much for each tiny glass just to TRY the wine, I'm sure our group would've walked out w more than one bottle.   There is a small courtyard next to the store where you could just sit and drink if you wanted to. There were numerous dogs w their owners. (So, dog friendly! ) We chose to walk around w our tiny glasses  and find a place w live music. (and find a place that offered wine flights...lol)

reviews.author: Lana Y.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots to stop by for a drink and to stop and relax for a little while. We visited on a Saturday, which it wasnt too busy, and enjoyed people watching while waiting for a table to become available at the Gristmill.  I enjoyed the frozen sangria and my husband enjoyed a beer while live music started playing outside in the court yard. Great weather although a little warm for a fall day in October. They did have misters and a bar outside so people didn't have to go inside if they didn't want too.   Plenty of parking nearby. Clean restrooms. Friendly and Quick service.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The Grapevine is a great place to a cool drink or a glass of vino, catch some music, or people watch. We did not partake of their wine but on a hot October, Saturday a cold beer or two was in order.   The beer line moves fast and there is a good selection of local and corporate beers. Masks are required indoors while you order and the outside tables are set pretty far apart.   There is a good-sized shaded courtyard with live music (on this Sat afternoon). We opted for the people watching section by the street and we were not disappointed.   Like most places in Gruene everything is a bit overpriced but if you know where to go there are good (nontourist priced) deals. The Grapevine is a cool place to hang while planning your next stop in Gruene.

reviews.author: Albert T.
reviews.description: Came here on a busy weekend, line was out the door, but definitely did their best to stagger the line. While there was plenty of out door seating, and a live band playing...definitely still crowded.   Drink wise...we got the frozen wine-a-rita - sangria and peach bellini......very sugary.. but very good if you like sugary drinks. Also kinda on the pricier side for 2 slushy type drinks after tip.  You'll probably make your way here while waiting for your table at the Gristmill to be ready.

reviews.author: Ken S.
