reviews.description: This place had a nice relaxing atmosphere, you can walk in get you an adult beverage and walk outside and sit under all the trees. All this trees provide a nice sheltering shade where you can sit down and enjoy some live music. You can just simply sit there and enjoying the day and watch all the patrons passing by...

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: I always stop in at The Grapevine when in town.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff are happy to assist in choosing wine.  The retail selection is diverse to please any pallet.  Great gifts sold here too'

reviews.author: Diane W.
reviews.description: Used to be super friendly, great tastings, and buy-by-the-glass to sit inside or out.  No more tastings. No more inside seating. Now "what do you want" as they stare you down and short you on a $10 glass of something we aren't even sure you're going to like.  There are WAY better places up the way in Wimberley, San Marcos, etc.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: This is a wine tasting room, not a winery. Just thought I would throw that out there since most people like to go to actual wineries when up in the hill country region. This is a super cute spot (that can get extremely busy) where you can sit outside and enjoy sipping on fermented grapes while listening to live music. It's dog friendly. It's family/children friendly. There are plenty of seat options outside. And it's very reasonably priced! Especially when you consider that your 3 wine tastings are FREE. I recommend!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: This is a very cute spot In Historic Gruene. The offer 3 free tastings for beer and wine. The tasting room inside is small but there's is a ton a seating outside. The have a decent selection of semi sweet to sweet wines which are my favorite as well about 6 draft beers. The staff was friendly and very nice. They were very helpful when picking what wines to taste. We purchased a glass of wine and went and enjoyed outside. They have cute little table and benches as well as a stage outside. If your stopping through Gruene,  this tasting room is a great spot to stop and enjoy a glass of wine.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I LOVE The Grapevine and I tell everyone I know about them! It is my favorite place to go, especially this time of year when the weather starts to cool off they will light up a fire pit. It is the perfect place for a date or group of friends to hang out. Before ordering, you are aloud to taste three wines. There is a wide selection to choose from with categories: sweet/dessert, red, and white. My husband and I usually will take one small sip of our glass and then switch so that we can try six and then buy a bottle of the one we love the most. They give you the option of having a chilled wine in a bucket of ice. In the summertime, we will do this with one of the sweeter wines. Our favorite thing to do is to get them to open the wine and bag it, then give us two plastic cups. This allows us to carry the bottle around and sip on the wine while we walk around town to the different shops.

reviews.author: Shelli S.
reviews.description: Weekend at Gruene did not disappoint. Peach Bellini s and Coors Light while listening to live music is the best!  Great service with a smile! They were even super busy!

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: What better stop while you're in Gruene than to stop in to taste a few wines.  You never know what you'll find.  My friend and I had gone in for a tasting to see what might be tempting.  It never hurts to buy a bottle of wine, right?  Well, it was fairly crowded, being such a beautiful day out.  However I have seen it busier.  Anyway, we had walked up to the counter and were greeted and asked what we would like.  We took a few minutes to decide and got our sample.  A little dry for me, so we got another.  Now a few minutes have gone by as we've been standing there.  People come up to the counter and get help.  We finally decide what to get and the person who is been helping us keeps on walking by, as she is helping others.  But there are a few other people working the counter, including a gentleman less than four feet away.  Well, we stand there, just looking, waiting for someone to help us.  That help never came, so we decided to walk out without a purchase.  It's always important to keep track of everyone that comes into your business.    Because I did like the wine I will be back at some point in the future, hopefully to get the bottle that had caught my attention.

reviews.author: Steve C.
reviews.description: They will not hold open a tab anymore, but demand to hold on to your driver's license over a bucket of ice.  SMDH.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Great place to try samples of wine. They have a reasonable selection to choose from. They offer samplings, by the glass and by the bottle. They staff is very friendly and helpful. The best part of the experience is the atmosphere. They have a cute patio and outdoors area where live music is played. They also offer cute gifts. The only thing I would recommend is more of an appetizer selection. It is definitely a must stop if you are in Gruene for the day or the weekend.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: GREAT customer service and they are really cool and subtle when it comes time to close up shop.  You can still hangout on the porch and finish your beer after they close everything up.  Domestic beers abt $4 each and $5 for an average plastic up of wine.  Chill place to hang out before a show at Gruene Hall.

reviews.author: Melyn G.
reviews.description: Great weather to be out at the annual Clay festival enjoying some Texas wine and a cheese tray and of course live musix

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Nice selection of Texas wines. Was cool to see that they carry a selection of Rohan meadery and honey wines. This will save a trip to LaGrange. Come here on and off, usually to show out of town guests which was the case today. They loved the hospitality and selection.   The only negative is that it can get so cramped inside and the AC is not up to the challenge of cooling the place with the constant traffic opening the doors. It was pleasant sitting outside today, cooler than inside.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: You get 3 free tastings of either wine or draft beer. OR you can choose to do 5 tastings with a souvenir wine glass (stemmed or stemless, you pick.)   The customer service here cannot be beat. On a weekend day, you will find it to be a happening place, but you won't be waiting in line as you would expect. Sometimes they even have Peach-A-Ritas and Frozen Sangria!   The Grapevine offers a plethora of bottled wines for sale, or you can buy a glass..   There is ample seating outside of the Grapbine building, where you can enjoy a glass of wine, beer or maybe you bought a bottle to share. They will give you a bucket with ice to keep your wine cool in.   The bathroom situation can get a bit tight, as there is 1 male restroom and 1 female. But there are plenty of restrooms available at Gruene Hall which is not far at all.   I like that you can open a tab, so you can grab a beer or glass of wine, walking around Gruene and shop, then stop by when you need a refill.   I was bummed they no longer offer any of the wines from Val Verde in Del Rio, but the waiter did suggest a few wines for me to try that were comparable.   They also have small cheese and cracker boards available.

reviews.author: Karen L.
reviews.description: Stumbled on this place while exploring the area. Such a fun little wine bar - great drink options and a cute patio with live music. Would definitely go back to enjoy the summer vibes here. The staff in the tasting room was so nice to us and the guy performing was really good and chill. Stop in here and check it out!

reviews.author: Fana T.
reviews.description: Great sotol, hip environment, nice and clean. Kelsey our server was lovely, will come back for the river Rita next time.

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the d√©cor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: OMG this place was something we happened to stumble upon and it is a Austin must! This is a great cocktail bar that is modern and very desert chic. We are so so happy we stopped here and will be buy thing their Stool back home to make our own delicious Palomas. Also whatever their berry cocktail is, is a must try.

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Our favorite spot in the Dripping Springs / Driftwood area. Obsessed with all the cocktails - specifically the comanchero. Obsessed with the interior decor  - please do my house next. Obsessed with all the servers - Nicole, Kelsey + Erin* are WONDERFUL. This place is the best!!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: This place is great! Good food, great service, even better drinks. Kelsey was our server and she was so friendly and attentive! We'll definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: If you want a unique drink, great atmosphere and amazing staff.... Go here. We were able to get different but classic drinks and cozy up to fireplace. The food truck made the best fries and quest, perfect for sharing.

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Leah C.
reviews.description: So I actually had a taste of their goods at the total wine and me an my mom decided the distillery wasn't too far and we should check it out. Very unique sotol experience, I want to say they are the only distillery in the states, but could be wrong! Very nice outside space, they have a food truck with some very good food! It is a bit of a drive but worth the trek. Had a lovely time here and would certainly come back! Just have to be careful on not enjoying too many beverages as it is a drive!!

reviews.author: Nilofer M.
reviews.description: If you want delicious and fresh Italian food with a beautiful indoor dinning experience I would highly suggest this spot. I came across it while searching on Reddit and made the best deduction of having dinner there for my 28th birthday!  Our waitress was the NICEST person I've ever met. Super kind, didn't rush, had great recommendations and allowed my boyfriend to surprise me with two little cakes.   Everything on their menu hits the spot but I got the fettuccine dish and my boyfriend got the penne vodka (which he claims is the best he's ever had). The drive is a bit long from ATX but 100000% worth it.  I will be visiting back when the weather is nicer to also enjoy the vineyard next door

reviews.author: Charli V.
reviews.description: Had a great dinner with my partner the other night at Trattoria Lisina. We didn't have an appointment but were able to grab a table right away.  The driveway was hard to see coming off the road but I suppose this is due to the "dark sky" community. Albeit, Some extra signage would be nice.   We ordered meatballs as an appetizer and these were delicious! The garlic toast that comes with this dish is soooo tasty!   Focaccia and oil is complimentary, wish the bread was softer and less greasy but it was free..   We split the taglierini portofino. It was the right amount! The scallops in the dish was perfectly cooked, the shrimp may have been over seasoned but the lemon butter slightly cuts the seasoning.   Over all, We spent about $80 for our meal and 3 drinks.  We were pretty satisfied! Thanks for the great service and delicious Italian!

reviews.author: Anna T.
reviews.description: We had a large party and one of the waitstaff spilled an ENTIRE TRAY of iced water on one of our guests. We understand mistakes happen but NO ONE from management came to apologize and no concessions were made, not even a drink or the meal of the person who got soaked.   Poor management.   The meal was fine and we still have a generous tip despite leaving with horrible sense of proprietorship.

reviews.author: Eric G.
reviews.description: We brought food from here to a table outside the winery nextdoor.. with wine from the winery. I think this is your best bet if you're looking to eat and be away from crowds (for COVID).  I have to say all the food was good. The linguini was my favorite, followed closely by the mashed potatoes. The breads (focaccia and garlic) were each tasty, i could eat that focaccia all dayyy.  The lasagna was good, a bit heavy for me, though.. but what do you expect with lasagna!  I'd probably skip the Caesar salad next time..  While not my favorite Italian food ever, the grounds are beautiful, and it's a great place to bring a date or some friends and have a picnic style meal with some wine ;)

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: This place is a visual feast--a beautiful building of European flavor with a substantial Vinyard nearby, surrounded by beautiful oak trees, and beautifully maintained gardens.  While it is not easy to get to, it is the only gourmet restaurant I know of that accommodates helicopters.  (We arrived by car.)  We have met Austin friends here several times and the food has always been excellent, but we all agreed that it is now even better than we had remembered it from pre-covid days.  Warm bread came early with a plate of olive oil and herbs for dipping.  The antipasto plate and the fried calamari were both excellent, with a spicy dipping sauce.  Our friend loved the pasta dish with saut√©ed scallops, and the 8 ounce filet that my wife and I shared  was the best of our eight decade lifetime.  We will be back again and again.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: Beautiful venue and setting but it's evident this restaurant is struggling from a personnel and management standpoint.  We drove 45min today (Sunday) and arrived before 11 AM - the place was completely empty.  We took a walk around the property and upon return checked in with the hostess for a party of 6.    We were shocked when she asked if we had a reservation.  Looking at the empty restaurant we politely asked if she was sure we needed one?  She mentioned they were short staffed and completely booked, but we could order take out.  Confused, considering the place still only had one table occupied, we left and went to a different venue.

reviews.author: Hilton S.
reviews.description: I must start by saying, Morgan is one of the best servers I have had in recent years.  She was attentive and knowledgeable without being aggressive.  She knew the menu perfectly and made great recommendations. We started with the asparagus salad and prosciutto pizza (upside down as Morgan recommended). The asparagus was grilled perfectly with a slight char to it. The pestos on the salad were amazing. The pizza was crisp and delicious. Honestly, it couldn't have been better. I then had the duck breast with cranberries and my dining partner had the ribeye.  Both were cooked perfectly and seasoned just right.  For dessert we got tiramisu.  It was light and delicious. The mascarpone was airy and lady fingers had just the right bit of liquor. The decor was a bit "overdone" for my taste, but I can't dare take away any points for my view on that. Really a solid 5.

reviews.author: Taye M.
reviews.description: Wow! Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. This is the place to go if you want Texas fancy. What I mean is it's a relaxed but beautiful place. The food is worth every penny.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: We ordered a little bit of everything for my sisters birthday! Wish I had gotten more picture of the food, but we really enjoyed ourselves and the conversation. My favorite dish was the fettuccini Alfredo with shrimp. Highly recommend the tiramisu!

reviews.author: Mandy T.
reviews.description: Tuscan feel, amazing food and wine!  Loved the pasta lemon butter and shrimp.  Super delish and don't forget the tiramisu - so delish and huge helping

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: First ever dining experience at Trattoria Lisina.  We we did for a special occasion, a "mile stone birthday."  We drove 1-1/2 hours to get there!  Let's start with negatives (which I don't normally do!).  The most expensive menu item, aside from the bottle of wine, was a pistachio encrusted red snapper filet.  The fish was 2x over cooked, and was tough as leather.  The main problem was it's a filet, skin on, blood line still intact.  As a seasoned Gulf fisherman and chef, I know you need the blood line cut out of the filet, even the fishing guys on YouTube get that.  Great piece of fish, tough to cut even with the knife provided.  It's not all about presentation.  Issue raised with waiter (Joseph S), and "he could have the manager come over to discuss."  As a waiter, when the dish is bad, take it away and redo!  The craft cocktails were OK, not worth the $14-$15 price tag.  The star of the evening was the calamari fritti, which was great!  Fresh, hot, tartar and marinara sauces were on point, terrific.  The veal osso buco, the best in TX, by far!  There's something about fresh bone marrow!  Dessert was the tiramisu, which was awesome, until James S added to the bill.  Overall, Trattoria Lisina is a "destination" restaurant, but for the $$, it's not worth the hype.  Enjoy one of the Mandola locations in ATX, the food is better and the price tag is 80% less ...

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: A hidden gem nestled within in a vineyard in the hill country just a few minutes from our abode.   Definitely a must-go-to for special occasions in groups, or when looking for a cozy romantic setting.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Driving to Trattoria Lisina from Austin is always a fun field trip out into a totally different part of Texas. No traffic, windy two lane roads and there you are, in a vineyard in the middle of nowhere. I'd have never guessed a place the size and class of Trattoria Lisina would be nestled in hill country like this.  The inside felt distinctly Houston/Dallas vibes: much more corporate and big scale than a little mom-and-pop, but in a good way. Nice and air conditioned with plenty of space too. Now for the food:  The focaccia they serve with garlic/herb olive oil is OUTSTANDING. I could have eaten it all night, so so good. Like fools we ALSO ordered garlic bread. The garlic bread was toasted baguette slices that were burnt and dried. No bueno. Also: how is one bread item the best thing on the menu and the other maybe the worst? Strange, but anyway, don't get the garlic bread when you have garlic oil and bread in your lap, overflowing. The calamari was ok but the entrees were amazing. The osso buco was SO TENDER and so full of flavor. It came with a little marrow spoon and was a huge portion. My husband got the crispy duck with polenta cakes and cranberry salsa and he was a big fan too.   The service was so nice and sweet and the setting was beyond stunning. I really liked my time here and would definitely take guests when they visit too!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: This restaurant came highly recommended to us so we had high expectations.   First off, the free focaccia they give you is the bomb. Best item we ate all night.   We ordered garlic toast and it was BURNT. We were told that is how it normally is but we asked for it to be taken off of our ticket. All we could taste was char.   I had the fettuccine con prosciutto. It was ok. I would've preferred thinner prosciutto. I also added chicken and it seemed like it was frozen not fresh. Would I order it again,no.   We did also order the garlic potatoes and they were really good. They really only tasted like the cheese in them but they were great.   We ordered the tiramisu and chocolate caramel cake. Tiramisu is rum HEAVY and I mean it. The chocolate caramel cake was overly salty. I couldn't even eat it. I do normally like "salty" desserts so this was a bummer.   Service was ok. Took awhile for refills. Would I come back, probably not. Great ambiance but based on what we ordered we wouldn't come back.

reviews.author: Erin M.
reviews.description: Best upscale restaurant in the Austin south suburbs. Wonderful setting for kiddos as they have a play scale. Great to order a glass or three of wine and sit outside in the gorgeous venue. Everything tastes amazing and the service has a high level of attention. Been here 4-5 times with family and date night. Just love it!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: A second (or maybe third) run at Trattoria Lisina. Owned by the Mandola family, it's a nicely isolated property with vineyards along the drive, play structures and other outside amenities, a pretty outdoor dining area with umbrellas for the tables and a vine covered facade that demands to be Italian. The inside if modern rustic upscale Italian. They are obscenely popular, so plan to make reservations well in advance. Don't expect to walk in and get a table.  Service today by Jeremy was impeccable. He was hyper attentive and considerate. One of our party has a citrus allergy, and he adapted wonderfully to that.  We started with fried calamari and some artichoke frittatas from the antipasti menu. The calamari was tasty and not over cooked, and the serving was the size of Cleveland. We never finished it. The frittelle al carciofi (artichoke fritters) were scrumptious and unique. What an interesting and creative use of artichoke. The spicey Mayo and marinara sauces were ordinary but fitting.  As it was brunch time, I had a Bloody Mary while she had their Sicilian margarita. Both were well executed. I chose the grilled asparagus salad for my main course. Nearly to die for. The asparagus was grilled just enough, crisp not mushy, beautifully presented, and the mixed greens were fresh, and the dried tomato pesto spiraled outside was rich. She had the Insalata Mista, a mixed greens salad with shrimp added. And she loved it. Since we'd indulged pretty heavily on the calamari and their incredible bread, Jeremy accommodated with a half size salad for her.  We'd intended to have a desert, but, since we'd been such greedy swine with the bread and artichoke fritters and calamari, we had to forego.   Trattoria Lisina lived up to their billing. Actually, they exceeded it. Well done, folks.

reviews.author: Scott D.
reviews.description: The only restaurant we visit on every trip to the Lone Star State of Texas. Beautiful Italian setting partially surrounded by vineyards with impeccable food that will more than please the palate.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: I made reservations for a girls day lunch and  was disappointed.  I've been here on several other occasion with food and waitstaff being spot on.  Today wasn't one of those days.   We were seated and immediately greeted by our waitress.  She left us with our menus  and within 2 minutes came back to as if we were ready to order.  We shared we hadn't had a chance to view the menu.  She returned within another few minutes, we had decided to order calamari to start with.  We ordered wine after the 4th time she stopped at our table.  We ordered our entree, she came by and asked if she could remove our plates as we're eating some of their delicious focaccia bread.  We let her know we were still working on it.  Another five minutes passed and she picked up the plates.  After about 10 minutes she came to see what plates she could remove.  This was how the rest of our lunch went. As for the food, the calamari was rubbery.  I had ordered pasta alla nino and the chicken seemed like it was a precooked fillet that been microwaved for too long with the pasta being hard on the ends.  They did right by taking it back and not charging me for it.  However, the waitress didn't ask if I'd prefer something else.

reviews.author: Mark K.
reviews.description: Lovely location for a date for anyone coming to Driftwood or living close by in the Buda/Kyle/S. ATX area. My wife and I came here for our anniversary a few months ago and loved it. Came back and brought some out of state guests and they loved it as well. Beautiful location, great food, and wonderful views if you're seated by a window. Service is always on point, and the staff is wonderful. Yes.. it is from the founder of Carrabba's, but this feels much more personable and more of a "pet project" on a winery - so don't go in with the mindset your getting chain Italian. Hint: the later you go, the fewer kids that are around, which lends itself to a more intimate dinner with less iPads.  As for the food - the lasagna is a favorite, and the artichoke fritters were excellent this go around. We always get the caprese and it's always so fresh, with wonderful burrata.

reviews.author: Marley D.
reviews.description: would not recommend, the owner knowingly harbored the  fugitive/insurrectionist Luke Coffee, aka the "High Five Cowboy" who assaulted Capitol Police with a crutch on J6. FTP.

reviews.author: Elle G.
reviews.description: We were traveling back home after a July 4th trip with our pup. It had just rained so we looked for a place that had outdoor seating.  The first time I was there I remembered picnic tables so we took a chance. There was already a line when we arrived at 11:30 am.  All of the outdoor tables were wet and no one was  eating outside. People were just standing around the picnic tables waiting to be called inside.  I asked the hostess if we could sit outside since we had the pup. She said due to the rain they didn't have any servers working the outdoor tabled so she recommended that we order to go and were welcome to use the picnic tables.  We had our waterproof picnic blanket with us so that was perfect.  Also, the picnic area was BYOB so my husband had a beer from our cooler before we got our meal.   We had the ribs and burnt ends plate with sweet tea.  The plate came with potato salad, coleslaw and baked beans.  The coleslaw hang a tangy taste as did the bbq sauce. We both really enjoyed our meal and will be back next time we're in the area.

reviews.author: Bailee C.
reviews.description: This place clearly has a cult following.   Not worth the wait or money.   The BBQ sauce is pretty amazing.   Sunday 12pm was a 90 minute wait for two people. We opted for a to go order. Took about 30 minutes. We ordered the brisket and ribs meal for $27. You would have thought the meat was top notch expensive stuff with how little they gave us. And to think, for $3 more (and 60 minutes more of a wait) we could have gotten all you can eat.  Thank God for the delicious BBQ sauce I poured all over the meat as well as the sides. If it wasn't for the sauce I would have thought I had Corona virus because this stuff had no taste.   I see reviews saying they only accept cash. We paid with a credit card. There was a minimum payment for alcohol though. I think it was $18.

reviews.author: Allison B.
reviews.description: Very good and decent sized combo plate for $20 or so.....the place is enormous and popular so when you see the lines at first you think you'll be waiting forever, but we only waited for 30 to 40 minutes and when we sat down service was very fast. It's BYOB or you can get wine or beer (I recommend lone star) in the cellar that's right next to the BBQ.

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Wow what a disappointment!  Brisket is hard and has its form it's so stiff!  Beans are like a can of ranch style, I thought with all the reviews this place was great.

reviews.author: Gwendolyn S.
reviews.description: Dillon (Dylan) was fantastic. He steered us well during our tasting and we went away with 3 bottles of excellent vino and a mixed 6-pack of beer.  We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves (even had a good laugh at the tipsy women imbibing). Wish we could have ordered wine at the restaurant though. I knew we wouldn't be able to finish a full bottle and still drive back to Austin so the wine stayed stoppered. My husband was able to enjoy a couple of his beers, so a win for him.

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: After eating delicious bbq next door my wife and I decided to do a little wine tasting. A charming western style building houses the wine tasting room.  There are little items for sale like candles and honey.  I tasted a few where one was too tangy for me but did pick up a bottle of Salt Lick Cellars BBQ White.    Outside will find tables under huge oak trees and games to play like bocce ball. This place is designated as over 21. Besides wine they sell buckets of beer bottles to enjoy.

reviews.author: Kristina I.
reviews.description: My fiance and I come here on a Thursday and the place was empty (just how we wanted it).  The bartender in the tasting room was very friendly and helpful.  We chose a bottle of wine that was a very reasonable price and finished most of it before we at next door. The grounds are pretty and there is plenty of seating!

reviews.author: Kyle R.
reviews.description: I've been to salt lick two times. I've been to Austin four times. The only reason I didn't go all four times is time constraint/ lack there of vehicle.   It's a nice drive out of Austin, getting a little taste of Texas hill country. Ideally I'd go to a swimming hole near by, then stop at salt lick for a great meal to finish the day.  Everything is delicious and it's an awesome atmosphere. Plenty of outdoor seating which makes it an even better experience.

reviews.author: Frank T.
reviews.description: The Salt Lick Cellars was a nice little bonus to our trip to The Salt Lick bbq. With a little bit of a wait ahead of us, we decided to walk over to the cellar for some beers. You walk down the sidewalk along side of the actual Salt Lick restaurant and drool as you see the other patrons inside eating their bbq.   As you enter the cellar you are faced with various wines wall to wall hut on the far left, their selection of beers. We looked over their beer selection and picked up 3 buckets of various beers including lone star and shinerbock. After grabbing our buckets, we enjoyed some on their benches outside. From there you can enjoy looking at their vineyard or play some bocce ball. Or you can walk back with your drinks back to the wait area to be seating.   Perfect side stop if you're looking for an adult beverage while you wait if you forgot to BYOB

reviews.author: Kristi H.
reviews.description: My review is tainted, I admit, but it is still valid.  What do I mean tainted?  Well, it was a girls weekend, we were soaked to the bone and freezing, unhappy/snippy tenders, and we were jammed in a tiny wine tasting room stuffed with other people trying to avoid the rain.  The fellow customers were likely just as unhappy as we were, but there was wine!  One note though - everyone else was just standing there, we were the only ones that were paying customers and we STILL got attitude.    Our least favorite tasting we did all weekend, but wines were good (not great).  Need to try again one day when there is great weather!

reviews.author: Kyle P.
reviews.description: This place has the best I mean theeeee best bison ribs and potato salad. Open seating for outdoor orders. There are 2 main buildings but the wait for a table was over an hour. Sat outside, food came out super quick. Even got to go in the back and check out where they smoke all the bbq. Authentic as it comes. Texas bbq. This places is BYOB there were even college kids with handles of liquor on their tables as if it was almost a daily event or something to do on the weekend. Atmosphere is cool and kid friendly but you can also have a great time in the winery. Definitely a must if you visit austin, it will not disappoint my meal was about $33 and this place is cash only. The ATM wasn't working so this was somewhat of an issue but we got it handled. Awesome bbq

reviews.author: Tasha K.
reviews.description: Best place I happened upon ever! We were leaving the Dutchman winery and looked over and saw a mass of people. My bf turned around and we decided to check it out. Such a great surprise: BBQ and wine! What's not to like? Beautiful grounds, lots of outdoor and some indoor seating. People from all walks of life enjoying the weather and listening to some good live music. BBQ was really good and came with all the fixings. Winery ladies were very approachable and helpful. So glad we stopped in. It made the day.

reviews.author: Jennie C.
reviews.description: Awesome selection of wine and beers, enjoy here or next door at salt lick bbq. Outdoor garden area and bar are amazing. So many flowers and greenery. Say hello to Maggie  cutest dog. Get the 6 pack of beer ($16)u can always take it home. Wayyyyy cheaper than $4 ea.

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: We went around 2 on a Saturday and as you could imagine, it was pretty busy, but we still got good  service. I mean what else do you do after a 6 mile walk  through the parks but stop for wine!   We got good service inside, both the woman that helped us and the younger guy behind the bar were very friendly and helpful .   We both did a wine tasting (I did the whites) and hubs did the reds. 5 tastings for 12$ which I thought was pretty reasonable. The Chardonnay they had was pretty good along with another I can't pronounce . Hubs enjoyed a couple of the reds as well.  Both left with a cup of white sangria while waiting for our food next door. It was a perfect day to enjoy it on the patio as well.   Would we take an Uber out from Austin just to go here, meh probably not. However, if you're in the area it's a great spot with friendly service. When we're back in the area with friends we'd go back.

reviews.author: Janelle M.
reviews.description: Pretty decent Texas wine. We did a tasting and we liked every wine we tried and bought the bbq red.

reviews.author: Will A.
reviews.description: Very good wine and tasting experience while waiting on a table to get BBQ. You can take a bottle of wine or beer from the cellars into the restaurant which is awesome!

reviews.author: Kevin W.
reviews.description: If you have a long wait and run out of beer, the cellars is a great place to get some beer.   Located on the same property as Salt Lick. Follow the path and you will see signs for the cellar.  Good selection of can and bottle beers.   6 pack - $14 - You can mix 2 different beers. Comes in an ice bucket and you can bring it to the picnic area at the Salt Lick while you wait.

reviews.author: Yilan Y.
reviews.description: Honestly so disappointed by the service and quality. We waited for a long time to get our six pack, then when we started drinking it, we noticed that the beer had a best by date of December 18th which was a week and a half ago. When I brought this to the bartender's attention, she said that she could only give us new beers if they hadn't been opened. She also said that the best by date didn't mean anything and brushed off my concerns. This is a quality issue. No restaurant or store should be charging full price or even selling goods past their best by date. I find this extremely upsetting as I've spent money on beer that should have been sold a week and a half ago. Also, we opened the beers but stopped drinking immediately after noticing the date on all the bottles. I don't think a cellar should be able to sell beer or wine past the best by date, and I'm sure no one wants to buy it either. Word of advice, check the date on the bottles before opening. Or better yet, don't bother waiting in the lines and spend your money elsewhere.

reviews.author: Tiffany S.
reviews.description: The deck and view are worth interacting with the lady who worked here. I came in and said I wanted to get a glass of wine to take back over to the restaurant. She said "Ok" and gave me a menu. I was a little surprised she didn't try to talk me through any wine options or tell me about the Winery off the bat. Just an OK and then she turned away to talk to another guy who worked there about "this lady they apparently both know who's daughter is so big now"...   Honestly I learned alot about that lady and nothing about their wines. Went with the chilled ros√©. After she'd already poured it she goes 'Oh! This is a dry bubbly, is that ok?' - It was, because I love dry champagne, so lucky us. I would have done a tasting if asked, I read on a sign they are $12. I probably would have bought a bottle if I had been able to pay for a tasting.   In short, the ros√© was in fact dry but really tasty. Service just dry.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: The Salt Lick BBQ restaurant does NOT sell alcohol but the Salt Lick Cellars, a 20 foot walk away through the courtyard, does. Five stars off the top for the Cellars being a kid free Zone. The rustic tasting room offers wine by the glass or bottle. Unlike the restaurant they do take credit cards. They allow you to bring your wine or beer back to the restaurant to have with your meal. The staff were super friendly. I had a bottle of Rose which was very nice.

reviews.author: Ayca U.
reviews.description: Great wines selection to try from, all gluten free.  Friendly service and highly recommend the charcuterie and cheese - great presentation   Clean and well kept Must try

reviews.author: Ria G.
reviews.description: I'd give this place 5 stars for the interior and overall vibe, but only 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the wine itself.   The atmosphere is lively with board games and great decor inside, and a food truck and lots of picnic tables outside for large groups.   However, my group ordered 2 different red wines and 1 sparkling white wine and felt that the wines were lacking in flavor and very watery. Maybe this is how Austin wine is, but if you're looking for deeper, richer flavored wine, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: Aditi P.
reviews.description: 10/10 holistically on this place. Everything from wine, environment and experience were on point. We had a group of girls in for a bachelorette and the service did not disappoint. The owners have an amazing story telling ability when it comes to their wine. The ambiance of interiors down to the charcuterie presentation is all thoughtful.

reviews.author: Sametra B.
reviews.description: Pretty laid back spot. A nice spot to grab a quick glass of wine with a friend or 2. For a locally ran winery, I'd say it's worth going for sure. The menu selection for cheese variations are subpar. We did try some octopus and squid, which was an interesting discussion over some glasses of wine. You can only imagine how these convos went lol! All in all, I highly recommend stopping in for an interesting glass or two. Cheers to more wine!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Ok so I accompanied my boyfriend to the brewery and distillery nearby, so of course we had to stop for the obligatory glass of wine for me.  I was not going to get any snacks, but their cheese and charcuterie board was calling my name.  We both got the tasting. Each of us got different wines. Our favs were the Tempranillo, Grenache and spaghetti western. You can get all your wines at once or one at a time. I suggest getting them all at once because staff can get busy.  The cheese and charcuterie board paired well with our wines and it was definitely the perfect snack. Loved the cheese selection. The bread sprinkled with olive oil made my day cause who doesn't love bread They have inside and outside seating available. Parking is onsite, but shared with other businesses.

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Went to Austin for a short solo trip and what a nice surprise. This place was so cool and chill. The service was great, the tables were well spread out, the flight and snacks did not disappoint.   I had the:  Friends with Benefits Opening Ceremony Gerwuz  Vermentino   All a selection of whites and sweets.   I would highly recommend this place to get a taste of Austin and also enjoy a quiet spot.

reviews.author: Stefany W.
reviews.description: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was just a nice place to relax, drink some wine and read a book which is exactly what I did. I came with a friend and we enjoyed trying all the various wine they had to offer.   They also apparently had a monthly oyster pop up which was fun. I ended up ordering some and they were delicious! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Krystle U.
reviews.description: My partner and I first found their wine at Travis Heights Wine and Spirits and fell in love w the malbec, so we decided to visit the winery. The first time we came here, they had a private event going on so that was sad. The second time, we got here a few hours early so they hadn't opened - that's our fault. Finally, our third attempt was fruitful!  The service here is super chill and on top of things. We 2 flights so we got to taste a good variety of samples. Great pours. We ended up leaving w one of their best bottles and now we're saving it for a special occasion.   We got (ranked from 'pour me another' to meh): *Violet Crown *Tempranillo Nuevo *Vermentino *Red-Nat *Picpoul *Piquette - this seems to be a star here but we personally hated it - tasted a bit like dilute pickle juice  A bottle we had before coming to this place was their Hill Country Rosso and that's still my favorite.  As far as COVID safety goes, the tables are super spread out, the staff wears masks at all times, and everything seems clean.   This place is super cool and what seems to be a hidden gem.

reviews.author: Jenni N.
reviews.description: Very cute tasting room within an industrial area. You would not think there would be a place like this there. The Yard is the location and they have several business including this winery, a distillery, a brewery, and a few other places. The wine was good and the cheese and charcuterie board was a good size. I'd like to give 5 stars, but we had to ask for napkins, no plates given either. It was also a bit messy inside. Not sure if they were re-organizing or what. But friendly staff, good wine, and cute space! I recommend a stop in!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I stopped here to enjoy some new wine and some pizza from Lil Nonna's. I made reservations on the way there. During the 'rona, it is recommended to ensure you can get a spot.   My hubby and I did a wine flight a piece. We tried all the reds, the rose, and white wine (Vermentino). We ended up buying a bottle of Malbec to take home which we both had enjoyed. Note, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.   I really like the atmosphere of the winery as it is inside a warehouse where they make their own wine and buy their grapes. The winery has a few things to eat or you can buy pizza from Lil Nonna's. The pizza takes awhile but you can always purchase online and set a date. If you are done at the winery you can also bar hope in the area for beer, cocktails, and whiskey.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: It's simple, if you're not pretentious and you like natural wine, you'll enjoy this place. Industrial spot located in the Yard, great natural lighting and some benches outside for the big groups. A truly gorgeous selection with some fantastic small plates as well- tinned seafood, quality cheeses and bread, etc. Always an enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Cameron N.
reviews.description: We each ordered flights. The staff was knowledgeable, quick, and polite which made the experience even better!

reviews.author: Alec B.
reviews.description: Awesome winery, love that it's so close to the city. All the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wine selection. They had several really good wines, my favorites were the Violet Crown and GSM.

reviews.author: Mike L.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our visit here,  the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.  A must visit when near b Austin.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: Star service and a non-judgmental space. I dig you, Austin Winery!  We decided on Austin Winery after we had plans to go to Spokesman next door for some beers. Unfortunately, Spokesman had an event going on that looked a little noisy and full for our study date, hence the change in venues. The winery was very spacious and lofty--I love that in an industrial winery! We asked if we could move a table (to plug in to their only one outlet--score!) and do some computer work with their wifi. The gal at the tasting room was fantastically wonderful. She gave us a large smile and told us to do whatever we wanted. Wonderful service alone will get me to come back. That's for sure.  We each got a flight of wine to try, and got down to it until they closed. They have a good selection of whites, rose's and reds, so fret not friends. All is provided. They also have some light bites like cheeses and charcuteries, so you can definitely go with that if you're hungry. The tastings were a little pricey compared to what you might get at a wine tasting out in the vineyards (I used to work in the industry), but you're paying for the convenience of being in South Austin and lots of space to hold conversations, play board games and just be with your groups. They have loads of seating and an upstairs area (that a Bachelorette party was using). Restrooms are clean and wifi is strong. We also walked home with some Brose (a hilarious take on rose especially because it was a women-lead winery effort). Clean, classy and airy space.

reviews.author: Kan C.
reviews.description: Cute place. Not a huge fan of the wines but the food was great.  Will try again ! Maybe my pallet was off

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: Very cool industrial spot. Lots of good wine options and there was a food truck. Good spot to visit during covid due to availability of outdoor seating

reviews.author: Shannon L.
reviews.description: This place has a great vibe and both indoor and outdoor seating.  The staff are friendly and knowledgeable.  Lil' Nonna's pizza truck is right outside of the door and has fantastic pizza - try the VBR!  The bummer is they only have Texas wines and I am not a fan.  I tried 5 different options and truly am not a fan.  I would love if they had other options.

reviews.author: Jeannine K.
reviews.description: Cool facility but overpriced with impatient staff that seemed unwilling to give any info on their wines.

reviews.author: Amy F.
reviews.description: Liked sitting outside to distance, but the benches were a little rickety. The inside had a great vibe - hope to come back when it's safer to be out and about!

reviews.author: Amy Q.
reviews.description: Super helpful and friendly staff and yummy wine options! We were able to taste several options and guided along the way.  Love this place!!!

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: Time to celebrate another birthday and boy I love this place. I want to go in a date and romance myself lol!!!!   You are allowed to bring in our own food and we bought plenty of bottles of wine and a cake to celebrate my girlfriend 35th birthday

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: I came here for a wine tasting with my sisters over the weekend.  The staff was friendly, conversational, funny, and engaging.  The wine was delicious and the charcuterie board was nice about $25.  They were bottling wine there in the store which was neat to watch and they would talk to customers about the process.  They have some cute instagramable conversation spaces for seating.

reviews.author: Genel M.
reviews.description: It's a lot of fun to go with friends, share  a cheese plate and trade sips from flights of wine. Good way to discover new wines.

reviews.author: Jessica E.
reviews.description: Such a cool joint! Went twice in one weekend! There are many choices and no headaches to go with the wine!

reviews.author: Kaila W.
reviews.description: I love this place! My friend and I decided to stop here on our way back to Austin after a long day of being in the sun and swimming at blue hole in Wimberley. We were a bit skeptical because of its limited reviews on yelp but I'm so glad we went and tried it out. Their wine is great, their flights are customized to your individual pallet, and their charcuterie board is to die for. If you go during the summer be sure to try their peach/apricot wine. I thought it would be way too sweet for my liking but it was a great refreshing summer drink! They are located in a small development that also has a few shops, a bakery, and Nate's coffee and cocktails right next to it... and we can't forget, this place is only two blocks from Louies barbecue

reviews.author: Hayley B.
reviews.description: Owner is very friendly and approachable. The inside is beautiful with huge windows and fun lounge furniture. They also have a patio! Loved the wine we tasted and had a good cheese board accompanying it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: Cool and casual atmosphere with lots of options.  From the very dry red to very sweet white and everything in between.   A tasting is reasonable and you can make your own menu or the Water 2 Wine team can put one together for you based on what you tend to like.  Then get a glass of your fave and hang out.  Cool casual atmosphere and a great way to start off any night!

reviews.author: Aubrey P.
reviews.description: So happy this place is here! Beautiful interior and great wine! Went for the first time this weekend, and recommend The Carrington for a wonderfully smooth red

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderfully off the beaten path.  I absolutely loved the modern space inside but also the very rural outdoor space. Wonderful areas for kids to play and adults to chill. Lots of great beer options for everyone no matter what your taste is. I tried the Everything is Aussome - an Aussie sparkling ale. It tasted a lot like an IPA to me. I may have expected it to be a bit lighter in taste but still a great bold flavor. Great for groups, family picnics, or just a fun day out to relax. Definitely worth the stop in the area.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Really like the venue and that they've completely opened back up. Looks like a great spot for a group event or private party.   Dog friendly. Plenty of parking. Seating inside and out. Small menu with plenty of Biergarten faves.   Just wasn't digging the beer this time. We did a couple of flights and sampled 8 different brews. The Blonde Ale was okay. Hubby and I both liked the Destination IPA. He likes the Dark Skies. Overall, the beer was a little off. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Danielle D.
reviews.description: Gorgeous brewery and hang out spot tucked away in dripping springs. We got brewmaster flights and a little meat and cheese board. The beers were good - and rotate so it encourages you to be repeat visitors. Absolutely worth the stop especially if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: This brewery should be on everyone's stop if your going to Salt Lick just down the road. Stopped here on Friday night and caught the tail end of their acoustic live music set which they happen to do every Friday night. They stage by far is the best set up I've seen In the area under a natural oak tree with twinkling lights scattered above. Could easily see this place being a great wedding venue. They also had a nice little hiking trail where there's additional seating and a kids playground located further down. Now let's talk about the beer and the brewery. The brewery is huge and has a nice modern approach with a little Texas flare. As far as beers I ended up trying a flight and by far definitely grab a Barton creek gold on a hot summer day. If your looking more of a full bodied beer destination ipa would be my choice. Can't wait to come back here once the weather starts to cool down.

reviews.author: Brenda G.
reviews.description: Came here for a friend's baby shower.  It's near Salt Lick and there was a short dirt driveway before the parking lot.  Our friends had an area reserved for the event but there seemed to be plenty of seating.  The service was great and it's a perfect location on a nice October day.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: I haven't found another brewery on the level of Jester King, but Vista brewing got the job done. It has a great location right by Deep Eddys and Salt Lick BBQ, which allows you to make a nice day trip out of it.  Starting with the service, my party and I were seated immediately and were served. For drinks, we ordered  1. Adair 2. Zwickled  All the beers were excellent, especially the Adair.  For food, we ordered  1. Pretzel  2. Brisket Sandwich   The food was also great and a lot better tasting than other breweries, for sure. I did think it was interesting to have brisket pastrami cold, but it was still solid.   Overall, I will definitely come back to the spot because they have great food and even better beer.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were on a long weekend vacation and went to Salt Lick for BBQ on a Sunday. (Amazing BBQ!)  We were looking for a tap room, since Texas doesn't let you buy beer beer before noon on a Sunday.  Vista has a huge outdoor seating area and they have a real good beer menu. I got two IPAs. They had snacks you can buy as well and I got a beanie and they had stickers if you ask.  Very nice people at the bar and lots of COVID appropriations were in place. Their free was was super good as well!  A really great place to try!

reviews.author: Ron U.
reviews.description: I wish I could give this brewery six stars, we absolutely love coming to Vista brewing. There is something there for everyone including the wine lover, most of these breweries only cater to brewing beer but Vista also has a good selection for wine. They always have cool food trucks with tasty items to round out A wonderful visit that you won't forget anytime soon. It also has a wonderful playground for kids and a band that's just the right amount for a venue like this. Bring your friends your family you're out of town cousins because this place is all that and a bag of chips.

reviews.author: Allie R.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this brewery! It is located on a huge plot of land with lots of room for games, swinging chairs in the trees and live music, making it the perfect place to hang (even with children). Awesome selection of beers. They also have food available.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday evening, was pretty easy to get a reservation and their patio had tons of open space. They did a great job of enforcing masks when people aren't seated at their table and made it easy for us to keep distance while in line.   Their beer selection is very diverse, so I opted for a flight in my first round. I was pleasantly surprised they allowed you to include their more expensive barrel series in the flight which made the 4 4oz pours for $12 a great deal. While those were tasty my favorite was the dark Pilsner, for such a dark beer it had a more mellow, malty flavor than you would expect.   Food wise it was fairly typical brewery fare, but the $1 hunks of watermelon really hit the spot on a hot August evening.   If you're looking for a brewery a little outside of Austin to escape the city for an evening I'd definitely recommend checking them out!

reviews.author: Sandi N.
reviews.description: Vista Brewing is one of the Breweries exempt from the new closed bar order (during Covid19) because of their food to alcohol¬† sales ratio.¬† We were excited to make a reservation for a special occasion and were assured (by way of Facebook messenger) that their "kitchen was open and ready for business".¬† ¬†We arrived, ready for some good beer and food.  First disappointment:¬† Their reservation check in system.¬† A chalkboard sign indicated a table for to-go order pick ups and simply an arrow for reservations.¬† No employee to greet, direct or be helpful.¬† 2 employees filling to go orders as we stood in what we estimated to be the 'reservation' line.¬† Several people were behind¬†us when 2 young women cut in front of us and said loudly "Will you take walk ins" and to our astonishment they got an employee's attention who completely ignored us and helped them get a table.¬† ¬†Very rude!  Once we were checked in we found a table in the shade and went to get our¬† beers and food.¬† ¬†Disappointment #2:¬† ¬†No food.¬† Only popcorn and a cheese plate.¬† That was it.¬† We told them we had been assured over messenger that their kitchen was open and they shrugged and said  "Don't know what to tell you.¬† It's being renovated."¬† ¬† ¬†I can't understand how they are allowed to stay open with¬†beer and POPCORN sales as food, under the Governor's new restriction.¬†  At this point we already had our beer so we went back to the table to make the best of it.  Disappointment #3:¬† ¬†the amount of flies and mosquitoes. We go out to another "farm style brewery" frequently and have never had an issue with flies or mosquitoes like we did here.¬† ¬†Maybe it's one brewery using a spray service vs. not?¬† Maybe it's dog¬†poop from being a dog friendly brewery (although, so is the other farm Brewery we go to...)¬† We had 4 mosquito bites while sitting there and this was at 5:00.¬† Flies were insane.  It was a disappointment all the way around as we had really been looking forward to several hours of relaxation, beer and food out under the trees.  Added on 7/11:  I have not changed a word of my original review, however I am adding a Star based upon the great communication I have had with one of the owners, Kent, who wrote to me after my original review.  He seemed genuinely interested in my feedback and responded in a very thorough manner.

reviews.author: Alex V.
reviews.description: First time ever at Vista! Also first draft beer (not Crowley/growler) since beginning of lockdown. Such a great spot.   COVID: Vista has a GREAT outdoor area with plenty of tables distanced from one another. The ordering process specifies 6 ft of distance in line. Hand sanitizer is everywhere. Beers are delivered in single use cups. They have also started their live music Fridays again where you can venmo the artist tips. Masks are required everywhere but at your table.  You can make a reservation on Open Table for their outdoor area. Currently, they are open until 8PM.  We brought our own chairs and a blanket to use as a tablecloth. We also brought our own glasses to pour the beers into. I love beer out of a glass so this was a need for me.   Overall: This brewery has a ton of good stuff going for it. It's a little out of the way for Austinites (40 minutes), so you've got to make a night out of it. We're generally bigger IPA fans, so there are a few breweries we would check out ahead of this one. BUT they still have a ton of great beers on tap, and it is so worth checking out.

reviews.author: Alena D.
reviews.description: My husband and I love vista brewing! The owners are so friendly, it's family friendly and they follow covid guidelines so we felt very safe. We love sitting indoors and outdoors depending on the weather and like that we have that option. They have live music on weekends and the beer/wine selection is good. Pre-covid their food was farm to table and delicious. We're anxiously awaiting the return on their standard food items. Definitely a great place to check out!

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Come for the beer, don't stay for the food.   We came here for the first time and ordered a bunch of food and beer. The beers are good. The food is not. I didn't realize the current menu is because of covid. The sandwiches were all cold. The pimento cheese dip was good but hard because it's also cold. Literally everything came out of the fridge as they handed it to us.   It was a terrible first impression. I understand it's covid, but I think they could've at least heated the sandwiches or tried to make some better food that can be packaged.   Great venue. Not sure I'll come back.

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Big fan of Vista. We didn't get to experience their food as they are doing snacks only for now. I recommend bringing food as the snacks aren't great, but I recognize they're doing their best given COVID.   The beer is pretty good though and they have a good variety with their more evergreen beers like kolsch, pilsners, steam beer, IPAs, etc. The other half of the beer selection are collaborations they'll do with a lot of ales and they have a saison on top as well.   You can't beat the environment either. You're in a beautiful forest with a ton of outdoor seating. Great for kids; there's a playground way in the back too. They'll bring in good live music on a few days. Looking forward to trying to food when things open back up.

reviews.author: Garnie B.
reviews.description: Had a school event there and it was great.  Plenty of seating in and out.  lots of room for the kids to run about and having a great staff about was wonderful.   only ding was the coordination / distribution of food.  Basically they ran out for our guests, and well, there is nothing you can do about it.   Events are hard to plan for, especially with family and kids, so we will work with them next time to better handle the food service / serving.   The beer was good, the wine selection was pretty good.   What i liked the most was the atmosphere. on a cool evening, with the stars out, it was a great place to be to unwind and chill with friends / family.    Plenty of parking..   Finding the place...well, thats tricky.  See punch in the address in Google Maps, you will be ok, just know that when you get close, slow down, and know the entrance is on top of a hill ... so you can miss it if you are not paying attention.   will I go back: of course, and I would recommend you go and visit.

reviews.author: Ed G.
reviews.description: Friday afternoon at the Vista Brewing pop-up at the galleria!  Perfect weather, perfect pour!  Check it out!

reviews.author: Peter H.
reviews.description: The pop up location at Bee Cave Galleria refused service to me because I have a health condition that prevents me from wearing a mask. Congress passed Public Law 88-352 (78 Stat. 241). The Civil Rights Act of 1964 prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex or health condition.   Violating my civil rights is illegal and immoral and no public business can make a rule that overrides states and federal law. Imagine if Vista Brewing company refused service to a black or gay persons. This is exactly the same situation and they deserve a lawsuit.   There is no law in Texas or the USA that enforces a mask wearing policy. None. Period. No law allows a business  to ignore The Civil Rights Act of 1964. That is federal civil rights legislation that prohibits discrimination in numerous settings including: employment, education, voting, and public accommodations.  No law exists in Texas or USA that enforces mask wearing. No business may ignore SEC. 201. (a) All persons shall be entitled to the full and equal enjoyment of the goods, services, facilities, and privileges, advantages, and accommodations of any place of public accommodation, as defined in this section, without discrimination or segregation.   Corporate lawyers of Starbucks, Whole Foods, HEB, Home Depot, Lowe's and others allow those of us who are medically exempt. They know the law and don't want to be sued for civil rights violations. I shop there all the time maskless and have no issues.   Places of public accommodation are forbidden to violate state and federal law. Not obeying the laws from ignorance or self righteousness doesn't change the law. Businesses can't make laws.   My suggestion is - get educated on your legal responsibilities if you own or run a business of public accommodation. Wanting to have your costumer's safety is admirable but when that crosses the line to breaking the law, that's a line nobody may cross.

reviews.author: Jennifer T.
reviews.description: Unfortunately drove an hour and a half to find out they were closed for a sold out event.  We looked at the website before making the trip where there was no mention of this event.  Please update your website!

reviews.author: Kiki H.
reviews.description: The temporary location in Bee Cave is horrible. Very rude staff. Some beef jerk named M a t t is the reason I will never go back.  Tip: Don't waste your time or money for overpriced fruity flavored beer served with an attitude. There are plenty of other places within a few hundred feet at the Hill Country Galleria that provide better service than Vista Booing.

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.    The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalape√±o. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Sarah H.
