reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Garrett F.
reviews.description: Definitely go during the week no crowds. Get as many flights as your table can handle. Upgrade your first drink to get the mason jar!  Merch area needs works, better options, pricing. Looks like the area was an afterthought.  Overall we had a great time. No tours still, Covid.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: ‚ÄºPSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!!‚Äº HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Our Jeep club organized an event at this establishment, anticipating a fun and enjoyable experience.  Wrong!  I will preface that this whole COVID thing has still, for some reason, has some still on edge.  However, this place has taken it to new heights.  While the great state of Texas has opened to 100%, this place seems to have missed that memo.  We literally got yelled it for actually standing up at our tables and told that if we do stand to have a mask on.  Additionally, we got yelled at for moving a table.  The guys exact words were "I'm picky where our furniture is placed."  Additionally, if you want to get a beverage, you actually have to MAKE A RESERVATION just to go in get one.  That is ridiculous!  By the way, the Hays County police are on site to enforce all of this over-the-top nonsense.  Most of us stayed for a single drink and then left for better and more fun pastures.  It's obvious that this place has forgotten all about who the consumer is and how we should be treated.  Not only will we never go back, but I am never going to purchase any of their products again.  By the way...the Jeep community here in Texas is very tight-knit and we will talk...

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: This was nice and the drinks were great. It was crowded so keep that in mind and call ahead. No one was wearing masks...including myself. Normally, I would though and as an afterthought, I probably should have.  Just FYI, whatever your choice.

reviews.author: Deeah K.
reviews.description: Had been wanting to try this winery for awhile since it is close to where we vacation on Canyon Lake. The gal that runs it is very sweet and hospital.   The inside tasting room is a tad bit shabby and small. We went outside on the deck and they have lovely views but only one side is shaded, the other side has a retractable awning but they did not open it so it was roasting hot.   While there we tried their Cabernet Sauvignon and unfortunately it was not memorable. I was going to give this winery a two-star but the views and the staff are sweet, so I bumped it up a star.

reviews.author: K R.
reviews.description: It appears this place is no longer in business.  When we arrived at the address it was a gate to someone's house.  The picture on Instagram looked really cool so we were hoping for a glass of wine, some food, beautiful views, and fun photos to share.  The owner should update the address if incorrect.  If they're closed, please update the information on Yelp.

reviews.author: Corynne G.
reviews.description: Detour and come see 20+ years in the making!  The couple that runs the vineyard are the kindest and warmest souls you'll come across. They're remarkably acknowledgeable of wines, you won't regret it! One of the best stops I've ever made!

reviews.author: Linda R.
reviews.description: Need an appointment apparently .......not sure until we got there and it was closed.

reviews.author: Sara J.
reviews.description: Amazing vineyard with an awesome wine selection and gorgeous views. Will for sure be back again!

reviews.author: Tara M.
reviews.description: Fawncrest is a boutique winery off the beaten path between Austin and San Antonio. Thanks to the people at Canyon Gorge we discovered this hidden gem in the Hill Country!   The proprietors do everything from crushing and pressing to making their own labels and they consider their wine "holistic". They produce only dry wines with no preservatives or additives and is sulfite free.   Patty gave my friend and I and our dogs a tour and tasting on a Sunday when we stumbled upon the vineyard. But, the official tasting hours are Noon - 7PM on Saturday and by appointment.   If you like a dry Merlot I recommend Fawncrest.

reviews.author: Yolanda G.
reviews.description: As the BF and I found ourselves taking care of business in Canyon Lake, I thought it would be awesome to check out a local Texas Hill Country winery. Seeing that there were only 2 in this town, we went for the one that was closer to where we were. GPS landed us in a neighborhood of houses which confused us as we were used to visiting wineries with long pebble stone roads filled with vineyards and an entrance sign. Don't expect that here as the tasting room is truly located in the owner's house! We were definitely thrown off and nervous to approach a house with two dogs in the back yard fence for fear of being shot for trespassing, but luckily, there is a small sign on the front of the house providing directions to walk around to the back and enter in the sliding glass doors. We ended up in the small cozy tasting room which is an extension of the owner's house and were welcomed with open friendly arms. The McNeil's are the sweet couple that owns the small vineyard. One side of the house has a sit and sip porch that has a view out onto the lake and the 4 rows of grapes. The tasting room is air conditioned with a TV that we found ourselves watching football with the owners and playing with their big puppy. The free wine tasting was the icing as we got to try all of their wines and have a second sample of our favorite. They make a delicious Chardonnay which is aged with both French and American oak chips. They also have a Cab Sav, a Cab Franc, a Merlot, and a red blend of 3 grapes called The Meritage. We loved the relaxed charming atmosphere and the selections of wines this vineyard had to offer. BTW, there is an outside tasting bar that they have to host larger groups which is nicely covered to block the hot sun in case you're wondering. We left this little charming simple vineyard with a large smile, 3 bottles in hand, and another fond memory to add to the book.

reviews.author: Ly D.
reviews.description: Located between New Braunfels and San Marcos is a beautiful and quaint little gem named Gruene ("Green"). Gruene Historic District is embellished with historic buildings, antique stores, specialty shops, quirky restaurants, and beautiful landscapes. It is small enough to walk by foot, but big enough to discover new things to do and see for an entire day. There are restaurants for coffee, pecan candies, ice cream, and even pickles! And there are shops for toys, unique t-shirts, plants, and pottery. The possibilities are endless.  There are a few unconventional hotel and cottages conveniently located nearby that are walk-able distance. Otherwise the drive from New Braunfels is about 10 minutes. I came here on a Sunday and there were quite a few people walking around, but it wasnt so crowded that I couldn't feel a breeze. There are also plenty of street and parking lots scattered throughout, but there is a main lot located near Got Toys and Typsy Gypsy.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: This area is the CUTEST and perfect spot for a little day trip. All the locals we met were super friendly and were very excited to have us out of towners stop by. I love old historic buildings and this is the perfect place to come learn some history and see how well they preserved their town. Tons of restaurants, wineries, and little shops to explore. I wouldn't say it's necessarily kid friendly but a nice romantic getaway or girls trip would be perfect here. Everything is within a five minute walk of each other which was nice.  Parking was easy for us to find, the biggest parking area we found was behind the grapevine winery so I would head there first before wasting time circling in front of the store you wanna go into.

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: This is my favorite old town in Texas.  It makes me so happy every time I go.  From vintage style stores, cowboys, great wine, live music, floating the rivers, blue bell ice cream, and all of old Texas nostalgia... I won't go a year without coming back.  Stay wonderful Gruene!

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Gruene was once a Ghost Town...   ... I remember it well ...   Gruene is now the place to see AND to be seen  Dance, Drink, Sing, Sleep, Shop, Eat, and People Watch

reviews.author: Liliana M.
reviews.description: What a great little place to visit and possibly stay at one day. Lots and lots to do from nice shopping to enjoying a great glass of chilled wine!

reviews.author: R N.
reviews.description: Too much traffic and too noisy (not talking about the music). I was born and raised in New Braunfels and now live only 20 minutes from the city. We come to Gruene often, to shop and/or eat. Recently we stayed for a couple of nights during the week just for a get away. We stayed at the Gruene Mansion Inn which was fantastic. Gruene itself, however was awful. I walked early in the morning and it was like walking on the side of the freeway. The traffic was non-stop, including big trucks. Cars were moving fast. I had to run to cross the street, in between cars, no one stopped. After my walk (probably around 0800), I headed back to my room and noticed that there were lawn workers cleaning at Gruene Hall with leaf blowers. At around 0930, we walked to go shop and they were still blowing leaves at all the shops in the area......lunch at Mozie's......still blowing. Tried to go back to our room at 1300, still blowing. My husband tried to take a nap at 1430, couldn't because of the leaf blowing. It was ridiculous! Not so cozy or peaceful.

reviews.author: Cheryl J.
reviews.description: Gruene is such a wonderful,  cute and fun town! Great restaurants,  a ton of fun and cute shops, tastings for wine and olive oils! I just can't get enough of Gruene! Would be a dream to live and work here! This was our 2nd girl's trip here and can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: It's always fun to visit during Market Days (3rd weekend of the month). You can always find some cute, original arts and crafts or some yummy local food (i.e. honey, Chicken vindaloo, etc.).  It can get crowed and you may have to be patient while looking for a parking spot, but fun nonetheless.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: It's pronounced, "Green" Gruene is a historic district outside of New Braunfels, along the Guadalupe River. It's an old Civil War era cotton town that was once somewhat of a ghost town. It's bounced back with tourism!  Gruene is a place to go to hang out for an afternoon, and take in the antique shops along Gruene's main street. They also have a wine sampling spot. The Gristmill is a great place to get some German food, and then head to Gruene Hall for some live music at Texas' oldest dance hall.  Gruene, Texas was founded in the 1840's by German settlers. The entire area is all German. The downtown area is mainly made of old brick buildings that have been restored. They're cool architectural designs that make up the shopping district. During Gruene Market Days, local vendors come out for a public market in the streets. As far as I know, you can't really go tubing through Gruene, as it's a bit out from all the tubing spots. The water comes rushing through here, and it seems like it might be difficult to tube it here. Try closer to downtown New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Alice C.
reviews.description: i really enjoyed visiting gruene!  i think with the combination of gruene hall and gristmill restaurant, it creates the perfect atmosphere and ambiance to relive historic days.  everything is perfectly landscaped.  and a quick walk down towards the bridge gives you a gorgeous view of the river and tubing.  it's not a large area, but they employed traffic police to help pedestrians cross.  parking situation is also really well managed with street parking and lot parking!

reviews.author: Brad F.
reviews.description: We just keep coming back every year! Love it.  Customer service and friendly environment

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: Beautiful area! Very picture worthy shops and old fashion signs everywhere. Many good places to eat. I happened to stop by during a Festival of some sort with live music, BBQ and beer. This place is a must see and visit.

reviews.author: T T.
reviews.description: Super crowded this last Sunday afternoon and the traffic control officer was just about the rudest person I have experienced in a long time. He clearly hates his job and wants everyone to know it. He will be my reason for not returning to the area.

reviews.author: Ron M.
reviews.description: Nothing quite like visiting Gruene as a getaway from the big city.  Although you will get your traffic jams and crowds on a busy weekend.  But it's a nice cool, overcast day. Shops, food, wine. . . enough to make everyone happy.  If you've never visited, do.  If you've visited before, what's taking you so long to come back?  I promise you'll find something to enjoy.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: About 45 minutes outside Austin.  Gruene is my new favorite getaway from it all weekend day spot.  My friend and I were early coming back to Austin from a weekend getaway in San Antonio on a Sunday afternoon.  Being newish to the area I wasn't familiar with Gruene.  We saw the highway signs advertising Gruene, and usually my curiosity gets the better of me and I will find myself driving out to these places that end up being nothing.  However, Gruene is the first time the signs haven't lied.  My friend and I fell in love instantly with the magic of Gruene's historic wooden downtown main street buildings.  There is something for everyone here,  restaurants and cafes galore, an amazing historic music hall that has some fantastic bands regularly playing, little boutique shops, a winery, a wine tasting room highlighting the best of Texas wines + a couple of beers on tap, numerous adorable BandB's, outdoor market days highlighting local artisans, and of course the token water tower.   I recently spent an afternoon here enjoying the market days, tasting great food, and sipping some great wine.    Time moves a bit slower here, and even though you are 45 minutes from home, you are on a mini holiday.

reviews.author: Kat C.
reviews.description: Great town to visit. It has something for everyone. If your in the mood to eat and drink, you have many options. If your in the mood to shop, the choices are endless of selection of stores to check out. Great place to go see a show and enjoy. Worth a trip to eat, drink, and be merry.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Great historic spot to wander around.  Many interesting shops and restaurants/bars to visit.  Enjoyed ourselves !!

reviews.author: R G.
reviews.description: Gruene is a fun town to walk around, has great shops and plenty of places to get a snack or have lunch. It was a nice addition to my visit to Austin.

reviews.author: Anita C.
reviews.description: Nestled in New Braunfels this is a great place to people watch, taste some wine, eat good food and hear live music. A few times a month they have something called Gruene Market Days where artists/bakers/creators of all things hand crafted come out and sell their goods.  Restaurants like Gruene River Grill, Grist Mill, Adobe Berde and La Cantina offer great dining and nice views. Gruene Hall is a must stop! Lots of antique shops too. Parking can be hard but be patient and something will open up.

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: Gruene is one of the most beautiful, quaint towns I have ever seen. There is so much new construction of new shopping centers, which look like little Bavarian villages, new homes, upscale condos, and of course quaint gift shops, restaurants, and coffee houses.  The bikers love to make it one of their pass through routes, as well as the snowbirds, and river/tube crowd. Come to Gruene for all your antique hunting, shopping, drinking, and even visit one of the many winerys that have daily wine tastings.

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: I wonder if it's a new winery. The parking lot isn't as big as others but the space is very nice, benches and tables under trees. The inside is small because it's in a cottage so there's a sign saying one group at a time. The wines are from California. You can do a flight for $15 or a glass. We all chose a glass (8oz pour) whereas a tasting is 6 oz. loved our reds. There's a sculpture garden to stroll. Lovely place for convo. Also we tried the fat boy cheese spread w ritz crackers and it's so good!

reviews.author: April K.
reviews.description: We had a very pleasant experience at Parmeson! The wines are super high quality and very enjoyable. We had the Rose and the Sauvignon Blanc, both of which were outstanding. Tom and Katie are wonderful hosts and the garden setting is a delightful place to pause and relax. Highly recommended spot for fellow enophiles! We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Natasha Z.
reviews.description: Charming little boutique place and a convenient stop on the way to Fredericksburg. However perhaps I will be a bit biased coming from California and having tried some of the best wines, the wine here is not something for a refined wine pallet. It's a cute little spot to check out and try out but not something that would leave you wanting more. Sauvignon Blanc was the best choice of the flight and the others did not leave me too excited.

reviews.author: Jeff A.
reviews.description: Stop by and see Tommy at Parmeson Wines!!!  Super wine at nice prices too...  all good but I really enjoy the red zin, Pinot and the rose in summer time!   The new Alberino is very good!! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: I keep meaning to post a review for this winery. My husband and I visited them a few weeks ago to celebrate a recent job interview. They have only recently opened up, so we had never heard of them before and were excited to try them out. They had a very cute tasting room with nice stone that also felt very homey. The tasting was $20 and you get to try 6 wines. $20 still feels a bit hefty for a tasting in Central Texas for me, but their pours were pretty generous and you're not being served by someone who looks like a teenager who couldn't care less about your experience (like what Becker has become). All of these wines are from Sonoma. Overall, we didn't love the tastings except for the Zinfandel and the Cabernet which were absolutely outstanding, but I don't typically love lighter-bodied red wines or most reds from Sonoma. The quality is great, but a few of the prices were just slightly higher than what we can personally justify - I absolutely loved the Cab but it was $60. The Zinfandel was more affordable at $39. Their Wine Club gives you 20% off purchases which is nice, but it is a 6-bottle quarterly shipment.¬†The winemakers are the Parmesons themselves and we had the pleasure of getting to chat with them while we did our tasting. They are a wonderful couple who were very welcoming and lovely to chat with. We loved hearing their story of how they got into winemaking. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: I went in there without my husband looking to get him some good beer, I know nothing about beer-- at all. Just the type he likes.   I got the 6 pack (and got a % off for buying a pack) and brought them home. My husband LOVED the nitro beer I got him. I also got my mother in law a coffee ale. She said it was the best beer she had ever had and she doesn't even like beer. My father in law drank the White Stout. He said it was phenomenal.   Hats off to the owner, for helping me pick out the best beer. And hats off to this store for carrying such a great variety and quality of product! It was amazing!

reviews.author: Brandy B.
reviews.description: I am new to the area and wanted to check this place out and grab a dry cappuccino after pizza yesterday, Monday October 18th around 7pm. I was unenthusiastically greeted by a girl who acted as if I was bothering her by coming into get coffee. I was asking her questions about the place and what they had and she was incredibly rude and continue to answer my questions with one word answers. No smile ever came across her face and she really made me feel uncomfortable as I was just trying to get some information about the store. My family is really big on cigars /coffee/ whiskey and I was very disappointed in the customer service or lack of customer service. I decided to push through and continue with ordering a coffee and when I asked her for a dry cappuccino she proceeded to roll her eyes and told me she didn't know how to make it and asked me what a dry cappuccino was. When I asked her "isn't this a coffee place?" she said "I don't know how to make the coffee I just push the buttons". As somebody that has been a barista and worked at a coffee shop I tried to explain to her how to make it and she just increasingly became annoyed with me. I decided to scratch the dry cappuccino just ordered a double shot of espresso which was awful by the way. As I continued to try to make small talk it was very apparent that I was not welcome there. I even asked her if she wasn't having a good day because of the way I was being treated. As I was paying, I asked her if there was a place that I could leave a review for the store she looked me dead in my eyes and said no. I confusingly asked her, " oh you don't have a Yelp?" She straight up told me no. As somebody that has worked in customer service I have got to say this is the worst customer service I've ever experienced and I would never treat a customer the way that I was treated. I just hope that the owners can see this and know what goes on in their store when they're not there because if I was the owner of the store I would want to know about one of my employees making people feel very uncomfortable And not being helpful at all. I made several attempts to try to turn this experience around and give her the opportunity to create a pleasant experience for me but she just acted like I was interrupting her day of sitting on the stool behind the counter. Customer service was awful coffee was awful she didn't even know how to make a dry cappuccino. If I were you I would steer clear of this place it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Houston R.
reviews.description: WOW!  SO much to choose from!!!  Steve is amazing at helping choose something if you are new or even a novice of cigars, wine, beer and coffee.     Clean, well stocked and excellent customer service. Floor to ceiling stocked with variety!  Something for everyone!  Get your gifts done here!  Cheers!

reviews.author: Dan A.
reviews.description: They have about a billion craft beer brands and types. The carry an assortment of cigars. (I don't smoke though). The gentleman behind the counter, Steve, is super knowledgeable about his beers and stogies. If you enjoy the nicer things, here is your place.  Better pricing than other places on both beer and cigars.   This place intentionally protects it beers and cigars from harmful UV light by putting reflective tint on the front windows and the right amount of illumination inside. That shows seriousness in what they do.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: Great customer service. I came for a wedding and was able to find a nice selection of wine from Texas wineries as well as California wineries. Thebseems to have a lot of great cigars everywhere, and the humidors were in great condition. I would definitly come back!

reviews.author: Adrian H.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Great for picking cigars and beers, coffee is really good too. Look forward to going back for more supplies

reviews.author: Alison K.
reviews.description: Great espresso!   Very nice place. Easy stop for great coffee and an excellent beer selection.

reviews.author: Wesley F.
reviews.description: Stopped in after my haircut next door, because I got 10% off after showing my receipt as a promotion, since it just opened. The staff was very courteous and professional; additionally, the store was well stocked with everything, especially different types of sodas from Texas. I would highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a variety of beers, cigars, coffees, wines, and sodas. I am definitely going back soon to get more of the soda!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Great craft beer selection and love the idea that I can pick and choose what beers make up my 6pk. Nothing worse than buying a whole 6pk of a beer that you don't like and then stare at the next 5 cans.

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: My wife and I went to Bella Vista Ranch for a 4th of July tour with lunch, and we found it to be terrific value for the money. There was a nice lunch from a food truck (the name of which eludes me, unfortunately) followed by an interesting talk about the history of olive oil and the origins of the Italian family farm dating back to the second century BCE. The owner explained how he established Bella Vista on the ancient Roman model and described the modifications he has made to make olives grow in Texas. Then we toured the olive orchard and learned about the different varieties of grapes grown on the property. We saw the processing room containing the "frantoio" or olive press as well as the vats where this year's wines are aging. We then tasted several oils as well as four glasses of wine per person. All this for $25 (the regular tour without lunch is only $15).  Oils, vinegars, wines and soaps are available for sale. These are pretty expensive (e.g. $18+ for 250ml of their basic Texas Blend oil), but I don't mind paying those prices for high-quality locally produced specialty goods. This is a fascinating day out, which I recommend wholeheartedly.  Pro tip: If you're coming from San Antonio, take I-35 instead of US 281 and the back roads. We were expecting a relaxing drive in the country, but construction and traffic made it a stressful trip. Coming back on 35 was a joy by comparison!

reviews.author: Ann S.
reviews.description: So, so rude. The olive oil and vinegar are excellent, but the experience was ruined by the lady--the one everyone complains of here. The hours on Sunday are until 4. I get there at 3:25, and she walks past me with her whiny, demanding voice telling me that they close at 3:30. Uh, wanna put that on your website as your updated hours?  I went in anyway. The gentleman doing the oil tasting was knowledgeable and helpful. He told the lady to close the gate.  You know, what a non-stupid person would do should they slothfully decide to close early since they dont work for a living.  My mother was incredibly upset by this lady's rudeness. When you run a service like this, you stay open until you no longer have a good flow of customers. Closing is at 4? Hi, if a bunch of people are coming in at 3:30 thru 4:00, you keep working. Lazy Texas people who inherited their property and think they work hard by paying others to harvest their crop and bottle it. Meritocracy, right? They are the class of people who make this state an impoverished mess.    Don't run a customer service business dependent upon people stopping by on a lark like a fascist regime. You don't get to do that. Then again, when you dont have a legitimate concern about how you pay your bills, i guess you can just work until you get bored with the whole work thing.   Go sell wholesale if you hate customers. Working for yourself does not mean you get any more freedom. You have are dependent on good will. And you don't have mine.  The lady tried to make up for her garbage attitude when i made my purchase. You know what? Have a blessed day, lady. A.BLESSED.DAY.  Tl;dr. There are other puveyors of Texas olive oil, particularly in south Texas. Do not waste your wine tasting trip here. If you want to support local, consider others who are hard-working enough to sell their products in Central Market.

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: I will never recommend this place to ANYONE! The main older lady was very rude to my parents, as well as the other couple in front of us. I regret not reading the reviews before coming here because everyone is saying the same thing. We did a wine tasting (which was $10) and were barely served anything. My husband and I both left this place wondering how they are still in business. The wine was super expensive (not good at all), and they have horrible customer service. Listen to these reviews, people!

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: Very limited services. I walked in to see if this facility was appropriate for sitting outside for a tasting. I was immediately met at the door because there was a "tour" in progress. There was no other option other to join the tour that was already in progress. The woman that met me right at the door was very un-hospitable.   The inside smells absolutely delicious, full of olive oil.  The grounds were beautiful.

reviews.author: Marina R.
reviews.description: Worst service ever. Mistreated. Was watched the entire time. Before I could even ask a question about the wine or olives, an employee firmly told me as she was finishing up with another set of customers that "I don't have time to answer your questions."  She then proceeded to hard sell our group to pay $10 for the "last minute" tour. And, to add insult to injury, as 2 of the 4 of us completed their purchases, both employees proceeded to exit the store and watch us walk to our vehicle and  drive off. I will never spend a dollar at your business.  Good luck to you.

reviews.author: Jennifer B.
reviews.description: Such a great tour. We failed to check the tour time and arrived a little late but they let us join the tour and tasting. It was terrific! The tour and history of olives was really interesting. Definitely try the balsamic and infused oils. The wine tasting was pretty brief compared to the olive portion but great none the less. The wines are dryer, not sweet. I thought they were great. A lot of the other local wineries wines are very sweet, but I really enjoyed these! You should absolutely plan to visit if in the area.

reviews.author: Krystle M.
reviews.description: Amazing olive oil. Wine was good but pourer was either grumpy or just to the point?! 5 samples, but we shared a tasting. Not worth the $10 as the pours were barely a "splash." You couldn't enjoy the swirl sniff taste ...

reviews.author: Kerry C.
reviews.description: We went here twice. The first time we went we had a group of 6 and showed up about 15 minutes before they closed. The guy there suggested we go to another place. He just didn't want to serve us so we left.   The second time we went there were 4 of us and it was in the middle of the day. While the wine is fine, the server was the single most rude person I've ever encountered at a winery. Just astounding how she could be that rude for the duration of the wine tasting. I will never go back and suggest no one ever go there. You cant drink the wine fast enough to over come they workers rudeness.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: We liked the olive oil a lot.  However... I think the "thorn" of this place is the owner.  He seems rather joyless in making something that could ideally fulfill the soul.  His 1 1/2 hour (yes, it's long) "tour" is mostly comprised of the history of the Olive, snarky political opinions, braggary of his past career in Silicone Valley, and a hatred for Texas AandM.   Not a place to take a kid. Seriously.  We sat and listened to him for well over an hour then briefly stood under two olive trees, looked at another one that was hurt in a storm, looked at the press machinery, and then did a "tasting." Like I said, the oil was good. I got the impression that the lady helping in the gift shop/tasting room didn't want to be there either. Basically I was confused why this man (and his 5th wife...no lie) were running this business and opening it to the public.  I walked away a little sad that something so wonderful like successfully growing beautiful trees to make a solid product could be reduced to something so joyless.

reviews.author: Alana C.
reviews.description: We were warned at great length that we could not even look at our cell phones during the tour which seemed odd when people might have a kid or babysitter or be waiting on something important from work to come through--I mean we are all adults...but I soon found out why.  Far less than an entertaining traditional tour, you sit and listen to someone talk more like a college class lecture, but with way too many rabbit trails of information that eventually make you tune out.  Like what a certain blizzard is called in different parts of the world, how accounting dates back to the Romans, etc.  I am passionate about olive oils and wine but learned too much about history and every other subject to even focus on what I wanted to know about olive oil. Or feel entertained.  The group I was with concurred.   There are 3 types of learners: auditory, visual, and tactile and the class is entirely sit and listen to one man talk for half of it then stand and listen by a tree then a press for the other half. So only appealing to auditory learners. And no audience engagement during the lecture.  At the end you actually get to see and touch. But they had no bread for us so we had to drink an olive oil and talk about it for 30 more minutes so I left before I tasted the other flavored oils as it had already been a full day of just listening to way too much info to retain.  In a very strict manner rather than entertaining with audience engagement.  And strict rules.  Obviously people tune out and begin looking at their cell phones so that's why they don't allow them.  Rather than making the tour entertaining so you dont' want to--It was in the hot sun as well so it was pretty miserable.  The olive oil was good but I've had better, it was a bit weak to me, we did the wine tasting as well and those were not acceptable to me.  I actually would recommend skipping the tour and talking to the staff as you taste the olive oil because they knew all of the information given on the tour without the lengthy side notes of things that should be shaved off for entertainment value.  And that's really the best part.    I don't think they like people very much though to be honest.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Who here likes an hour and a half talk ab everything I ever learned ever?? If you raised your hand then step right up, produce $15 and hold on to your hat!  It went on so damn long I wanted to ask for a hall pass just to sneak to my car.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: A hidden mecca of olives.  In central Texas.  The Bella Vista Ranch was designed as a traditional Italian family farm and features the first commercially grown olives in Texas.  And the olives I sampled are Texas size and Texas good.  Apparently the crowd favorite is the bleu cheese stuffed olive.  We sampled a garlic stuffed olive that was really good.  The ranch also offers delicious balsamic vinegars and olive oils which go for around $17 a bottle.  My lips slurped the Fig Vanilla Balsamic over and over again.  I am sure I was sample cheating but that stuff is incredible.     This is also a working winery that produces several red and white varieties plus a Natural Blackberry Wine!  Yum.  Wine tastings are $5/per person.  I think the owner has a great thing going for him and a beauty of a property. Tours of the orchard happen on the weekend and include a wine tasting for $10/per person.

reviews.author: Jim L.
reviews.description: I can't believe only 5 people have reviewed this ranch. I have been back four times now and each time come away with a little more understanding of the narrative that is offered. While I purchased my typical bottles of olive oil - some for myself, some for holiday gifts - I did also indulge in some olive oil based soaps.   The olives and oil are fabulous. I am not as great a fan of their wines. They are not awful, just not with the properties I care for, typically. The in-laws found a favorite to take home, though.  The tour is still $10 and includes the wine tasting, which is a good deal.  Bottles of oil range from $16-$27 each, depending on size.  Soap is $6.99 a bar.  They also feature balsamic vinegars (not made there) and jars of olives, which are delightful as well.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: The speaker was very very rude.  Very long winded.  Made a point to tell us about his great computer career in California.  Do not go with children.  Was quite disappointed with this trip.

reviews.author: Ashley F.
reviews.description: Do not judge a book by its cover. Take one look at Jack and the humble grounds here at Bella Vista, and you'd never guess that he has olive friends he emails with back in Italy or that he can tell you all you'd ever want to know about the science and technique behind growing and processing olives.  I would highly recommend the tour - while there isn't much walking involved in this tour, my husband and I found it to be highly informative. And with Jack's red-blooded Texan sense of humor, it was a very entertaining education. Be sure to note the times of the tour (Sat @ 10am and 1pm, and Sun @ noon) since it's a group setup.   After the tour comes a tasting of several types of olive oil produced on site along with some of their balsamic vinegar offerings. While they also have wine offered, I'd recommend sticking with the olive oil - clearly what they specialize in. If you're only interested in tasting the oils/wines (not the tour), it's probably good to avoid arriving at the tasting room about an hour after each tour start since the tasting room isn't overly large and tends to fill up easily with the folks coming off the tour.

reviews.author: Alison T.
reviews.description: Super disappointed in the customer service.  Both the lady and the gentleman that run the place were very rude and short with us.  Their products are not made by them in Wimberley and when asked about that they became extremely defensive.  Beautiful place that has a lot of potential if they were friendly and cared about the experience people want from that kind of place... but the vibe is anything but friendly and welcoming.   When they started to bash a particular presidential candidate it killed it for us. Keep your opinions out of your business. Don't bother would be my recommendation.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: While I thought it was pretty interesting to learn about and taste boutique olive oil (as I'd never been to an olive ranch before) $15 per person does seem a little high when the actual tour is quite short and obviously the intention is that you're going to buy some stuff at the end, and all that stuff is small batch and quite pricey (understandably so.)  So it ends up  being more like $100 for two people when you include the olive oil you will want to buy plus the wine you might want to buy (some people seem to think it sucks, we liked some of it.)  But you will leave with a buzz on and some delicious olive oils!  The owners were away so their daughter gave the tour; I thought she was pretty funny and personable but there were some questions she couldn't answer but it was really no big deal (and she wasn't super long winded like the owner seems to be  but of course some people like that and some people don't.) It's also probably better when there are olives on the trees but it was still overall pretty interesting to see the different trees different olives grow up and hear some history and facts about olive oil production.  I liked hearing about the process and seeing the machinery. And of course I liked tasting the fresh olive oil, which was indeed super tasty and surprisingly spicy. Most of their oils are made from all different olives smushed together but they have one variety that's just made with one kind of olive which we got to try. They also had a blood orange infused oil that I'm now obsessed with; we bought some and later made some asparagus on the grill that had been rubbed with the oil, it was the most delicious asparagus ever! We also enjoyed the wine; we are not wine snobs in any way but we enjoyed what we had and bought a bottle just  because it's the polite thing to do. We sat out on the bench in front of the tasting room and enjoyed our wines and just had a lovely afternoon.   I will say that it gets a little hectic in the tasting room when people come in just for a tasting after a tour- I would say if you want just a tasting, don't come between 1:30-2:30 because it's going to get confusing!

reviews.author: Lyra S.
reviews.description: The tour was all talking with a look at a tree or two and a look at some equipment. If you want to hear the entire history of olives then this is for you. Personally I was falling asleep. The tour guide was rude and narcissistic.

reviews.author: Kristen C.
reviews.description: Wine tasting is $10 per person,  and it is by far the smallest sample I've ever been given in many years of wine tasting. What a rip off. Also the lady that did our tasting was really rude to us. Then, she basically berated a guy when he politely asked where he could dispose of his child's diaper. She was an older lady. I didn't catch her name, but I have a feeling she receives a lot of complaints. It was very awkward and so unprofessional. Never ever going back.

reviews.author: Leigh M.
reviews.description: The couple who own this place are fantastic characters. The wife is sweet and talkative. She was delighted to hear that we moved out here from San Francisco (that's where she grew up but couldn't  stand the fog). The husband is an old curmudgeon, but delightfully so. He worked in high-tech in Silicon Valley and moved out his last company to Austin in the early 90s, eventually leaving to grow olives and make wine.   it's not always the case that you visit a winery and the owners pour for you, so that was a treat. They are a very small production and a bit off the beaten path, so it was pretty quiet there too. A small group arrived just as we were leaving, but it was nothing like the bustling tasting rooms at nearby Driftwood Cellars.  The blackberry wine is actually good--you wouldn't necessarily guess that it's made of blackberry not grapes. And the other three reds we tasted were also nice.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Great wine and a great atmosphere! We joined their membership May 2020 and keep on making the drive out their for tastings and special events. We even purchased their wines for our wedding (white and red blend)!!! Highly recommend going out to do a tasting and hang out. Plus, there are tons of other places to check out for food, beer, and more wine nearby to make a day of it. Adam, the owner, has created a chill place to relax nestled in the back of the property surrounded by trees. Parking is super easy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Semi new winery with very friendly staff and kids friendly. They have 6 wines to taste, 2 whites, 4 reds to include a table white and table red and a port. Favorite was the table white and the cuv√©e. The biggest reason for the 4 and not 5 stars was none were local grapes or wines.  Props for the kids toys and adult size connect four and Jenga.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: We added this place to the itinerary last minute and I am glad we did.   This location is not a vineyard itself. It's basically an outpost of the parent company in California. Based in Paso Robles, Graveyard Vineyards is a small producer. The wines offered are all grown and made in California.   We opted for the tasting. They offered 6 wines for $15. We enjoyed generous pours of 2 whites, 1 rose, 2 reds, and a dessert wine. All of them were very good! You can tell their not Texas wines (in a good way!).   The staff was incredibly helpful. They offered tastings outside and were very attentive! I would absolutely recommend stopping by if you're in the area.   If you can grab a Malbec, do it!

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: Our family was in town from CA and we decided we would go wine tasting locally and try some Texas wines. The wineries prior, all staff wore masks which was nice since we had a couple high risk individuals in our group. When we arrived at Graveyard, the outside was not impressive, not exactly the winery ambience. Once we got inside, the male was not wearing a mask (ok... fine... mask mandate lifted.... ) but he then told me I could take off my mask standing about a foot away, and I told him no I can't, we have high risk individuals. He then said to go outside for the tasting which we did. But honestly, who tells people to take off their masks or suggest they take off their masks during a pandemic? He has noooo idea of our health conditions, concerns or even has the right to even suggest on the matter. I was definitely taken back.  Once we went outside the table was just covered in pollen and debris and leaves. We were all so itchy from all the leaves under the table. Just no grooming or landscaping or care given to the on-site property. It was not a relaxing atmosphere whatsoever, as mentioned prior, a parking lot view/feeling.  The female local staff member had superb customer service, but again, in our faces pouring wine with no mask on. Out of the wineries we went to that day, this is the ONLY place where they were mask free. Although the mask mandate was lifted, we're still in the midst of a major pandemic and felt other establishments honored that respectfully. We felt very safe at all the wineries prior.   Grapes not from Texas.   Pros: Wine was good.

reviews.author: Jon H.
reviews.description: This review is meant as an FYI to those people who are thinking about joining the Graveyard vineyards wine club.  Graveyard expects you to take three shipments and are unwilling to cancel your membership before you pay for, and receive three shipments.  I have received two shipments and did not want any more Graveyard wine.  When I reached out to the wine club, the response was "you are asked to received three shipments; you've had two.  Your third one is coming up."  I am going to be candid here.  I just don't care for the wines.  I know others like them very much.  My sister, who lives near the tasting room in Dripping Springs, loves the wine.  There is nothing wrong with the wine; I just don't care for it and I think two shipments is enough to make up my mind.  I conveyed my feelings to the wine club manager and her solution was to downgrade me from a 12-bottle shipment to a 6-bottle shipment.  I really don't mean to knock Graveyard.  But my suggestion is to buy a case of wine and try it before you join the club.  I want to emphasize that there is nothing wrong with the wine; it just does not align with my tastes.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Graveyard is a brand new addition to the winery community in Drip, having opened in late January. They are an offshoot of a parent winery in Paso Robles, CA. The wines they sell are all produced, bottled and shipped here from that operation. They do yet carry the entire CA inventory but do plan to increase the Texas offerings.   The wines available include a couple of Graveyard's more affordable blends - Paso Tombstone White and the red blend from that line. Both are pleasant, sippable blends at a very reasonable price point. The red was light slightly complex mix of common reds produced at the parent vineyard. They also stock Ascender, a credible Brut. Their estate Cab is actually very good- a lighter Cab with a nice effect on the palate.   The lounge itself is pleasant and airy without being pretentious. The staff, especially manager Adam, are all personable and informative.

reviews.author: Wendy B.
reviews.description: We had a great time at our spaced-out table outdoors. The trees there are gorgeous, but otherwise, the view and ambiance is more of the parking lot. It was a relaxing time playing checkers and sipping wine under the trees, though. Our server was wonderful and covid-safe. Unfortunately, one staff wasn't wearing a mask, even inside, but we didn't have to deal with him much. We really enjoyed the wines. I know they are based out of Cali, but it was still nice to get a decent sparkling wine at a Texas vineyard. They were all good, but that was a nice surprise.

reviews.author: Stephanie K.
reviews.description: Everything is stellar from the staff to the wine to the environment! You feel like you are at home in your living room drinking great wine and chatting with friends. Mindy, Caitlin and Adam are awesome! Scream has to be our favorite red!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: Epic wine! Very nice people! Great way to spend an afternoon. If you are looking for really good wine and a tasting this is your place!

reviews.author: Lindsey U.
reviews.description: Great wine and tasting menu! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Alyson F.
reviews.description: We were sadly under impressed with this new addition in Dripping. We were given a room temperature bottle of Rose and were told by the staff it was "the usual temperature they sold Rose." I don't know about you, but I crave a cold Rose in this Texas heat. They ship in all of their wines from California so you won't find any Texas wines here either. Without good customer service or outstanding wine, we won't be back.

reviews.author: Jeff K.
reviews.description: Not Texas sourced wines, but absolutely incredible! From their parent vineyard in Paso Robles, Adam and company have some stunning wines. Super nice folks, too! Our favorites are the Chardonnay ( not oaky), the red blend, and their insanely good Malbec. We've been back three times.... they're dangerously close to our home.

reviews.author: DeeAnn M.
reviews.description: Simply the best! Look no further for great wine. Graveyard has the best red wines you will taste in this region. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The tasting room is comfortable and inviting. Do not leave without tasting the dessert wine that is like chocolate in a glass! It is all good here so just go !

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place. Don't drive by without going inside for a sample. The vodka is so smooth. The creams are out of this world and the elderflower liquor is perfect for a spritzer or to sweeten that mixed drink from Brad. I can just drink it on its own but I am tough like that.

reviews.author: Kristy C.
reviews.description: The place has great potential. Very cute and good drinks.  But they have a long way to go when it comes to customer service.  The bar tender seemed to be really put out that we were even there.  Didn't welcome us, when we asked if we needed to go to the register part of the bar to order,  he looked at his phone and rudely said, I'll be with you in a min. Then continued to be annoyed that he had to take our order. The place was empty only 1 pinter group of 4 so wasn't like he was super busy.  They even said he didn't really seem to want to be there and definitely didn't want to be taking our orders.  The AC was also very lacking we were all fanning ourselves with the menu which seemed to be the best use of the menu since he didn't want to serve us. The sink in the women's bathroom barley had water coming out if it and they were out of toliet paper but we dare not ask the 1 bar tender as that would have really put him over the top. I wouldn't recommend this place and if I was the owner I'd want to know how bad my employee is. No wonder there was no one inside.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Just a quick update (which I intended to post in December).  Stinson is alive and well in their new digs--now fronting FM 150. Much more spacious. It'll be a great space to spend an afternoon once the pandemic ends.  Call ahead if you want to pick up some of their fabulous Texas Holiday Nog, but remember, only 2 bottles per person per month.  Careful though and drink responsibly. This is not your father's Oldsmobile eggnog. It will sneak up on you and kicks you in the noggin like a freakin' mule.

reviews.author: Claire A.
reviews.description: Quiet little distillery to visit down south, great selection of cocktails. Was hoping to find some wine as well but was told the wine is mainly used for the brandy. This place had board games, friendly staff and is dog friendly! Highly recommend checking it out. Planning to come back when they restock their whiskey and egg nog

reviews.author: Karie B.
reviews.description: I have loved this place in the past.  Drinks were always measured and made to perfection-  delicious!!  The two female bartenders we have had in the past were amazing.   However I think they missed the mark on this expansion.  Sadly this is NOT the same place.  Total different vibe.  The new 'bar manager'  (a dude) made me a Mojito that I couldn't drink. He also told my husband that he is planning a lot of new drinks to put on the menu

reviews.author: Deborah M.
reviews.description: We went on a distillery drive in Dripping Springs and this was our last but BEST stop!  We sampled and bought the premium vodka and then went back and got the coffee based liquor Carajillo and the Texas Holiday Nog.  I highly recommend these and a trip out there to visit the friendly staff.  I might have to buy the holiday rum based egg nog for all my friends for the holidays!

reviews.author: Laryssa B.
reviews.description: This spot is a Awesome. When driving from Austin to San Antonio, we stopped for bbq up the road and then came here to taste. All the liquors were good, the cocktails were too. The gentlemen working were friendly and knowledgeable. (Also patient with all our questions)   We bought two bottles of the Carajillo, which is ten times better than any baileys or other coffee liqueur we've ever tasted.   These guys had a great playlist rocking, and the wood wall behind the bar is beautiful!

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: Won't waste your money on this place, service was terrible, female bartenders are rude

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Cool place with great staff. I had never tried anything like this before and a nice change of pace from the wineries. They have a neat setup inside a metal building. It's not the easiest place to find but would be a great place to just hang out for awhile. They have some outdoor seating and corn hole games set up too. Really different experience.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: So, stopped in at Stinson's and met a couple of the owners.  There is so much to love about the place.  Good drinks. Original takes on standards like their take on the margarita: The Brandyrita.  Had a great time. But the star of the show was their Texas Brandy, and the Carajillo, which made me a fan.  Can't wait to go back and find out what else they have cooked up.   Great stuff.

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: A cool little distillery with very friendly staff. Quaint and chill spot to have a drink and relax. My friend and I went on a whim after eating at the Salt Lick and seeing signs to this distillery. We hung out for an hour. We talked with the staff, drank a dram, and played some corn hole. Great little spot with awesome drinks. As a whiskey guy, that's what I wanted to try, but it wasn't ready. Nevertheless, brandy was good. Great time at an awesome location with good people.   Enjoy.

reviews.author: Michael G.
reviews.description: Come check out Stinson Distilling. Amazing drinks and staff. Lots of refreshing drinks in this hot heat.

reviews.author: Arian E.
reviews.description: There is only one downside to this place: they make you bring your own funnel for doing Rumstands from the big jugs.  Otherwise this is a fantastic young distillery and one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!  You can't loose with booze!!!

reviews.author: Kelvin T.
reviews.description: Elderflower liquor is legit! Highly recommend! And try the Citrus Fizz. Had to pull around the back of the building to part and enter the tasting room. Good setting!

reviews.author: Nicole C.
reviews.description: Delicious variety of alcohols to try and great mix drinks. We also had a tour of the distillery process. Tried the Passionate Lady, Citrus Fizz, and reserve tasting- all very good! Love the tasting room decor and environment!

reviews.author: Rafael V.
reviews.description: Love this place. Best mojitos around. Vodka and rum are really off the charts amazing.  The inside is nice and cool and you can play games while you drink. People that go are very personable.

reviews.author: Al G.
reviews.description: Great little secret of Driftwood. These cocktail concoctions are simply amazing. If you want a place that's unique and specializes in great spirits this is your go to stop!

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: Lots of choices and table games. It's hot out but they have a big fan to help keep you cool. We will be back soon.

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: We passed by this place heading to the Drip yesterday and since I'd never heard of it, I immediately yelped it.  A new distillary only about 10 minutes from my Casa?  Hell yes, I'm curious.  And I'll admit I became even more curiouser after reading Arian's review....I intended to ask them about this "one of the best after-hours swingers hangouts in Austin!!!" sitch.    The tasting room was a little hard to find as it's around the back of this little warehouse strip but it's open and spacious and we were only the 2nd couple there on a Friday evening.  We were warmly greeted and bellied up to the bar.  Our bartender (and all the staff I think) are in the Stinson family.  She was very friendly and gave us all the history of the place and explained each tasting in length.  They are currently offering a tasting of 4 of their liquors for $7 (these served quaintly in communion cups) and have cocktails they can serve as well.  We sampled everything (of course), the vodka, the white rum and dark rum, the elderflower liquor (think St Germaine) and the Holiday Nog.  She also threw in a sampling of their Bailey's style coffee liquor that's not quite "ready" yet.  I immediately fell in love with the Holiday Nog, which doesn't actually have any egg in it (thank goodness) and is made more with rum than whiskey (again, thank goodness).  This will go great with holiday gatherings.  I will keep an eye on their FB page for release of that coffee liquor!  All of their bottles run in the $25 range.  Hubby and I each had a cocktail, him the mojito and me the Citrus Fizz, and both were made well and were tasty.  We also bought several of their cocktail glasses as they are sturdy heavy glass, perfect for Bourbon.  Which, btw, they are still perfecting their whiskey recipe and will offer that in the future as well.    We really enjoyed talking to everyone and after getting a little liquid courage, I did ask about the swinger's parties.  She laughed and said that was just a friend making jokes....I wonder......

reviews.author: Dewey L.
reviews.description: We came across this distillery accidentally, and so glad we found it.  It may not look like much on the outside, but inside, the drinks were great.  Nice variety and options.  Will definitely return!

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Great stop on your trip to Dripping Springs. A family owned and run business. The owners are super friendly, and it's such a relaxing atmosphere. I had the blackberry smash with vodka and it was so good. They have the option of vodka or gin in your cocktail depending on your preference.   Definitely a great way to spend a day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: We spent the weekend visiting distilleries and this was very disappointing.   It's not busy at all but they still gave us gin instead of vodka.  It would be okay to play some music as it's awkwardly quiet due to the lack of patrons.  Finally, the people at the counter seemed annoyed with people overall.  Another couple in  the parking lot stopped us and asked if we had the same bad experience so it was not just us.

reviews.author: Amy S.
reviews.description: Had a great stop here. The blackberry smash was amazing. The Helen's were amazing too. They are very eco friendly, affordable and yummy. And the people were friendly. Win win win trifecta! We left with four bottles.

reviews.author: Jeff P.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated distillery makes for a welcoming experience.  Not like other local "corporate" locations.   Patio is large with plenty of comfortable chairs.   Vodka and Gin are amazing.   My wife enjoyed the Gin sample which was truly surprising.   She a vodka gal.   This is a must stop.  Bypass the corporate spots and come here first.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Definitely a hidden place with a great view! Glad we stopped at this place after seeing a sign off the side of the road and following a winding path down to see this gem.  Very homey vibes with a great patio for outdoor seeing that just has a fantastic view of the hill country. Decently priced drinks consisting of either gin or vodka.  Seating is pretty limited inside, but the outdoor space is just amazing and honestly makes the experience really that much better. I'd highly recommend 'The Bullfrog' with vodka. Tasty drink, but not overpowering and has a nice kick (smooth vodka that doesn't burn like gasoline).  P.S. They have some cool looking merch! Make sure to take a look at their terrariums...they are wicked!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Frog Pond Distillery was a pleasant surprise.  I have been wanting to come here for a while now, but always drive-by, and don't get a chance to turn around.  However, this time I made a trip purposefully to stop in.  I am glad I did.  Frog Pond is a family-owned business and passion project. The entire family was behind the bar the day my friend and I stopped in except for mom and I think a daughter.  The family owns the land and has slowly overtime built the tasting room and production area themselves.  They currently make a vodka and gin.  They offered us a free sip of each to determine which we would prefer in one of their handcrafted cocktails.  Both had a nice flavor profile that blends well in cocktails.  Their cocktails were creative and they mentioned the family came up with the recipes together.  The cocktails were delicious and very reasonably priced.  Their space has a fun modern 50's theme.  They have an outdoor patio you can sit back and relax on a nice day.

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: This is a family run business, which is a major plus!   Love supporting local, small family operated businesses. Their vodka is top notch and their featured cocktails are great.  The views from the porch are amazing and so serene. Definitely coming back for another round.

reviews.author: Anastacia R.
reviews.description: My friends and I were doing distillery/brewery tours in Dripping Springs for a cute birthday celebration. We tried Deep Eddy's but they were closed so we decided to give Frog Pong a try and we were not disappointed! The guys at the front were helpful and kind. The drinks were so affordable and flavorful, I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Wanida S.
reviews.description: I've always wanted to stop in and check this place out. It's got a great view and their vodka and gins were tasty. They weren't overpriced and had great service. **only open on the weekends.

reviews.author: Arko G.
reviews.description: On our way to a wedding, we stopped by for a cocktail, and this was the perfect spot. We were debating between here and Deep Eddy, and we picked here for a more off the beaten path option and chill atmosphere. And we were definitely not disappointed. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and knowledgeable about their product. Outdoor seating is spacious with impressive views. Cocktails were highly affordable and very tasty. Unfortunately, tours were closed due to COVID, but we hope we can come back for tours some time soon!

reviews.author: Christina M.
reviews.description: What a nice change of pace from the better known distillery down the road. Instead of an overcrowded atmosphere with way overpriced drinks, this place is relaxing and affordable. There's a great wrap around porch to take in the landscape around you, while sipping a delicious cocktail. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Glenn R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful facility!  Stopped in for their grand opening and was amazed at such a sparkling clean, friendly place.  It's very obvious that a lot of careful thought has gone into this place. The actual distillery is incredible. The whole place is just beautiful. Even on a scorching Texas Summer day, there's a strong breeze out on the porch.  It's a very "Austin-esque" type place, down-home and friendly. Although I don't drink, my wife enjoyed a cocktail very much and we bought a bottle to take home. They had some nice lemonade and infused water for me too.  Great design of the logo, bottles and everything. Really worth stopping in if you're in the area or just feel like a nice drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: While driving into Dripping Springs for an anniversary get away we spotted this beautiful building set near 290, decided to turn in and see what it was. We weren't disappointed, Super cute place, nice patio to hang out on while sipping lovely cocktails. Really reasonably priced drinks (mixed drinks either $5 or $6 depending on choice). Has an area to play games out front, and indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: They put advertising stickers on your car without permission, which is astonishing. I left the one on my trunk and added a sticker that says "sucks" under it. Unbelievable that they would do this.

reviews.author: Christiana F.
reviews.description: I stopped by after a recommendation from one of the wineries in the area. The owners were very welcoming and their drinks were fantastic! I ended up buying a bottle of gin on the way out. It was chilly and the sun was going down so we weren't able to sit outside but the view was great and seems like a fun spot during the summer.

reviews.author: Lochness P.
reviews.description: Delicious drinks! Vodka is super smooth. I recommend the Helen! And the patio with the view is beautiful!

reviews.author: Claire K.
reviews.description: Walked in was greeted and made to feel like I was in my own home. If my home was a sweet Distillery like the Frog Pond. Patio and chair were peace on Earth. With a amazing Texas Breeze. And the Gin and Tonic was just perfect. My sister got the cocktail of the day with lavender and gin and it was amazing. Color and all. I highly recommend a stop to this Local Distillery. They are A must try.

reviews.author: Carey D.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem. We started off at another well known distillery down the road and googled what else was close by and found this awesome little spot with a great view. They make small batches of vodka and gin at the distillery and make a few different drinks to try. Their porch was a great place to hang out while playing giant jenga and relaxing. I noticed cornhole as we walked in as well. We watched deer randomly wandering in the distance. The drink I had was great, a cranberry vodka fizz, so I had another. The indoor space is fairly small and the patio could fit maybe 30 people comfortably. It was not crowded at all when we were there on a Sunday afternoon. We'll go again next time we're in Austin!

reviews.author: Devin C.
reviews.description: I am very new to the Gin world, but I was truly in need of an alternative to Dark liquors. I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to take a chance. I am very happy to say that the product that they are offering, not only the liquor, is amazing. They couldn't have picked a better location to place their distillery. The hills of Texas, day or night, make relaxing on the patio with the variety of gin and vodka cocktails that much more relaxing. The bright pops of color when you venture inside of the distillery are such a delight and really made my girlfriend and I feel happy to be in such a welcoming place.   The gin was delicious and I plan to buy more bottles very soon. Don't think that my lack of praise for the vodka means that it isn't good (I am just not a fan of vodka..rough nights in college) but I definitely suggesting venturing out to this family run, local organization. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Love this place!! Their gin and vodka are amazing. Their cocktails are on point. The views are phenomenal. I am never going back to deep Eddy's when frog pond is right here?!?

reviews.author: Diana N.
reviews.description: Super cute, cozy, and clean BandB. One of the more reasonably priced places in Wimberley. Located right off the Square so easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the creek. I recommend Kiss the Cook (souvenirs, kitchen gadgets, coffee, etc) and Wimberley Cafe (good burgers and pie). The courtyard is beautifully decorated and relaxing. Plenty of FREE breakfast and pre-packaged snacks available even during COVID (cereal, Nutri-grain and Nature Valley bars, Chewy bars, muffins, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, pudding packs, fruit cups, yogurt, chips, milk and water for $1).  Stayed in the Maeson room. You have to exit the home into the courtyard to access this room, but I liked the privacy. Very comfortable king size bed, fresh linens, very spacious room w/ mini fridge, microwave, and tv, not much counter space in the bathroom though. Hosts were incredibly nice and welcoming. I would return!

reviews.author: Christina Z.
reviews.description: My sister got married last week in Wimberly, TX. Our family thought, "this is so random". Neither of the families lived there and most of us had never heard of Wimberly. Then my sister said she had booked us at The Square Inn and gave us room arrangements.   I had flown in leaving MD at 4 am then getting to Dallas and then drove an hour. It felt like it was 5 in the afternoon but in reality it was 11am.   We walk into the Square Inn and was greeted by the owners. It never even hit my mind from the crazy traveling, check in was at 3 PM. To be honest I didnt think about it till others said there hotels would not let them early check in.   When meeting the owners, it felt like family. It almost felt like we were all coming home. They were so great. They let us in early and was cool enough to say, "we need to run out before the others come, you are in charge."   The whole place was beautiful and amazing. Every room was perfect for single friends, to my other sisters and my crazy, but loveable nephews. Mr. Loyd one of the owners was like a natural grandfather with letting the boys run around but also telling them to close the door to keep AC inside. Lol  My favorite spot was the court yard. It looks like something out of a movie. Plus when it rains you can sit and watch the rain hit the roof. It's so peaceful.   So on top of a friendly, welcoming, beautiful space to stay and socialize, they also cook breakfast. Let me tell you it was the best food I have ever had at a bed and breakfast place.   We could smell the bacon at 6 am. Yum yum   So hands down this is place to stay in Wimberly. Its walking distance of all the cool shops and places to eat in town.

reviews.author: Ali R.
reviews.description: Cons: * There were mosquitoes CONSTANTLY flying around our room. We never left the door open, so I don't know how they kept coming in. (This was the biggest con) * When we placed the "service our room" card on our door, no one ever came to fix the bed or resupply fresh towels. We were gone for like the whole day, and no one came, so that wasn't nice * The water pressure in the shower was too hard * The bathroom floor would get soaking wet anytime we took a shower because the curtain wouldn't stay closed all the way to prevent the water from going outside the tub. * When they gave us the wifi password they spelled it with a capital T, but really it was all lowercase, so we had a hard time getting the WiFi to work until we called the front desk.   Pros: * it is within walking distance to all the little stores and Wimberley cafe. * the staff is friendly. * The price of the room is reasonable   They just need to fix all the cons listed, and I think they would have a fine place to stay. Very unique and quirky. Also, I do think it would be nice if they had cable television.

reviews.author: Chelsie B.
reviews.description: Really neat place, would love to stay here again. Very clean and friendly folks. Peaceful and quite. About a 3 min walk to nearby restaurants and bars.

reviews.author: Arnold G.
reviews.description: Okay. We ended up in wimberley on the coldest days of the year for my wife's 50th birthday. We arrived on Thursday and joined by our two adult sons. We were lucky to have made reservations at the Square Inn.  This place is quaint and hip at the same time.  Our room/suite was large and clean and really comfy.  The staff and owners were great and accommodating. We had to leave early due to the weather so we really couldn't enjoy all of the amenities, but we r definitely going to return. The Square Inn is a great choice for being close to the Square. Lots of great places to walk to and enjoy. Can't wait to go back and we will absolutely b staying at the Square Inn. Thx for making our short stay so pleasurable.

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: My sister and her husband stayed here while visiting from Spain. They loved Everything about it ,  especially the super comfy bed.  Breakfast was delicious

reviews.author: Peachy S.
