reviews.description: Fun, quiet place to stay. Fantastic location. Owners were really friendly and the breakfasts were amazing. They even accommodated my dietary restrictions!! Definitely will be back!!

reviews.author: Kimberleigh S.
reviews.description: My man did very well finding this BandB for our short stay in Wimberley. I don't know which was better, the gracious hospitality of the owners' and their family or our very comfortable room. The breakfast, served from 0800-1000 is also awesome. We stayed in the "Lauren" room located by the back patio area. The entire establishment is quiet and clean and I loved having a mini fridge in the room. The Inn is centrally located and quaint shops and restaurants are right outside the door. We would definitely stay here again.

reviews.author: Chuck M.
reviews.description: Nice location just off the main square. Great location to explore the Wimberley area from.  Well kept, nicely appointed rooms. Owner is very attentive and courteous.  Excellent pricing, often lower than other BandB's in the area.  I stayed a night mid-week. If you want to stay over the weekend, make your reservations early. It often fills up on the weekend. My room was off the patio in the back, the patio was a nice place to relax.

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: The Square Inn was perfect for my husband and I's Anniversary Getaway.  The staff was very helpful and welcoming.  Wonderful breakfast served every morning with plenty of shopping steps away. Our room was warm and quaint - bathrooms with recent update and decor.  We loved that the BandB had 24 hour come and go as you need as we were attending a wedding outside of town. Each room felt like it had it's own private oasis as it faced in to a beautiful courtyard area to sit and drink your morning coffee or a glass of wine. We can't wait to visit Wimberley again and stay at this adorable little BandB!

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Fantastic! Feels just like Wimberley: quaint and welcoming! The room was spacious, very clean, and well cooled even during the hot summer sun. All the details were great: towels were fresh and soft, wifi was fast, bed was comfortable, shampoo was even great!   But the location was amazing! Right on the square, so my wife and I literally walked almost everywhere! If we needed to refresh our drink, we simply walked back to the room. No problem!   Now the food. Breakfast is served daily and is delicious! In addition, they have a great selection of coffees, teas, and cocoas! Snacks like chips, pound cake, muffins, granola bars, microwave popcorn, etc. were available all day.   Can't say enough good things about this gem! Wouldn't change a thing!

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to stay in wimberly. The couple the manage the BandB are charming and attentive. This place is like home and has a lovely covered patio. Short walking distance to shops and resturants. Very clean and tidy rooms with mini ref and microwave. A must stay at reasonable rates.

reviews.author: Stephaney G.
reviews.description: this is the worst service I've ever received at a bed and breakfast. They took 20 mins to show up at the front desk when we arrived. they are charging us for damages they refuse to show us documents of. i went back and forth emailing the so called staff there and she told me she didn't have time for my problems. when I asked for her bosses number she gave me her fiances number. which, big surprise was no help because he would only side with her. he said hes the gm and theirs no higher position then him which is a lit because every gm has a boss and while we were there a lady was talking to them about things they needed changed who i'm assuming is Marcilia B. the owner. also the couple who runs the place was arguing so loud while we were there we could hear it from our room, when i went to see what was going on i saw her yelling at him.There was NEVER anyone at the front desk the whole time we were there and they lied about their medicine variety they claim to have. I'm pregnant and can only have Tylenol which the claimed they had in their "large variety" which only consisted of off brand aspirin. when i emailed them asking for documents all they did was argue with me (a customer) instead of trying to resolve the problem. I don't recommend  to anyone to stay here or waste your money because you will only get horrible service. DO NOT GO HERE WASTE OF MONEY.

reviews.author: Renee G.
reviews.description: Loved this place it was perfect for our large family. The food was great for breakfast. The outdoor patio was so comfortable and amazing. Thanks for the lovely well decorated rooms and comfortable beds.

reviews.author: Stephanie H.
reviews.description: My mother and I spent one night at the Square Inn. They were extremely accommodating even though we could only spend one night when they normally have a two night minimum. The room was very spacious,  decorated perfectly and very clean. The inn was fully booked but you wouldn't even know it because it was so nice and quiet. We felt as though we had the whole place to ourselves. The owners are so very nice and informative. The inn is walking distance to many shops and dining options. We weren't able to stay for breakfast but it smelled delicious. We will definitely be going back!!

reviews.author: Nicole D.
reviews.description: A girlfriend and I recently stayed here one night and had a really nice time.  It was super clean and the inn keepers Keegan and Meg were very friendly hosts.  It was very quiet at night and our beds were very comfortable.  Also, you can't beat the location for walking to the shops and restaurants.

reviews.author: Jon R.
reviews.description: Myself and my fiancee recently visited Square Inn, and were very pleased with our stay.  The Lauren Room was clean, with warm, rustic interiors and a fabulously comfortable king-size bed.  The patio located just a few steps from our door was spacious; nice place to hang out before venturing to either Marco's Italian or Cypress Creek for dinner (both restaurants, by the way..  wonderful).  Square Inn is walking distance from some truly amazing dining, along with quaint knick knack shops (soaps, candy, etc.)-- not to mention you're swimming the Blanco, or tasting at Wimberley Valley Winery, in just a few minutes' drive.  Can't beat that.  Which reminds me: amenities included a big-screen t.v. in the common area, a decent library of DVD'S, an Xbox 360 game console with games, and complimentary wine in the afternoon and evenings.  Really, really nice being able to wind down for the night with a movie, and a glass or two from Duchman Winery.   Marci, our innkeeper at Square Inn, was very friendly, and courteous, even during a fluke front-door locking mechanism malfunction which resulted in our having to wake her up.

reviews.author: Blanca G.
reviews.description: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay.  Very cozy, quiet and comfortable.  Loved that it was walking distance to all the shops. The owners were very friendly!  Enjoyed our *Cowboy Casserole*!

reviews.author: Johnny j.
reviews.description: This is a quiet little place with 6 rooms.  The innkeeper, Marci, serves breakfast every morning in the common area.  According to her, this place is a labor of love, and it shows.  The beds are comfortable and the atmosphere is peaceful.  I will definitely be staying again next spring.  If you are visiting Wimberly for the Square, the inn is literally a stone's throw away.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: The customer service was amazing!  We were treated like family and enjoyed our experience tremendously.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting. You choose 5 different ones for $11, making this one of the more affordable options around this area. It comes out on a wooden board with stemless glasses. It would have been nicer if the servers gave a bit more description about each of the wines, but they were all very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Haley C.
reviews.description: Literally so good! We were the only people in there on a Monday just before close and the service was great. It was even happy hour and we didn't even know it! The wine tasting was great and a GREAT value during happy hour.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Meh. It was nothing special. No ambiance. Service was decent. Food was delicious. But overall the experience was just normal.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Ac, Texas tasty wines and friendly people.  What else can you ask for ?   We worth the $11 sampling price.

reviews.author: Oscar S.
reviews.description: Great place just to get away and have a good brew. Great wine stop... nice people nice atmosphere!! Thank you

reviews.author: Carole B.
reviews.description: Totally disappointed.  Asked for a menu...ordered a bottle of wine and 10 minutes later we go to order food to be told the kitchen is closed!!!  Really at 7:40?  You couldn't tell us that before wine was bought!?  So we get to sit there and drink wine while everyone around us are eating.  Never again!

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Nice place to sit and cool off in Wimberley. They have tons of wine samples, drinks and some small appetizers. Plus a wall full of snacks and specialty foods to bring home for that special occasion. I spun the way back wheel and got some pickled eggs. I made it normal (kind of) by adding some flavored pecans.

reviews.author: Chelsea G.
reviews.description: This place is a must! Super cute wine shop/country store with a very chill vibe. We did a wine tasting and a cheese plate and everything was perfect! We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Luis D.
reviews.description: Great little charcuterie board with good ambience and delicious drinks. This place is worth the trip to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: A great place for sips, sauces, wine and more. Not only can you sample the sauces and dips but they offer wine tasting. They also have 35 craft beers. I definitely recommend stopping in.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Taste Buds is a cool little shop located in the tourist town of Wimberley, TX. It has been taken over my new owners and it had a name change, but most of what the former owners carried is still available, though some things are not; however, the new owners do offer some new things. They do offer some beers and wines, but my biggest interest is the hot sauces, salsa's, and pickles. They do offer some free samples and if you're not a chili head like me, be careful as the ghost pepper and the scorpion salsa's offer a very quick and very hot bite that will get your attention !!!!

reviews.author: Lisa C.
reviews.description: LOVE this place!! The food and drink selection was fabulous! So excited for Buda!! I would like it if the employees wore their masks correctly though. One didn't have one at all, but had gloves and the others had them almost covering their mouths, but not their noses. Soon there will be a vaccine, but until then... please.

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this place when we arrived in town and really glad we did. They serve tons of Texas wine and do wine tastings too. The other half of the building is stocked with cool Texas made dips and jarred goods. Our server was so nice and was easy to talk to! Also, we really appreciated that they were dog friendly! Overall a great place it's stop and check out while you're in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Joanna R.
reviews.description: Our first time here and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Quaint, welcoming stop before we walked around. Perfect place to stop in and relax, enjoy a glass, and a small bite to eat. Thank you Los Olivos for being a part of my Mother's Day weekend.

reviews.author: Wendy b.
reviews.description: We happened into this place by chance, and SO glad we did! Not only did Rylee take great care of us, she went above and beyond to make sure our Anniversary was fabulous! Home made secret champagne recipe and all! Cheers!

reviews.author: Elle L.
reviews.description: Quaint shop on main street. Small, wine bar with a few beer on tap. Small menu. Cheese trays look great. You can buy other gourmet items from their gift shop. Great service. Nice place to rest and cool down from shopping this historical downtown.

reviews.author: Tony T.
reviews.description: Ordered two of their sandwiches and they never came after 25 minutes.  Poor service, never checked in on, they were too busy serving a larger party who got there after is. Someone finally came to tell us our food was coming, 5 minutes later, nothing...we had enough and left.  Eating at Wimberly Cafe, much better food and service.

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: Super laid back and casual spot for epicurean gifts, wine tasting, beer tasting and even wine-a-ritas!! Be sure to get the queso and chips as well as a refillable winearita koozie bottle! The servers are all very friendly and knowledgeable. Overall just a great place to hang out for a bit and enjoy your evening.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: Lots of goodies in this place, one of my weaknesses is pecans with just about anything on them....quite a collection of sauces including Silver Leaf from Missouri City....they need some Mikey V's.....

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: We had the most magical experience. I cannot express how happy we were with our experience. We went for some rest and relaxation and that is exactly what we got.   We will be back!!

reviews.author: Amber J.
reviews.description: We thought this would be a nice weekend vacation. Two nights cost around $675. They were suppose to serve breakfast between 9-9:30 and it never got you'd until close to 10. The trash in our room was very taken out upon our arrival so our  bungalow smelled like somebody else's trash. We couldn't check in on time because they were short staffed even tho they told us we could the day before. One of our screens was falling off. We have extra pillows in closet but no extra pillows.  I swear our place was never actually cleaned between the people before us and us.   Serenity you looked so cute and wrap wanted to book our wedding there but you were just too dirty.  Hot tub had so many chemicals it took off my spray tan in less than 5 minutes. You couldn't sit in tub because you couldn't breathe with all the chemicals.

reviews.author: Angus B.
reviews.description: To begin with the website is messed up and doesn't let you book reservations....  Next, the phone number listed is to an answering machine in which you have to leave a message and hope they call back.   Upon making the reservation I was assured everything was going to be great with my room and the special lovers cruise package I paid for.  On our way to the resort I called to inform them we were on the way and to ensure everything was good with our room.  I was assured by the staff that everything was in order with my room and the lovers cruise package.    Upon arrival we went to our room and not only was the lovers cruise package I paid extra for not set up but there was also animal feces on one of the rugs!  This naturally upset us to a large degree.  Here we are not two minutes into our stay and we have two major screw ups.   The next day I informed the staff that my wife and I would be gone for a certain time (I was specific about from when to when).  During the time when we were away I requested that they refresh/clean our room.  I was again assured it would be done with no problems.  Upon our return, of course, the room had not been touched.  When I went to the staff and complained they stated that they again were sorry for the failure and would rectify it quickly....  We had just a little time before our wine tour and needed back in our room to get ready.  So I politely went into the room and asked the maid how much longer she would need to finish our room.  The maid gave me attitude and disrespectfully said another five minutes.  Even after this insult I again was polite to the maid and thanked her for her efforts, she in turn ignored me.   This was a disaster of a three year anniversary celebration for me and my wife. I would give zero stars if I could.  For the amount of money I spent there, I expected far better customer service and professionalism.  I would certainly not recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.author: Sarah R.
reviews.description: We cant thank them enough for our peaceful ,romantic weekend away for real life:) This 22nd anniversary will be a weekend to remember:)

reviews.author: Mariel R.
reviews.description: Beautiful place to have a relaxed weekend close to nature and farm animals. They received us with a bottle of wine, cake and a warm, cozy loft. This is our second visit and we will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Joel L.
reviews.description: We stayed in the White Buffalo Bungelow with hot tub. 6/28-6-30/19. Communication was difficult. They had to send 3 different sets of pictures to get them correct. We arrived at 10pm and there was no light on the 75 yard flagstone walk to our cabin. The place was nice but the exterior deck with hot tub had over grown weeds all near the outdoor seating and bugs were crawling everywhere. The next day Saturday, I asked if they could cut the weeds back, they said no. Can you imagine?!? We paid $67.00 for a $20 brunch voucher on Sunday which was a joke. Place needs updating and needs to be more accommodated to people arriving at night. Refused to negotiate a partial refund. So bad service gets bad reviews. No excuse. Poor management and ownership. They said my expectations were too high????!!! Make sure everything is right because it won't get fixed the next day. Avoid this place

reviews.author: Catlin G.
reviews.description: My husband came here for the weekend for a quick and close anniversary trip. The room was very comfortable, breakfast was tasty and the pool provided a welcome relief to the heat. It was also a pretty quick drive into downtown Wimberly where we found all kinds of things to do.

reviews.author: Heather U.
reviews.description: Beautiful, serene cottages.  We loved our stay and we will definitely be back!  The breakfast they brought Saturday was lovely and everything was just wonderful!

reviews.author: Stephanie L.
reviews.description: We scrolled thru Facebook and Instagram pictures the days leading up to our stay, when we arrived, we immediately agreed that pictures did not do the Serenity Farmhouse Inn justice at all! The staff is friendly and very helpful. The layout of the grounds is perfect - everything is nearby but still far enough away so it's quiet outside. We stayed in the Farmers Market, and it was absolutely adorable, cozy and comfortable. Each morning a delicious breakfast was delivered to our door, and when we were done all we had to do was put the tray outside and the staff discreetly came out to pick it up. The sunset views were spectacular, and watching the deer walk around during the evenings was the perfect way to end our day. We cannot wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Alfred W.
reviews.description: The place is nice. We went for my birthday. The place is a nice BandB and the property is large. Breakfast this morning was great and filing. I would have given it a Ten but the property is about 8 miles outside of town where all the happenings are. If you love the country and rural areas then this is the place. The cottage was very nice and a huge heart shaped tub for 2 people but no shower. There is a bunch of cats on the premises and my saw a pregnant fox. Hey Welcome to Wimberley Texas.

reviews.author: Cheryl S.
reviews.description: Serenity Farm House Inn was charming. Our cabin was beautifully decorated with a beautiful bed and fireplace and heart shaped jacuzzi tub.  The Inn had wine in the refrigerator for us and a wonderful full breakfast brought to our room each morning.    Very Romantic !!  We would definitely go back.

reviews.author: Rob M.
reviews.description: Haven't even had my stay yet but it's been hard to get in touch with the office. After finally getting to talk to someone, I wanted to add a Sunday to my M-W stay. I was originally told it was okay, the manager called me back and said can't do it because there no one available to clean the rooms in a Sunday. My stay isn't till June 3rd surely there is a way to make an extra day happen in the beginning.

reviews.author: Kacie T.
reviews.description: We had a wonderful stay at Serenity Farm House Inn! They were so kind and welcoming to us. We stayed in the bungalow named, "Merci Mimi". It is an "upgraded" one with a hot tub! The property is located off of the busy highways, so it is always peaceful and relaxing out there!   When we arrived we were able to park near the cluster of bungalows and were welcomed with some fresh sangria wine! The hot tub was already up and running for us and they had a few coupons for certain shops/restaurants around the town for us!   As we explored around the grounds, we found they have a pen of a few rescue animals like donkeys, goats, and pigs which was a unique touch. The pool was also located near the houses and was small but had a beautiful view (as seen in pictures).   The houses were very nice and well kept. They had plenty of towels, kitchen supplies (everything you would need to cook), the kitchen appliances were in great shape and worked great! One thing we had some issues with is the ac unit, there was one in the bedroom, which I liked, and one in the living/kitchen area. They were just kind of complicated to use, we sat up late one night, with the handy manual they had laminated for us, trying to get it to keep the fan on while we slept. What I would suggest is having a ceiling fan in the bedroom or at least an easy setting on the ac to turn the fan on. We also were constantly adjusting the ac, it seemed like it would get really hot and then really cold. We also tested out the hot tub, it was really nice, but we couldn't go out there at night because there was hardly any lights out there. I also wish the hot tubs were a little more private, the house's windows next to us looked right down into our hot tub and people using the walk way by our bungalow could see straight into where the hot tub was. I noticed most of the other houses with hot tubs were more "private" than ours so it may just be the way the houses are laid out.   They also brought us delicious breakfast every morning complimentary! It was so good and fresh! So much better than any complimentary breakfast at regular hotels!   Overall it was a great stay and we will definitely want to come back in the future!

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: We will definitely be heading back to Serenity Farmhouse Inn. The staff are all friendly and accommodating. The grounds are well kept and beautiful. We remarked every day on how quiet the place is although there were many other guests staying there at the same time. The drive to the inn is remote but it will be worth your while. Each morning we were greeted with eggs, bacon or sausage and bakery (I requested gluten free and was accommodated easily). We had champagne and chocolates in our room upon arrival. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect place to spend a week just to relax and get out of town.

reviews.author: Amber N.
reviews.description: This was such a great experience. Breakfast was amazing. Room was adorable. And location was breathtaking. Staff was very friendly. Town was adorable. Great place to get away. We did the wine tour they offer which was so much fun and the wineries were beautiful

reviews.author: April A.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved our stay at Serenity. Beautiful property and rooms, quiet, peaceful place. Breakfast was amazing. We would definitely recommend this place!

reviews.author: Terry S.
reviews.description: Place was cute, bed totally uncomfortable... I killed 20 huge daddy long legged spiders. When we arrived one was crawling across the pillow I was going to sleep on. They brought us a broom.  The themes of the place are cute, little houses adorable.. it was clean and hot tub was clean.. but for the price I know we could have had a much better experience sans arachnophobia!

reviews.author: Amber D.
reviews.description: Nice stay, but could be improved.  We stayed 2 nights at the Rocky Creek Retreat in the resort village area, full price and not from a Groupon deal.   The grounds were nice and well maintained with cute decor.  The hot tub was clean and the cover looked brand new.  As we left Monday, I heard them cleaning other hot tubs.  We enjoyed our 2 kitty visitors that hung out and 'talked' to us.  We saw deer, a tarantula, and a fox roaming the property in the evening.  Lots of butterflies and birds, and wasps.  Breakfast was served promptly at 9:30 each morning, and it was divine.  Sunday we had chocolate covered strawberries atop a small bowl of fruit, with champagne and glasses of orange juice, a boiled egg, a cinnamon roll which I believe was made from croissant dough, and bacon.  Monday we had cheddar scrambled eggs, sausage links,  a blueberry lemon pound cake slice, peach jam, biscuits, and orange juice.  I wish it were served earlier, but we were aware of that at the time of booking.  Be forewarned - the roads that lead throughout the bandb are very rough with significant bumps and deep gouges for small cars, so drive slowly.  Another note on the vehicular aspect - you are not able to park directly in front of this particular cottage.  There is an area for you to park, then walk to your cottage. When lugging heavy luggage and in warm weather, it is a bit of a chore.  When we arrived and I mentioned this, the lady who greeted us offered to use her golf cart to tote our bags for us to our cottage, which was very kind.  The bungalows are pretty close together.  We arrived about 10 minutes before check in time, and our bungalow was still in the process of being cleaned, which was expected to take 30-45 minutes.  She offered us complimentary drinks and coupons to various restaurants in town if we would have liked to start there versus waiting, but having all of our things in the vehicle, we chose to wait for it to be cleaned.  It took only 30 minutes, and she prepared a fruit and cheese plate for us since we had to wait.  The very first thing I noticed about the bungalow was that it was very clean, from top to bottom.  The bathroom towels were clean, soft and thick.  Another thing, which I didn't think to ask about, was whether or not they stopped in while we were out to refresh towel supplies.  They didn't, and we used 3 towels on the first night, leaving us with 1 bath towel.  No fault on the bandb's part.  I wasn't going to call late in the evening for 1 bath towel when we'd already brought 4 of our own beach towels.  We had 2 a/c units, one in the kitchen area and one in the bedroom.  They got cold and stayed cold quickly.  The floorplan and furniture set up were odd and not necessarily conducive to what you would use a particular room for.  The TV was was mounted to a wall, that would you could a) watch from one wicker chair or b) watch with your head sideways from the couch.  In the bedroom, there was in fact a queen size bed as stated.  Unfortunately, it was set up sideways in order to make it fit in the bedroom.  Instead of sleeping with our heads against a headboard, we slept with our heads against a wall.  There were not blinds on the back door leading out from the bedroom, just a gauzy curtain.  No shielding from the morning sun.  There was little storage for our things - we had expected a dresser at least.  There was one tiny closet, from which we were able to hang some of our clothes, but it was stuffed with about 5 huge pillows on the raised part where you might set a bag or something.  Ultimately, we dug clothes and things from our bags daily rather than being able to stow them in a dresser.  When we booked, we were told that the grotto like setting of the hot tub was private.  Our 'grotto' was easily viewable from the two neighboring cottages.  Private in my mind means not in plain view - it should be described as personal hot tub, not private.  There needs to be some wasp patrol - we had an active wasp's nest on our back patio, so enjoying the back patio was a no go.  One of the back deck chairs was missing a cushion, and some old fencing like material was just laid against the back deck.  One of the cabinets had a window drape just randomly thrown in.  The shower door was completely off its railings. It has been this way awhile, as the linoleum is starting to pull away from the shower wall due to the long term leaking water.  Also missing were smoke detectors.  There were outlets, but no smoke detectors. There were 5 missing vertical slats from the sliding doors, which 1 or so would be okay, but that was a bit much.  The kitchen window was cracked as well. The lack of storage, odd layout and the lack of maintenance on some things detracted from our stay.  Overall, our stay at Serenity Farmhouse Inn was okay, but we intend to try elsewhere for the amount of money that we paid.  I hope that their maintenance improves as it is obvious that they put a lot into getting the cottage built and decorated.

reviews.author: Sona E.
reviews.description: We arrived at 9:30 am in order to be there early for the 10:30 am Wine Tour pickup time.  The staff was so gracious and welcoming.  They informed us that the White Buffalo Bungalow was ready and we would be able to get settled in before leaving for the wine tour.   White Buffalo Bungalow was just breath taking from the private drive to the private jacuzzi.  The room has a full kitchen and had a bottle of welcome sangria to begin the pregaming before the wince tour.  The shower was amazing and the soaps, shampoo/conditioner smelled so good!   This was a Wednesday so we were lucky to be on the wine tour with only one other couple.  Jodi is such a pleasant and inviting soul. She got asked about each person's preferences as to be able to personalize the tour and pick which wineries she decided to take us too.  Jodi is so knowledgeable of the town and the wineries.  The lunch she provides is just amazing.   The pool area is so nice and calming.  Again it was the middle of the week and we had the pool to ourselves which was great.  Breakfast is brought to our room by about 9:45 each morning and was so good. (We were the last delivery.)  I was able to walk around the property 1  1/2 times and get a mile in each morning.   If you are not wanting to leave the property stop by HEB and pick up food to prepare in the room.  This was such a wonderful  experience I am already planning to go back next year.

reviews.author: Mindy U.
reviews.description: I am absolutely in love with the little Poets Cottage we stayed in last week. I really appreciate all of the attention to detail in the beautiful antique linens, fresh flowers, pillows, seating areas, bath tray etc. I could go on an on. It was a beautiful and relaxing retreat. It was in a wonderful central location for day trips to State Parks, great Texas BBQ, cute little towns and wonderful back roads. The view from the pool is spectacular. Nothing quite like a Hill Country sunset or sunrise either.   We really enjoyed the big Jacuzzi tub. It would have been nice to have a shower for quick mornings, but we made do. When the neighbors used theirs, their jets were so loud we could hear them. We could also hear the man's booming voice at times.   Their breakfast was amazing and presented in such a lovely way. I wish we could have gotten it a little earlier. I think 930 is probably perfect for a leisurely vacation where you sleep in, but we were up and hitting the roads early. We did wait around for it one day and I am so glad we did.

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: How have I not reviewed the kind people at this wonderful establishment yet?  I so enjoy the the solace of their old farmhouse venue. And the great ciders they serve up certainly do not hurt the wallet or the ambience.  It's so relaxing sitting at the picnic tables out among the oaks listening to your favorite band. Strategically placed fans hidden among the trees aid in making the glade that doubles as a stage tolerable even on 90¬∫ days.  In these seemingly never-ending days of the pandemic, it's also refreshing to see the servers masking up indoors and out. I tend not to venture out too much for exactly that reason, but felt totally safe here even when ordering inside the tap room.  Maybe I should keep it a secret, but it's also one of those places you want to share exactly because it is so very special.

reviews.author: Kaci C.
reviews.description: Wonderful place! We went on a recommendation while we visited family. The ciders were great, as was the food. The only issue we ran into was that we ordered hummus, and the person taking our order didn't let us know that it didn't come with bread or anything else to eat it with. Considering we had just had a conversation with her about it being our first time there, we're about to present she didn't let us know that important bit of info. Not a big deal, and the person who brought us our food outside asked if we had ordered anything to eat it with and quickly brought us an order of a baguette.  Aside from the establishment itself, the vendors selling goods were all friendly and talented, and the other patrons of the establishment were friendly as well. We struck up several conversations with passers-by.  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Ellen G.
reviews.description: We love Texas Keeper Cider! Their tasting room is out a ways from Austin, but is on the most lovely grounds. They often have wonderful live music and their drinks are absolutely perfect for a Texas summer. They are so refreshing. We got one of the picnic baskets and it was full of yummy cheese, sliced meats and bread. Highly recommend!  It is worth noting, they do not have a full lunch/dinner menu. They basically have an assortment of DIY charcuterie boards, which we really enjoyed. However, if you go expecting a full dinner you may be disappointed.

reviews.author: Devon G.
reviews.description: The cider, the wine, the live music! What amazing vibes! The staff is friendly and it has some farmhouse style that is warm and comfy. They have a layout showing how sweet items are and let you sample, so you pick the right one!  Parking is massive and close to the large lot that houses bee keeper.

reviews.author: Mildred A.
reviews.description: Pretty great ciders! Did the tasting. Eat before you go if you are a fatty like me. I wasnt too fond of the food although i love their jellies! Nice outside area ... dogs and children allowed.  They also have live music!( but I was just there for the cider‚Äç)  Will definitely go again!

reviews.author: Marianne L.
reviews.description: I have been a long time fan of Texas Keeper Cider. I love the Tap Room, the grounds, the staff and especially the cider. The cider is dry and they make a wide variety of ciders to appeal to many palates.  They have successfully reopened the Tap Room and I decided to have my belated retirement party there. I was able to reserve a space for my large group and the staff was very attentive. If I had one criticism, it would be their food choices.  It's now a make your own picnic, and you choose cheeses, meats, and sides. It's not really a charcuterie tray, as they don't prep the plate.  The cheeses,  meats and bread all need to be sliced.  This made eating difficult with a large group. Most of my guests had to leave early so they could go eat somewhere else.  I know this new menu makes it easier for the staff, and they are a cidery, not a restaurant, but I miss their old menu.  I will still go to Texas Keeper Cider, but may not hang out as long.  (Or make sure I eat beforehand!) Overall, it's a beautiful South Austin gem.

reviews.author: Jodi H.
reviews.description: The ciders are essentially tribute to the apple gods, extremely generously priced, and the cidery is tucked away--makes for a great escape from the city of Austin!  Came on a rainy day with some girlfriends after dinner, and we LOVED it. It reminded me of Jester King Brewery because of the fact that it felt very off-road and secluded. If you're driving at night and a little too fast you might miss the entrance, so slow down as your GPS tells you you're near. The stone cobble walkway is so organic and lovely, that it felt like we were entering into a storytale cottage. Upon entering, everything screams wood and warm pinterest vibes. The three of us sat down at their tall barstool table, and started on our flight! What prices! Normally they do 5 for $9, but they tapped out of one of the selections so we did 4 for $7! Such a great price for the variety of ciders. I loved their hefeweizen + cider combo, and the first cider on their flight list (a name I forgot). Everything was so juicy and tasty, would highly recommend coming back.   The staff is very knowledgeable, and the lady doing the taptending that night was so sweet and helpful. She trusted that we knew which selection we were on during our flight. She also told us that there are five cideries in all of Austin! So for my cider lovers--let's hit all of them up.

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I don't know why it took me so long to get here but now that I've been, I'll be telling everyone about it and making return trips! If you're a fan of Argus Cidery, you'll like this place. I do think Texas Cider Keeper is making cleaner ciders than Argus (nothing was infected or had off-flavors).   It's easy to miss the entrance, but it's right next to the cemetery! The outdoor space is very quaint but all Texas and has tons of picnic tables. The tasting room is beautiful with butcher block tables and plenty of seating.   We opted for the tasting flight menu which is five 2 oz. pours for $9. Their mainstay Texas Keeper Cider No.1 is dry, refreshing and well balanced. I'm not a fan of sweet ciders, so this was perfect.  I also really liked their Grafter Rose -- which is made with Rome apples and some grapes, which gives it the beautiful rose hue. It's also on the drier side, which is nice.   Our least fave of the five had to be the Cider Weizen, which had a bit too much coriander (and this is coming from a girl who LOVES coriander and hefeweizen beers).   The bartenders were all knowledgeable and really try to give you an explanation of each cider they're pouring (a la a wine tasting).   They also have a tempranillo wine on tap because in Texas it all falls under a "fruit fermentation" permit. Apples, wines, it's all the same permit.   I'll be making it a point to come here more often, and I would if traffic getting through downtown and south Austin traffic weren't so bad.

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: My new favorite place in Austin. Love everything about it.  It's basically the only Place I ever want to be. If you haven't been yet- get on the ball!  The cider is so delicious - nothing is overly sweet and they have a good assortment of dry and well-balanced choices. Their sampler is 9$ for 5 generous pours and is a great way to find the cider you like most. For us it's the rose, but the original is a close second. Your best bet is to purchase a bottle and drink affordably. You even get a discount when you purchase bottles to go (although I'm not sure if that's just at the end of the night - we've closed this place down a few times).   We are also big fans of the food. The carrots in a blanket are so yummy and very unique! A must-have. The curried egg salad is a go-to as well. It's made with eggs from their own chickens! They also add pickled veggies on the side which is always a win for me.   The location is so spacious and beautiful. Plenary of tables inside and out. Even a great view from one side where you can watch the sunset over the trees. I've enjoyed live music there and loved the tunes they were playing inside.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We went here with some friends for the first time. It's a beautiful place at night to sit out on the lawn under the string up lights with your dogs and enjoy some cider.  The bartender was awesome and more than glad to educate us on all the stuff that goes into making cider.  Our friends got this HUGE cheese board that was really well priced too.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: One year later I returned for their 1st Anniversary Party and release of The Grafter Blanc.  For $9.50 (w/fees) your ticket included your admission and 10 oz tulip glass (not the standard 12 oz tulip most breweries sell for $5-6). There were no drink tickets included; all cider and other offerings were for purchase only.  Certainly not the best deal in town....a town full of breweries with taproom festivities.  The Grafter Blanc is definitely my favorite of their ciders, with the perfect balance of acidity, tartness and dryness.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Wow! So before coming here I always assumed ciders as overly sweet and flavored froo-froo drinks for those who don't like beer. I have never felt so mislead before! Cider is made from apples (no matter what the flavor), and real, legit cider is found here! It isn't overly sweet and there are many different kinds! Some reminded me of wine and a not-so-Sweet cider mixed together.  At Texas Keep there is room to bring a large group, or even the dogs or kids to run around. There is a small indoor area with games and a huge outdoor area with room to move about and enjoy the Texas sun (or stars).  The people here really enjoy and are PROUD of what they do. They are excited to tell you the story behind the names of the ciders and what they entail. They have seasonals and guest bottles and taps. Normally I would feel gross trying something out of a bottle opposed to tap, but the whole experience was so eye-opening, I didn't care. They told me their 1 bottle of (maybe a 750ml cider) has about 10mg of sugar in it as opposed to he "cider" I knew such as Angry Orchard that has upwards of 50mg PER BOTTLE! Yowza- no wonder they were too sweet!  I was definitely iffy about coming here since they didn't serve "regular beer", but I'm definitely glad I stepped out of my comfort zone- and you should, too!  Only reason it's not 5 stars- the food "truck" setup (not a truck just a station) was out of food by 6:30p on a Saturday night. We had ordered 1 of the 4 items on the menu for our group to try. When we went back to order our favorites, they claimed they were out of everything and turned around and took 1 more order. Annoying. So we ordered a pizza and left early to meet the delivery man at home. Maybe have more food or more options and we would've stayed until the 9p close.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Such a gem that's tucked away in far South Austin/Manchaca! The. Best. Cider. It's fresh, crisp and abundant here. Even a little bit of mead on tap too. We've been here during all seasons of the year and the property is always gorgeous and inviting. Staff is so knowledgeable and helpful. The kitchen is Now built in to the main tasting room. The fresh house made popcorn is absolutely awesome. This is a family friendly establishment as well and very nice of them to accommodate young children in a pretty adult setting! We are very thankful and grateful and it certainly keeps us as loyal customers.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a quick drive out to TKC on a Sunday. It was awfully hot and there was plenty of shade. We brought our dog too but he could not go inside which was challenging even for ordering. Our favorite cider is the No. 1! There was an event going on that sounded fun so we will definitely check out those options. We did not order food, just did a shared tasting. No one came outside to check on us or offer to pour and tell us about the cider which is common when visiting wineries with our dog and friends. It's a cute little spot for a weekend drive.

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: S√∫per cute romantic spot to come with your significant other or girlfriends.  The atmosphere is excellent.  They had live music on Saturday when we ran into this cute spot.  We ordered a flight of cider and had some garlic kettle corn, but regretted not getting the cheese plate because it would have been perfect with the acidity of the cider.  Zach, who served us, made our experience more memorable.  Definitely a spot to visit when in Austin.

reviews.author: Seela M.
reviews.description: This is a great place to bring out of town guests. The 9$ flight is lovely and a bargain. The grounds are beautiful and the staff friendly. You can hang out and play bird games or sit outside on picnic tables. The food is not quite  awesome yet, but decent if you want tot munch along with your cider. The ciders are dry dry dry and not gross apple soda tasting like Eastciders (barf). "Stillage" is amazing.

reviews.author: Vicktoria R.
reviews.description: Super tasty food. Drinks are tops and they have toys for kids in their outdoor area. Seating was nice and the misters keep it comfortable even in the summer heat.

reviews.author: Dayna M.
reviews.description: I recently stopped by your venue for the first time and I have to say, it was so delightful that we are planning to return as soon as we can! The cheese board was delicious but the cider was out of the world! Your staff was incredibly friendly and helpful; the customer service was very nice! Until next time!

reviews.author: Kurt A.
reviews.description: This cidery is unique in that it has the best cider in Austin per dollar.  The Cider Noir, Grafter Blanc, and Cider Weizen are all delicious.

reviews.author: Joe B.
reviews.description: I've been here four times and will keep coming back. The location itself is beautiful - plenty of outdoor space surrounded by forest and a valley. The ciders are so much better than what you find in the beer aisle at the grocery store, and they have a surprisingly large selection. During the week, this is a great place for a quiet, relaxing evening. During the weekends, especially when they are hosting a festival or band, it's a different atmosphere (but still great) - lively and fun, a good place for friends to hang out if they're tired of the usual bar scene.  The only negative preventing Texas Keeper from five stars is the new food menu. While the ciders are fairly priced, the food is anything but. We ordered a cheese and meat tray for $20 and got a platter with barely enough for one person. When we asked for more crackers, they charged us $2 more. Hopefully, this new menu is still a work in progress and they will make adjustments until it is reasonable.

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: Nancy knows. As the owner she curates great wines at affordable prices and makes them available to her friends. Everyone is her friend! This is a generous, comfortable place and the perfect spot for a leisurely afternoon of sipping.

reviews.author: Elvira A.
reviews.description: Stopped by this charming wine shop for the first time, and absolutely loved it! First of all super pet friendly, so we were off to a great start. I'm not too familiar with wine, so Nancy made a fabulous suggestion. The sparkling wine Naveran hit the spot!   The ambiance is chill, so you want to stay awhile. She has beautiful local art decorating the indoors and plenty of outdoor seating. There is also lovely music playing in the background, and just a friendly place! Will definitely make it a must visit spot on trips to Wimberley!

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: I picked this place at random when my friend and I decided to meet up near Wimberley. It had good ratings and it looked nice. It turned out to be the best decision; there was a huge event (and beautiful weather) so the heart of Wimberley was PACKED. This place is a bit outside of the main part of town and had plenty of parking, and the best part was it was not crowded. :) They've got minimal seating inside, but plenty of outdoor seating. They also have a nice selection of both beer and wine, plus some yummy snacks (like edamame and hummus!). My friend and I both opted for the wine flight: 4 tasters of wine ranging from red to white to bubbly, all great, and the staff was attentive and ready with the next pour in order to keep the cold ones cold. We had a lovely experience. I definitely recommend if you're near the area!

reviews.author: Paul V.
reviews.description: Fantastic spot in an idyllic setting.  Nancy is very entertaining as are the two other gals who run the place Lia and Katie.  The international wine selection is tops.  Beer too!  And my dog was allowed !

reviews.author: Denise M.
reviews.description: Message the owner on Monday to confirm her hours today. Only to show up and be told she closed at 6:00.  I won't be returning.

reviews.author: Christian W.
reviews.description: Wow! Was driving back down from Dripping Springs and came through Wimberley and sure am glad we did.  This little house is full of rooms and nooks that give it a very intimate feel where you and your friends and family can congregate and feel at home. The bar is loaded full of wines and the staff here isn't shy in regards to providing you with samples and information on each of them.  I don't know very much about wine, but was able to follow along and still get an enjoyable experience out of what they had to offer here. We came on a Sunday afternoon so you know I had to try the mimosa out. Crisp, clean, and refreshing!  Be prepared to shell out some $$ as this place isn't the cheapest option, but you do get a high quality and a large amount of variety which is hard to find in Texas.  Support this local business and lets keep their doors open! Spots like this are hard to come by.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: I finally made it here!! Unfortunately, the owner Nancy was on holiday break however, Dawn did not disappoint!! She not only catered to me, but also to my husband, son and his girlfriend by making us feel like family!! Dawn made a cozy fire for us to sit around and kept the ros√©, beer and Pellegrino pouring!! We couldn't ask for a better ambiance. Thank you Casa Vindemia!!

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: I notice this little wine shop in Wimberly as I walked past and fell in love with the wines from international wines from all over the world. Today I did wine tasting for six dollars a for several wine tastings plus you get a cute small wine glass for free. Delightful place to take your spouse or date.  The host is very smart about the wines they sell here and enjoyed the smooth wines tastings I received. It located downtown Wimberly so you can't miss it. I certainly will visit again soon. It does cost a few dollars more but worth the fun you have visiting such a cute cosy wine store. So stop in and see what I mean .....happy wine hunting!!!

reviews.author: Jack R.
reviews.description: A sweet little place to escape the cares of the world. Nancy chooses great wines for her customers and has both glasses and bottles available.  She also has some high quality beers and other drinks for sale. If the weather's nice enjoy your time under the oak trees outside.

reviews.author: Jeffrey R.
reviews.description: We came here for a friend's birthday party as a first stop on our party bus tour, and the wine tasting was fantastic. I highly recommmend coming here any time. The ambiance is adorable, outside seating available. The staff is very knowledgeable about all of the different wines. The tasting was lovely, and then we each had a glass of our favorite!

reviews.author: Lisa L.
reviews.description: Nancy the owner is very knowledgeable! The shop has moved from its original spot to this bright beautiful spot next to cypress creek! Small unique international wines, reasonable tasting price, and great atmosphere! Stop by and you'll be glad you did!

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: When in Wimberley you must stop by and have a tasting of CV's great selection of international wines! Nancy is a walking/talking Wine 101! Good drink and conversation!

reviews.author: Kory C.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been on many of the Bourbon Trail tours in Kentucky, so we know what a "good" tour looks like. Jason did an excellent job of showing us around the distillery, while providing great details of the distilling process. While Still Austin knows it isn't a mega distillery, it embraces that and makes the tour and experience feel personalized. We were able to sample several different whiskeys and one gin, and we even sampled a few unreleased items, which were all very good. My wife and I would recommend this tour to everyone. Thanks Still Austin for a great experience!

reviews.author: Carlson Z.
reviews.description: We booked the whiskey tour for $15 per person and had a great time on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Our tour guide was incredibly knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. I felt like I got a lot out of the tour and now have a basic grasp of how whiskey is made.   The distillery is pretty small and they currently sell bourbon and gin as their bread and butter, both of which you'll get to sample at the end of the tour. Highly recommended to check it out as it's just a fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: The best whiskey tour I have been on!   I booked a tour to surprise my boyfriend. When we arrived, the place didn't have electricity or AC due to an electrical issue in the area.   Rather than cancel, they treated us to some complementary drinks to make up for the electrical and AC issue.   The staff was very friendly, professional, and turned a bad situation into a very fun and amazing time. Couldn't have imagined it being any better!   The guide was very knowledgeable, the tour was insightful, and the tasting at the end was great! Go support this local Austin business!

reviews.author: Tony P.
reviews.description: Good austin outdoor spot. Came here for Sunday drag brunch bingo.Good time and the drag host was pretty funny and friendly. Dog friendly. Got an old fashioned for 6 bucks so that was a solid deal. Didn't get any good but it looked like a bunch of fried options which my friends seemed to enjoy. It was about 60% full on a Sunday afternoon. I will say that the music was way too loud during the bingo so that made it hard to talk. Outside of bingo, the volume was fine. Overall I'd recommend it. If not, St Elmo brewing is next door.

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a unique and cool place to taste various whiskeys, try Still Austin Whiskey Company.  The staff was fantastic and knowledgeable and we tried some of their whiskey as well as some mixed concoctions that were fabulous.  There is a great open patio area that shares space with a food truck and the Bearded Bread Company, but the winds were blowing like crazy and the temps were too cold to be outside long. Definitely try this place!  And then explore other spots in the same Industrial Park!  The artwork on the buildings is also great to tour on its own.

reviews.author: Mikhael W.
reviews.description: Our guide was pretty freaking awesome. I don't remember her name but she was a pretty red head with cool tattoos. I'm a tequila girl so I wasn't too eager to learn how gin and bourbon are made, but she really had my attention the entire time!   We were in a group of 10 which was just right. Everyone could get a few questions in if they wanted...laid back...chill...ITS AUSTIN!  Now, to the best part....and boy I was a bit disappointed. I've been on several tours in distilleries and the tasting at the end could get you about 2 shots away from tipsy. Typically there are about 4 samples....1.5-2 ounces each.....  Here....there were 2 samples with 1.5 ounces TOTAL!  I know all they do is gin and bourbon but can a SISTA have a bit more?! The tour is around $15pp, but I'd be happy to pay the standard $30-$40 for a tad bit more licka.    The gin and bourbon are still yummy!  Get a cocktail.....The old fashioned will have you stumbling!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, we decided to just stick with tasting their liquor instead of getting drinks. They don't have tasting flights, but they do have an option to order a taste of any of their liquors for $2 each. That's not bad at all. We were able to taste the whiskey and gin. The two year whiskey was the winner. I did see some yummy cocktails that I would love to try in the near future.   They have inside and outside seating. The outside patio has a cover for shade, but you do have areas where you can get sun   There's a food truck on site.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses. For those that want to make an afternoon or day out of your visit, the other businesses are all drink or food related.

reviews.author: Katie S.
reviews.description: Maybe the Bummer and Lazarus distillery on treasure island in San Francisco has bumped my taste in gin up a bit, but this place was pretty alright.  Considering they only have one gin, I think this place is still workin on it. I didn't try the whiskey so that's probably what this place hits outta the park.

reviews.author: Mark J.
reviews.description: Wow.. I have tried a number of Texas whiskeys and while they are all pretty good, they tend to have quite a bite since they don't have time to age. Still Austin has one of the smoothest Texas whiskeys I have had. They also have a nice gin. Their tap room is nice and the staff was great.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Employees are friendly and extremely knowledgeable about their products.  Knowing very little about the best ways to drink whiskey, I really appreciated the education they gave me and the ideas.  I absolutely love their Straight Bourbon Whiskey!

reviews.author: Christy B.
reviews.description: Really great atmosphere. Cute decor. They have their own made gin and bourbon and offer $2 tasters of each.

reviews.author: Malinda F.
reviews.description: Still one of our favorite outdoor hang outs!! But have to like gin or bourbon  Bearded guy food truck had awesome snacks!

reviews.author: Cynthia D.
reviews.description: Wow. This place is making some serious showstopper whiskey. Buttery and caramely and ever so lightly sweet, it's so satisfying to sip on this while listening to my vinyl collection, which I've decided is my latest "thing."  They are currently running a live music series, which is how I became aware of them -- they often do cool giveaways with samples to promote local musicians.

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the whiskey tour and the group agrees it was the best and most knowledged guide, Jason, and presentation we have seen.  Very educational despite having toured many others.   Very exciting to have Still here in Austin and the gin and whiskey's were all great.  Can't wait to try their newest creations.

reviews.author: Bethany S.
reviews.description: Still Austin is my favorite Texas bourbon, the distillery and tasting room did not disappoint. Take the tour of the distillery with Jason. He's super fun and informative. Fantastic drinks in the tasting room!

reviews.author: Rishma P.
reviews.description: This is our usual hangout spot with our friends and we love it! It's a chill spot where you can have a drink, eat great food and it's not too overcrowded. However our experience today was really disappointing and it was simply based of the service provided. I wish I got the gentleman's name because he was awesome and his drinks were well balanced. There was a female bartender who made the drinks extremely sweet and when we asked to have them remade, she was extremely rude and confrontational in her demeanor. The other male bartender took it upon himself to remake our drinks and when he tasted what she had served us, he also agreed with the taste being off. Kindness goes a long way and I wish she adopted a more graceful attitude.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Cool establishment with great product, be careful of glass containers purchased a bottle to bring home and shattered in Transportation. Not sure if it was specific to the containers they used as other bottles purchased from other distilleries did not.

reviews.author: Markeisha T.
reviews.description: This was a hidden gem. Loved the scenery. They have a food truck, everything done electronic through the QR code. Drinks were amazing you can tell they like there product.

reviews.author: Spencer S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed the tour and the opportunity to not only sample Still Austin bourbon and gin, but to try it in various mixed drinks.  Barbara is incredibly knowledgeable and enthusiastic as a tour guide and in her knowledge of the product. The home town feel of the staff coupled with the loyalty to their state and region in all of their ingredients and products is outstanding.    I highly recommend Still Austin bourbon and gin!

reviews.author: Laura A.
reviews.description: Great brunch with cocktails and phenomenal food! No food pics because we scarfed it down!  The Queen Mary cocktail will change your life.

reviews.author: April S.
reviews.description: Who knew there was such a thing as mead but the wonderful girl behind the counter helped us with choices and filled us with lots of knowledge.  My parents were staying at the cabins at onion creek right behind this place and when we stopped I saw a dog inside so I called my parents and said meet us up here and told my husband whoa we gotta pet that dog!  I enjoyed the bead as I had never had it before and loved the inside decor and how the place is set up.  Cozy if you want it, outside on the patio ( not for us since it was raining) up at the bar or in large tables.  If you're in the area its definitely a must.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I definitely recommend this tasting room!! It's right around the corner from Salt Lick and Duchman winery and definitely worth a stop!   We got a cider/mead/wine/beer flight (4 tastings, one of each).  Very cool interior design. A hidden gem- I hope you all try this place!

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: This place was ok. Didn't love it. Didn't hate it. My husband and I stopped in on a random day date through hill country on the way from Desert Door (excellent).

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Been here twice  and both times have been impressed with the variety and quality of their choices for wines and beers. Staff have been knowledgeable and friendly. Prices reasonable.  Met the owner tonight - really earnest, smart and nice guy. Only downer- Geeks who drink trivia. Absolutely despise it. Awkward format, unintelligible announcer, questions relevant only to the very young.  Won't be back for that.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Big ups to our new friend Jamie and his new place Hill country.  Very quaint place with two stories and plenty of samples for the beer drinker or wine drinker.  Your husband doesn't like wine?  No problem.   They got beer.  And plenty of it.   IPA's and Hefeweizen's will greet you at the door.   Family and pet friendly place. We will be back for sure.  Thank you for the awesome graciousness.

reviews.author: Kami C.
reviews.description: This is a great little place for wine or beer. They have a nice selection of great Texas wine and beer and the owner is a really nice guy.

reviews.author: Tracey N.
reviews.description: We are from the area and stumbled upon this gem.  The owner/bartender was outstanding and the place is out of a Pinterest page.  We bought a few bottles and hung out for a few hours.  We will be back and recommend this spot to anyone in the area.

reviews.author: Trent W.
reviews.description: Big fan of this place. Brand new building and very well cleaned and kept. We were greeted with great hospitality by our bartender. I had never tried mead before and was offered a tasting of it. We ended up having beer flights from their great selection. Perfectly located, close by to Salt Lick BBQ. Come to this place and try for yourself!

reviews.author: Cathy R.
reviews.description: We had my husband's 50th birthday party at Hill Country Tasting Room. Deepa was so helpful with coordinating all of the details. We met beforehand to plan where to place the food, decorations, and talk about special drink offerings. The staff was super friendly, went out of their way to make us feel welcome, and made it a very special night. We had a party of about 25 and the space was perfect! Would highly recommend and will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: Kevin H.
reviews.description: An oasis on RM150. Sort of in the middle of nowhere (for now), this place is a welcome sight for the people in Hill Country who like to drink. Beer, wine and mead only in a warm industrial space. The service was very accommodating, however not as knowledgeable as I had hoped, given the selection and the many questions several of us had as we tried mead for the first time. Prices seem to be a bit high considering we aren't in downtown, but it's a place we'll visit again.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: I loved the staff but they clearly don't want to pay for air conditioning!  Otherwise I would come back in a heartbeat!  Wine is great. They also offer beer, ciders and Mead!  If they don't realize that AC is important they won't be in business long!

reviews.author: Coby C.
reviews.description: Great selection of beer, wine and mead. The staff is very friendly. The environment is nice. We will be back next time we are in town. Thanks!

reviews.author: Nicole G.
reviews.description: Came out to Driftwood Tasting Room while we were on our winery "date day". We met the owner Lindsey and she was so sweet and knowledgeable. The venue is right of FM 150 in an industrial space with a great atmosphere. I highly recommend it for a date day, couples trip, or any kind of party. Locally owned and all products are sourced from Texas! Total perk -- super dog friendly!!

reviews.author: Susan D.
reviews.description: Hill Country Tasting Room is a wonderful find - I strongly recommend it! We rented out the entire venue for our rehearsal dinner, and it was absolutely perfect. We had ~50 people with an outside catered buffet dinner, and the venue was the perfect size - it still felt intimate during the speeches, but there was enough room for everyone to sit, eat, and mingle. The layout worked really well for us - for dinner, people could sit and eat on both the ground floor and mezzanine, and for speeches people mingled on the ground floor while the speeches were held on the landing. We love the atmosphere there - a combination of industrial, rustic, and chic that totally matched the vibe we were going for!  Planning was a breeze too - first Lindsey and then Deepa were both so accommodating and answered all our questions. Especially compared to some of the other venues I was talking to, Hill Country Tasting Room responded so quickly, kindly, and didn't mind when I asked a bunch of questions! I would definitely recommend them for hosting an event.  The drinks themselves were also amazing. We loved that it was all Texas beverages, and there were so many options! We were so glad to find a place that offered such a wide variety.  On the actual night of the rehearsal dinner, the bartenders were so helpful - I even got comments back from a couple of guests stating how nice they were! I can't wait until our next visit to the Dripping Springs area - we are definitely going back!

reviews.author: Joseph F.
reviews.description: Driftwood Tasting Room is tucked away in Driftwood, an oasis, but was a great stop! The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the selections they were carrying and they were able to make great recommendations based on our tastes. They have reasonable prices, they were in line with the other tasting rooms we had visited during the day. Their concept was awesome! Their selection is from local craft breweries and wineries and rotates between different companies. They also had the beverages available to take home if you found one, or more, you enjoyed.

reviews.author: E. A.
reviews.description: Two friends and I went to Driftwood Tasting Room and asked to do a wine tasting. The only employee there, Antonio, said the tasting would be $8 for four tastings. The menu had a long list of beer, mead, and cider as well as wine. We asked if we could mix and match the tastings between these drinks, and the employee said yes. We then asked, several times, if this would still be $8 for the tasting. He again said yes. When we went to pay, we discovered that our bill came out to more than twice that amount. Apparently, the tasting was not $8. He told my friends that we received full pours, and that's why it was more. Here's the thing, WE DIDNT ASK FOR FULL POURS; we asked for a tasting. The employee took it upon himself to give us the full pours, which we did not ask for and shouldn't have had to pay for. We left upset and confused as to what happened. One of my friends went back into the establishment to discuss a refund. We didn't want to all three go in and cause a scene, since the man was kind to us, we just wanted to remedy the situation. Apparently, he reexplained the full pours THAT WE DIDNT ASK FOR and then offered my friend $10 out of his pocket. She felt guilty about this and didn't ask for compensation for the other two of us that did a tasting. I repeat, tasting and not full pour. I'm not sure why he would offer us his own money instead of trying to correct the problem initially. Maybe he knew he was wrong? Or maybe he just wanted us to go away and not complain? I really don't know why he would do that. We discussed it more and felt upset about the whole situation and how it was awkwardly handled. It was a damper on what was supposed to be a nice day out. I decided to contact management through the Driftwood Tasting Room's Facebook page the next day to see if we could be fully refunded for the employee's mistake. I explained everything to the manager, Lindsey Pierce, who, of course defended the employee. I understand this, and I have nothing against the employee, but a mistake was made and I wanted it corrected. I didn't mention the $10, since it went to my friend who spoke to the employee. Apparently, this gave the manager reason to believe that I was lying. She said that my friends could contact her for a refund and I could get one after I returned the $10 cash, which I didn't even get, but ok. I mentioned how she was treating me like I was lying and like I was a criminal for complaining about what happened. Lindsey Pierce then THREATENED to take me to SMALL CLAIMS COURT for SLANDER for writing this negative review. All I tried to do was express my dissatisfaction and try to get a refund, and the manager treated me so impolitely and with such disrespect. I would never want to go to a place where the management treats a customer so rudely. There are better places down the road where the servers charge you what you expect to be charged and the managers are polite and genuinely care about your experience at the winery. I'd avoid this place at all costs simply because of how the management treated me when I tried to explain what happened.

reviews.author: Erika B.
reviews.description: Great place! Just a short, scenic drive out in Driftwood. Owners are friendly, knowledgeable, and welcoming. A great selection of local craft beer and wine that you cant find anywhere else in the area. We will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone. Must try the Oocheenama Ale or the Mads Red Wine.

reviews.author: Marcy R.
reviews.description: This place is a hidden gem and definitely a much needed place for the growing area. It has huge potential and I hope they get enough business to stay in business! I live nearby and it's a nice place to grab a drink. Beautiful interior! The glasses of wine were a little pricey compared to the nearby vineyards but everything else seemed reasonable. The guy serving my friend and I was super friendly and helpful I hope they continue to have great service. The only things I would recommend would be to maybe add a couple TVs without sound on to keep some of the guys happy should there be UT games or golf on. The bar is a beautiful spot to hang out. I'd also recommend having some nice big glass jars with some pub mix or nuts in that folks could purchase by the scoop and maybe even a cheese/meat plate or some olives. It's a great hidden gem for us who live nearby to be able to have an upscale bar with great local beer and wines. And sometimes someone in a group doesn't want wine so it's nice to have the options! Something for everyone. Hopefully eventually a food truck or some dinner pairing event would be fun. I have seen some really cool events advertised on fb but haven't had a Chance to make it in to one yet. I will add as I have two kids I wouldn't recommend this a place for kids as there isn't really an outdoor space. A great date spot or place to meet friends for a small birthday. Bonus would be to add a happy hour or special pricing for driftwood locals!!

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: What a great little spot! Small quaint tasting room with a bit of wine related retail.   Right near the square and very close to Wimberley Cafe. Very reasonable tasting price at$7 for 6 wines. You can order the dry red flight, the white flight or the sweet flight. Most all the wines from the Escondido Valley in west Texas. This is were most of the grapes are grown in Texas anyway although not widely publicized. Lost Draw Cellars and William-Chris are two of our favorites. Really enjoyed both the red and white flights. The sweet flight is VERY sweet and all about fruit. One exception is the Choco-wine. Sounds really awful- chocolate wine!? I am NOT a sweet eater and don't really like chocolate but this is a perfect combination similar to non-dairy Baileys.   So enjoyed the owner-host that helped navigate the wine. Super personable and great to talk to. We'll return here again!

reviews.author: Karol M.
reviews.description: This little shop offers tastings from various Texas and other wineries, organized by a preset menu of either whites, dry reds, or sweet wines. You pay $7 for an etched glass promoting Wimberley as a Little Taste of Heaven (well, why not?), and that includes the tasting of all the wines from the menu of your choice.  There's room for about 6 or 7 people at a time to belly up to the antique bar (standing room only), and the sommelier/host pours for each group separately, explaining each wine and its history as he/she goes.   The afternoon my friend and I were there, we both tried the dry reds, and our host was knowledgeable and entertaining. There was not a bad wine in the bunch, although we each had our separate favorites. A lot of these wines are served by the glass or bottle in the local and regional restaurants, and you can buy them here more reasonably (about $22-36/bottle for the reds we tried) without having to visit each winery. They also have an entire wall of wine-related gift items and cute bar accouterments.  Definitely a place to put on your list to stop by during an afternoon of shopping in Wimberley. Be aware that like most of the shops, they close up for the day at 5PM.

reviews.author: Carmen P.
reviews.description: We called Hill Country Wine Shoppe and spoke to Jill. We wanted to order two bottles of wine for our Aunt and Uncle to help them celebrate their 55th wedding anniversary but we live in Tucson. We had stopped in the store during our last visit and found the shoppe to be welcoming and the owners charming. We told Jill want types of wine our relatives like. She suggested two wines, included a note from us, and facilitated the delivery. Our ralatives were very pleasantly surprised and they said the wines were delicious. We highly recommend this store! Thank you Jill!

reviews.author: Cody J.
reviews.description: The old bar is beautiful and from an old Willie Nelson movie, "Red Headed Stranger." Their "dry" red wines were not dry. They were all very fruit forward compared to the traditional tasting notes of the types they are serving. It's a cheap tasting at $7, and comes with a glass that is etched with "taste of heaven" and Wimberley on it.  Now, it's more of a shop, than a winery. So, don't expect to have a few glasses, sit down, or to use a restroom. The girl that was waiting on us was very young and knew very little about wine, and seemed to care very little. That's not the best wine experience! If I came back, it would be to show my boyfriend the bar. Overall, the wine was mediocre! So, it's kind of a one time thing!

reviews.author: Kori S.
reviews.description: A tasting here is a must do while visiting Wimberley!!! Great Texas wine selection - actually the BEST! After a tasting grab you some bottles and you won't regret it. William Chris is my go-to when stopping in. The Rodeo Red Malbec and Choco Noir are also hard to beat. Happy tasting!!!

reviews.author: Ann J.
reviews.description: The best wine we had on our trip was from Hill Country Wine Shoppe!! Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of great wineries and vineyards in the vicinity but Hill Country definitely finds the best. Stop in for a casual quick tasting and be sure to get a few bottles of your favorites. You won't tend to find these in the grocery store!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Take a break from shopping and enjoy some of our Texas wines. This tasting room offers several wines from around Texas. They do have a set list. You can only choose from reds, whites or sweets. The tasting comes with a free glass. It's a cute souvenir. The lady serving us that day was very knowledgeable and even gave us a history of each wine and winery with each pour. The tasting room is small and can get crowded. There's no sitting, but it's not a bother. They do sell some cute wine associated items. I ended up leaving with wine and extras. I can see myself going back when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: Terrific service, very knowledgable staff and delicious wines.  Go and taste and get some fabulous goodies.  A must visit when in Wimberley.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Just $7 buys a glass and tastings of five wines. Extraordinarily friendly host explained each wine and all the wine regions of Texas. A few great choices, all Texas grown.

reviews.author: Laurie S.
reviews.description: We did the tasting and left there with 6 bottles.  The ladies were very knowledgeable and helped us find what we like.  I must say, I really enjoyed the Choco Noir.  Pinot Noir and chocolate....amazing.  Need I say, I enjoyed my Sunday morning coffee/hot chocolate.   Thanks ladies.  Loved the experience!!!

reviews.author: Cody E.
reviews.description: Disappointed. Not greeted when entering and helped the person who came in after my girlfriend and I. I can't rank the wine because I was never served any.   No southern charm in this swanky.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I was not impressed at all by the wine tasting here. I would recommend this place for the wine merchandise over the wine tasting/ wines. (I purchased a candle). It is a very small place with a bar that has no seating.
